And so, she is requesting a new loan of $750 to build an inventory of corn, the primary ingredient of her business. This will clearly help increase her income for supporting her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1959 au Ghana, Madame A. Félicia est une femme mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) domestiques à charge. Son mari est en chômage depuis trois ans, alors elle s’occupe en grande partie des charges familiales. Cela n’est possible que grâce à son activité de préparation et de vente de « ablo », un met à base de maïs très apprécié dans toutes les contrées du Togo. A deux reprises elle a bénéficié de prêts, ce qui lui a permis d’augmenter ses activités avec des commandes sans cesse croissantes de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus importante, surtout les week-end, jours des fêtes et occasions de mariage ou de funérailles. Or, les moyens actuels de Félicia ne lui permettent pas de répondre aux demandes de ses clients. La recherche de nouveaux financements s’avère nécessaire.

Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 pour lui permettre de constituer un stock de maïs, la matière première de bas de son activité. Ceci contribuera évidemment à l’augmentation de ses revenus pour les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy corn and make ablo.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vic is 27 years old and a mother of two. She began her trading activities approximately 5 years ago shortly after junior school. She sells both rubber and leather footwear. She participated in the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN in September, 2006. Currently, she is negotiating with a major supplier to provide regular supply of the goods. She therefore expects to be assisted with the loan from KIVA to increase the capital base.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en:
Kokouvi A. was born in 1980 in Kouvé (Yoto prefecture). He is a very devoted and intelligent young man. Born of polygamy, where the women and their children are left to fend for themselves, he left school to start a business selling tomatoes at the marketplace. Two years later with a developed business, he got married and had two children, plus he is the guardian of one other child. His wife helps him at work. With an initial loan, which he has repaid, he was able to expand his business a little.

Today, Mr. A. would like to become a wholesaler. To do this, he is requesting a loan of $850 to stock up on and to sell other produce from farming villages, in addition to tomatoes. The produce will include red and green peppers, eggplant, and onions. He will thus be able to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokouvi est né en 1980 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto. C’est un jeune homme très dévoué et très intelligent. Issu d’une famille polygame où les femmes sont laissées à elles mêmes avec leurs enfants, il abandonna ses études et se lance dans le commerce des tomates au marché. Deux ans après, vu l’évolution de son activité, il s’est marié et père de deux (02) enfants et un (01) autre enfant à charge. Sa femme l’aide dans son activité. Avec un premier crédit qui a été bien soldé, il a pu augmenter un peu la taille de son commerce.

Aujourd’hui, Monsieur A. veut devenir grossiste et pour cela il sollicite un crédit de $850 pour aller s’approvisionner dans les villages de production et ajouter à la vente de tomate d’autres condiments comme piments rouges et verts, aubergines, oignons etc. Ainsi il pourra accroître son revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To sell grocery produce items.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Bekie is 27 years old and a mother of two. She sells her goods in front of the family house. Some of the items include canned foods, biscuits, confectionary and some stationary. This happens to be a family business and she is running it now. She took part in the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN in September, 2006. She needs the KIVA loan to be able to grow the business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Born in Lomé on February 1, 1935, Massan A. is married and the mother of four. Ever since her husband retired, she has continued all by herself to deal with household expenses by selling ice cubes, ice water, and fruit juice. This business has gotten big due to the strong demand in her neighborhood, particularly during the dry season when the heat is excessive and people consume a good deal of her beverages to refresh themselves.

Unfortunately, her production capacity is insufficient to meet the demands of the customers in her area. Ms. A. is requesting financial support in the amount of $1,000 to acquire another, bigger freezer. This new loan will make a major difference for her business and the life of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 1er Février 1935 à Lomé, Madame A. Massan est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Depuis que son mari est admis à la retraite, c’est elle qui continue seule à faire face aux charges du ménage par la vente de glaçons, d’eau glacée et de jus de fruits. Cette activité a pris une ampleur importante à cause de la forte demande qui existe dans le quartier particulièrement pendant les saisons sèches où la chaleur est excessive et où les populations en consomment assez pour se rafraîchir.

Malheureusement sa capacité de production ne permet plus de satisfaire sa clientèle du quartier. Madame A. Massan sollicite un appui financier de $1000 pour acquérir un autre congélateur plus grand. Ce nouveau financement aura des retombées financières très importantes sur son activité et dans la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy freezers

loans.name: Zalyia

texts.en: Zalyia is 53 years old. She has 7 children who are all alive and schooling.  She has been selling \'Waakye\'(rice and beans cooked together and served with stew) over the past 20 years. With increase in population size in the community, demand for her services has gone up considerably. As a beneficiary of the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN, she is now in a position to assess a KIVA loan to increase the capital base.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ema Saa

texts.en: Ema is a single mother with 6 children to cater for. She is 52 years and owner of a popular fast food joint in her community. The business has been in operation for 6 years now. Having used a greater part of her capital to upgrade the joint to the level required by city authorities, the finances are low. She would therefore like KIVA to assist her with the loan to recapitalize her operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ablossi

texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Tsévié (Zio prefecture), Ablossi A. is married to a shoe-maker and is the mother of two. She also takes care of two other children. She spent her entire childhood in her father’s chicken coop. She helps her mother to sell poultry at the marketplace. After getting married, she got involved in this business -- which is booming especially during holidays -- in order to help with family expenses. Faced with the increase in market demand, she obtained two loans successively that she has repaid in good standing.

A very energetic and ambitious woman, she has decided to build up a substantial inventory by buying chickens and other poultry from her village and from surrounding areas. In this way, she can limit her travel expenses each week. Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $800 to expand her business and to augment her income, in order to raise her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Tsévié (P/Zio), Madame A. Ablossi est mariée à un cordonnier et mère de deux enfants et à sa charge deux (02) autres enfants. Elle a passé toute son enfance dans le poulailler de son père et aide sa mère à vendre les volailles au marché. Une fois mariée, elle se lance dans ce commerce très florissant surtout en période de fête pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Ainsi, face à la croissance de la demande sur le marché, elle obtient successivement deux crédits qu’elle a très bien remboursés.

Très dynamique et ambitieuse, elle décide d’aller acheter les poulets et autres volailles dans son village et ses alentours et en faire un stock consistant afin de limiter les frais de déplacement chaque semaine. Madame A. Ablossi sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui permettre d’accroître et d’augmenter son revenu afin d’élever le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire poultry to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joe is 41 years old and a father of three. He began his shoe business some 10 years ago with money borrowed from friends and family members.  Due to the repayment of the money over a relative short period he found it difficult to increase the stock levels. In spite of this the market is very encouraging. As a recent beneficiary of the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN, he would want to obtain a KIVA loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sodéhoé

texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1955, Sodéhoé A. is married and the mother of five. She spends all her days assisting her unemployed husband in educating their children. She has been doing this by selling various goods and by making and selling Akassan (or Akpan) balls, which are steamed balls of fermented corn mush wrapped in leaves. By obtaining an initial loan, which was repaid in due course, she was able to start this business.

A very energetic and active woman, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $550 to stock up on corn, the main ingredient in her product, in order to meet the continuously growing demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1955 à Lomé, Madame A. Sodéhoé est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Elle a passé toute sa vie à épauler son mari sans emploi dans l’éducation des enfants à travers son activité de vente de produits divers et de préparation et la vente de la boule d’Akassan (Akpan) à base de maïs. Avec son premier crédit qui a été bien soldé, elle a pu relancer son activité.

Très dynamique et active, elle sollicite un appui financier de $550 pour constituer un stock de maïs, matière première de base de son activité afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Making and selling Akassan balls

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is 50 years old and a mother of two. She operates a gift/jewelry shop in the Central Business District of the city. In addition, she retails also imported perfumes. Owing to the shop\'s location, she enjoys a high patronage from the public .She has gone through the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN and is poised to seek KIVA\'s assistance to capitalize her operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Aidan

texts.en: Aidan H. is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and his baby boy in the town of Tzar Kaloian near Razgrad. Aidan is a crane – operator by profession and works in a construction company. For 4 years Aidan has a parallel business. He breeds some calves in a private farm shed in the town. Now Aidan breeds 7 calves each of them about 250 – 300 kilos. He needs this $ 1 200 loan to supply enough fodder for the winter months.

loans.use: To supply enough fodder for the winter months

loans.name: Sali

texts.en: Sali S. lives in Tzar Kaloian, near Razgrad and as most of men in the town works as a constructor. Eight years ago he starts his parallel farming business when he rents a cow shed and starts to breed three cows. Now there are 12 cows in his farm. Sali continues his work as a constructor ad he has hired a worker to take care of his cows. The loan amount thet he applies for is $ 1200 and the loan aid is to buy two more cows.

loans.use: To buy two more cows

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed S. is 30 years old and has a farming business since 2004. Now he tills 60 decares own and rented land. He grows tobacco and savory. He sells tobacco to the cigarette factory in Isperih and savory to flavoring trading companies in the region. Ahmed needs this $ 1200 loan to make repairs on the place where he dries the tobacco.

loans.use: To make repairs on the place where he dries the tobacco

loans.name: Servet

texts.en: Servet M. and his wife Nigiar run their agricultural business for 6 years. They till 400 decares land on which they grow tobacco, common balm, squashes.  Before this they have had a cow farm but economic reason made them close it and start with agriculture. Now their business is doing well. Sometimes during the season they hire more than 20 workers. Servet M. and his wife need $ 1200 to supply seedlings and fertilizer for their farm.

loans.use: To supply seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Oktai

texts.en: Oktai D. is 24 years old. He graduated computer sciences in university. Being a student he starts to work in several IT companies. This gives him professional experience and financial support to finish his education. After graduation he hounds a computer shop in his native town Tzar Kaloyan, near Razgrad. This is the only computer shop in the town. Oktai D. will use this $ 1200 loan to make an additional supplement of his shop.

loans.use: To make an additional supplement of his shop

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan A. is 36 years old. After he worked for many years as a constructor in the country and abroad he decided to start own farming business and together wit his brother started to breed cows. At the beginning there are only three cows in their farm but each year they increased the number and now Hasan and his brother has a modern cow farm with 50 cows and 15 calves and at the same time cultivate 130 decares land. Hasan A. need this $ 1 200 for seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: For seedlings

loans.name: Stoicho

texts.en: Stoicho V. is 39 years old. He is divorced and lives in Razgrad. He is funning his vegetable producing business for 8 years. Stoicho tills 30 decares land on which he grows tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, onion, garlic and others. All production is being sold on two stand on the cooperative market in Razgrad. During the season Stoicho hires some workers who help him in his vegetable garden. Stoicho V. applies for this $ 1200 loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Nezat

texts.en: Nezat H. is 39 years old. She is in retail business for 9 years. Nizat has a knitwear and ready made clothes shop on the cooperative market of Razgrad. She is running her business alone and yet alone she supplies her shop from wholesale stores in Ruse and Dimitrovgrad. She is famous as an honest and well mannered trader and thus she has a great number of customers. The loan of $ 900 she applies for is going to be used for working capital.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif I. is a big landowner from Razgrad. He tills over 2 000 decares land. Arif grows 1200 decares wheat and 800 decares corn and sunflower. All production is being sold on market. He has all necessary technical equipment for his farming business and now needs $ 1200 to make repairs on one of his harvester machines.

loans.use: To make repairs on one of his harvester machines

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en: Valentin D. is 34 years old. He is married and has one kid. He is in apiarian business for 7 years. Valentin has 50 hives on two different bee yards near the city. He is a specialist not only in honey producing but also is well known as one of the best bee breeder in the region. Valentin D. needs this $ 1200 loan to buy five more bee hives.

loans.use: To buy five more bee hives

loans.name: Sasho

texts.en: Sashio Ivanov is 63 years old, married, with two children and four grandchildren. He has been breeding cows for over ten years now. Presently he breeds 9 cows and 2 calves in an own cowshed in his native village near Razgrad. All members of the Sashio’s family are occupied with this business. The loan amount is $ 1200 and the aim is to buy two more cows.

loans.use: To buy two more cows

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en: Sabri I. is 50 years old and lives with his wife in the village of Jastrebovo, near Razgrad. Sabri and his wife keep the only grocery store in the village. They keep this store for three years. Before that they had a chicken farm for over 35 000 chickens in the village but it was hard for the family to keep it so they had to close and to reorganize their business. Now they need an $ 800 loan to buy new electronic scales for their grocery store.

loans.use: To buy new electronic scales

loans.name: Emil

texts.en: Emil K. has been a military man for more than 20 years. After the reorganization of the Bulgarian army He was dismissed and the only way to look after his family was to start own business. Three years ago there was an auction for the old store building in Emil’s native village. So he got the contract and made this building a nice grocery store – the only one in the village. Now it is his business and he runs it with the support of his wife. Emil K. needs some financial help to supply some goods for his store. The amount is $ 120.

loans.use: To supply some goods for his store

loans.name: Rujdi

texts.en: Rujdi M. is 41 years old and lives with her wife Sevinch in the town of Tzar Kaloian, near Razgrad. Two years ago they started this cow breeding business. They owned a contract for a part of latest state cowshed in the town and started to breed cows. Now they have fifteen cows and five calves and get 20 litres milk daily. Milk is sold to a milk company in Shumen. The loan they apply for will be used for a special milk container. Loan amount is $ 1000.

loans.use: For a special milk container

loans.name: Mehmed

texts.en: Mehmed A. tills over 2 000 decares own and rented land in Razgrad region. He is 56 years old and has two sons. Mehmed grows tobacco, wheat, barley, corn and other grain crops. He also possess al the necessary equipment to till his land. The loan of $ 1200 he applies for will be used to supply fuel fir his machines.

loans.use: To supply fuel fir his machines

loans.name: Mehmed

texts.en: Mehmed A. is 54 years old. He lives with his family in the village of Jasenetz, Razgrad region. Mehmed has won business for over 10 years. First he kept a grocery store in the village and had it for 7 years. But three years ago he closed the store and made it a workshop for primary treatment of walnuts. He buys up walnuts, shells them and imports kernels. Now Mehmed A. wants to buy a cracking machine and needs $ 1200 loan.

loans.use: To buy a cracking machine

loans.name: Leven

texts.en: Leven K. has seven children and seven grandchildren. He and his large family live in the village of Strajetz, Razgrad region. Leven is in farming business for 15 years. This business is the only source of income for him to take care of his family. Now Leven K. breeds 15 cows and 7 calves and all the family is occupied with this business. Leven needs $ 1200 to supply fodder for his cows during the winter

loans.use: To supply fodder

loans.name: Yazgul

texts.en:
Yazgul was born in 1975. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar region, settled in Absheron region. 
This single girl borrowed a loan of $400 and bought sugar, tea and etc.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to be busy with sale of manufactured goods (light industry).
She has been engaged in this business for 7 years.

loans.use: To start selling of manufactured goods (light industry)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restock the restaurant and buy a new bicycle for transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock different varieties of newspaper and magazines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restock the business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana Fast foods is a joint operated by Diana Q. and patronized by a lot of clients within the area Diana operates. She is has been a long standing client of Kraban and has participated in the TEACH lending skills program. She needs a loan amount of $1050 to expand her activities.

loans.use: Micro Wave Oven

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort would like to expand her animal rearing business. She has 25 grass cutters, a local animal which is used as delicacy and rich in protein source. Comfort has been trained in animal rearing based on KRABAN TEACH program. She wants a KIVA loan amount of $1000 to build a new animal coop and to increase the animal she keeps.

loans.use: Animal Coop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: A 46 year old mother of one, Theresa sells her goods in the in the Central Business District of the city. She has been in the business for the past 7 years and procures her stock in bulk from Accra, the capital city. Suppliers in her trade demand advance deposit from them in order to supply goods. As a beneficiary of KRABAN\'S TEACH learning sessions, she is sourcing KIVA\'s assistance to increase her market share.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is the owner of the Rasco Hotel, a renowned hotel within the hospitality industry in Madina, Accra.  Raphael therefore contacted KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION and willingly participated in the TEACH lending program. The hotel lacks an internal communication system which would allow clients to send and receive messages while staying there.  Raphael is planning to install a PABX system in the hotel to address this problem.

loans.use: PABX (Internal Communication)for the Hotel

loans.name: Fransisco

texts.en:
Francisco lives in the city of Villa de Garcia located in the State of Nuevo Leon. He is married and has two children. Some time ago he decided to set up his own automotive paint and detailing shop; prior to this he worked for an automotive company but his salary was not enough to cover the cost of his children’s tuition fees. With his business, Francisco has been able to provide his children with an education. His dream is to see his kids successfully finish their education and therefore ensure an opportunity for them for a better future.

One of his children is now helping him out in the shop, and with his help and with the support of the rest of his family Francisco has struggled to come out on top. But now he needs a loan of $650 for the purchase of paint and other materials and so to be able to offer a better variety of colors and services to his clients, and further earning more clients. He and his family need your support. Do not leave them alone. They sincerely thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco vive en la localidad de Villa de García, ubicada en el Estado de Nuevo León, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Hace tiempo que el decidió poner su propio taller de enderezado y pintura, pues anteriormente era empleado de una empresa automotriz, pero no completaba con el sueldo que ganaba, ya que sus hijos se encuentran estudiando y no completaba para las colegiaturas. Con esta actividad Francisco ha podido brindarle a sus hijos lo que requieren para su educación, el principal sueño de el es ver a sus hijos terminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios y de esta manera poder brindarles la oportunidad de un mejor futuro.

Ahora su hijo ya es ayudante del taller, con su apoyo y el de el resto de la familia, Francisco ha luchado para salir adelante, pero el ahora necesita de un crédito de $650 DLLS para poder comparar pintura y material y de esta manera ofrecer una mayor variedad de colores y un mejor servicio, obteniendo así más clientes. El y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo, no los dejes solos, ellos agradecen tu ayuda sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is 45 years old and has four children. She uses the front part of the family house as her store. The goods in her store include canned foods (tomato paste, milk and oils), rice, beans and maize. She has been selling these items for the past 6 years. After going through the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN, she increased her sales by 40% at the close of last year. She seeks the funding from KIVA to strengthen her capital base.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
In the city of Villa de Garcia, Nuevo Leon lives Maria Isabel with her two children and her husband. She sells hamburgers from her home and has been doing so ever since she moved to there. She started her business not only to earn extra income but also this allowed her to take care of her kids herself, that are still very young. A company employs her husband but his salary is not enough to cover the mortgage payments on their home among other expenses. Since Maria Isabel started selling hamburgers they have been better able to cover their expenses.

Her devotion to her husband and the love for her family has permitted Maria Isabel to struggle day after day, putting her family first and helping her husband. She now needs a loan of $250 to purchase ingredients and utensils that she uses to make her product. Show your generosity. You have the ability to help her. Do not doubt it any longer. The decision is in your hands. They will thankful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la comunidad de Villa de García, Nuevo León, vive Maria Isabel con sus dos hijos y su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas en su propio domicilio desde que llegó a la colonia donde vive, comenzó con esta actividad porque además de generarle ingresos extras, al mismo tiempo le permitía cuidar ella misma a sus hijos, quienes son muy pequeñitos aún. Su esposo es empleado de una empresa y con su sueldo no completaban para hacer los pagos de la casa que están pagando aún y los otros gastos, desde que María Isabel comenzó con la venta de hamburguesas pueden cubrir mejor sus gastos.

El compromiso con su esposo y el amor a su familia ha hecho que María Isabel luche día a día para sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar a su marido. Ella necesita ahora de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar insumos e utensilios que utiliza para producir su producto. Muestra tu generosidad, tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudarla, no lo dudes más, la decisión esta en tus manos, ellos te lo vana agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.en:
Sandra is a mother of two littles ones and is married. Her husband is a waiter for special events, and so his job is occasional and his salary is not unstable. With the sitaution at hand and in order to ensure the well-being of her family, Sandra looked for a business that would permit her to incur extra earnings. This is how she started selling snacks from her own home, and that being the case she was able to take care of her home and her children as well. A sense of responsibility and her enthusiasm have always been part of her and thanks to her business she can now cover for all the basic necessities of her children.

Today Sandra requires a loan of $375 to purchase more merchandise and a table to display her products. She plans to cover the full amount of the loan in a term of 5 - 10 months approximately. You can be an important part of the wellbeing of Sandra and her family. Help them to grow and above all, help them to have a more steady income. They thank you and appreciate your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra es madre de dos pequeños y esta casada, su esposo es mesero en eventos sociales, por lo que su trabajo es eventual y su salario no es fijo ni seguro. Ante esta situación y para asegurar el bienestar de su familia, Sandra buscó una actividad que le permitiera obtener ingresos extras, es por ello que hace tiempo comenzó a vender frituras en su propio hogar, de esta manera no descuidaba su casa y a sus hijos. La responsabilidad y el entusiasmo siempre han estado presentes en ella y gracias a su proyecto ahora puede cubrir todas las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.

En este momento Sandra requiere de un préstamo de $375 DLLS, para poder comprar más mercancía y una mesa para mostrar sus productos. Ella planea cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un plazo de 5-10 meses aproximadamente. Tú puedes ser parte importante del bienestar de Sandra y su familia, ayúdalos a crecer y sobre todo ayúdalos y tener ingresos más seguros. Ellos agradecen y aprecian tu generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena lives in the city of VilL. D. Garcia, in the State of Nuevo Leon. She is married and has two children of 5 and 3 years of age. Ever since she was still single she has been involved in sales by catalogue for home products, and to date she still maintains her business as it is quite profitable. Her youngest daughter is sick with asthma and the treatments are very expensive. Her husband\'s salary is not enough to cover these costs and those of their house in which they live. Maria Magdalena works very hard for her daughter\'s health and she now requires a loan of $250 to be able to add variety to her merchandise and increase her sales.

She plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a term of 3 to 6 months. You can help Magdalena to pay for her daugher\'s treatment. Do not leave her alone. Your generosity is of great help. The decision is in your hands, do not doubt it any longer and help them. Magdalena\'s family will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Magdalena vive en L. localidad D. VilL. D. García, en el estado D. nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos hijos D. 5 y 3 años D. edad. ElL. desD. que era soltera se dedica a L. venta por catálogo D. artículos para el hogar y hasta L. fecha continua con esta actividad, pues es bastante rentable. Su hija más pequeñita esta enferma D. asma y los tratamientos son muy caros, por lo que con el sueldo D. su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir esos gastos además que continúan pagando L. casa en L. que viven. María Magdalena trabaja muy duro por L. salud D. su hija y ahora elL. requiere D. un préstamo D. $250 DLLS para poder surtir más mercancía e incrementar sus ventas.

ElL. planea cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un periodo D. 3 a 6 meses. Tu puedes ayudar a Magdalena a costear el tratamiento D. su niña, no L. dejes soL., tu generosidad es D. mucho apoyo, L. decisión esta en tus manos, no lo duD. más y apóyalos. L. familia D. Magdalena te lo va agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is mother of three daughters, is married and lives in the city of Villa de Garcia in the State of Nuevo Leon. The necessities of the home have been greater each time and seeing as her husband\'s income was not enough she decided to start a new business, a grocery store. Until today she still manages the business and with the active support of her two adult daughtre she has been able to make a success of her business.

Now Maria Luisa requires a loan in the amount of $200 which she will use to add variety to her merchandise and be able to offer a better selection, thus attracting more clients and increasing her earnings. You can help her to go on, and above all, expand her business. It is the major source of income for the family. Decide and help her. She and her family need you. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luisa es madre de 3 hijas, es casada y vive en Villa de García, en el estado de Nuevo León. Las necesidades del hogar cada vez eran mayores y al ver con el sueldo de su esposo no se completaba ella decidió emprender un nuevo proyecto, una tienda de abarrotes. Hasta la fecha continua y con el apoyo activo de sus dos hijas mayores ha podido salir adelante con el negocio.

En estos momentos María Luisa requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para surtir más mercancía y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad, atrayendo así más cliente e incrementando sus ingresos. Tú puedes ayudarla a continuar y sobre todo hacer crecer su negocio, pues es la principal fuente de recursos que posee su familia, decídete y apóyala, ella y su familia te necesitan, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elvia Guadalupe

texts.en:
Miss Elvia lives in the city of Villa de Garcia. Some time ago she suffered the loss of her husband and she was left solely in charge of her children. In face of this difficult situation she started to make and sell cakes. This business is the only source of income in their household and through this business they cover their expenses, bills, tuition, everything. Miss Elvia works very hard to give everything her children need and her love for them is what has been keeping her going and what has allowed her to continue despite the circumstances.

She now requires a loan in the amount of $925 that she will use to purchase an industrial mixer. Currently she uses a manual mixer and it is no longer useful enough for her, to cover all the orders she receives. Help her increase her sales. You have the ability to support her. Do not leave her alone. She and her children will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Elvia vive en la localidad de Villa de García. Hace tiempo que sufrió la perdida de su esposo y se quedo totalmente a cargo de sus hijos, ante esta difícil situación ella comenzó a elaborar pasteles para luego venderlos. Esta es la única actividad que genera ingresos en la casa, y con ello se tienen que cubrir los gastos, los servicios, las colegiaturas, todo. Doña Elvia trabaja muy duro para poder darles todo lo que necesitan a sus hijos y el amor a ellos es lo que la mantiene de pie y lo que le permitió continuar a pesar de las circunstancias.

Ella requiere ahora de un préstamo por la cantidad de $925 DLLS mismos que utilizará para la compra de una batidora industrial, pues actualmente posee un manual y con esta no le es suficiente y no alcanza a cubrir todos los pedidos que ella quisiera. Ayúdala a incrementar sus ventas, tu tienes la posibilidad de apoyarla, no la dejes sola, ella sus hijos te lo van a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase industrial blender

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.en:
Miss Mary is a very hard working woman. Since some time ago her husband had to leave to the United States in search of better opportunities after he was left unemployed and was given no other alternative. Following this situation she felt vulnerable because she was left alone with her 4 small children. It was then that she decided to make and sell tamales and in this manner secure an income. Thanks to this business Miss Mary and her children have a more secure well being.

Now she needs a loan of $925 to purchase ingredients and untensils to make tamales. She plans to repay the full amount of the loan in a term of 6-12 months. Help her. She and her children need you and they sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mary es una mujer muy trabajadora, hace tiempo que su esposo tuvo que irse a Estados Unidos en busca de mejores oportunidades ya que se quedó sin empleo y no le quedó otra alternativa. Tras esta situación ella se sentía desprotegida, pues se quedó sola con sus 4 hijos pequeños, entonces fue cuando decidió comenzar a elaborar y vender tamales y así poder asegurar ingresos. Gracias a esta actividad Doña Mary y sus hijos tienen un bienestar más seguro.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $925 para poder comprar insumos y utencilio para producir los tamales, ella planea regresar el monto total del crédito en un plazo de 6-12 mese. Apóyala, ella y sus hijos te necesitan y te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Miss Francisca lives with her husband in the city of Villa de Garcia in the State of Nuevo Leon. They live alone as their children are already married. They don\'t receive any support from them which is why Miss Francisca decided some time ago to start a small grocery store. Her husband is unemployed and they live from the sales of the store. Now the two of them work at the business and they work a great deal every day as it is their only source of income to live on. Together they have been able to make it on their own, that of course came about with much effort and patience.

She now needs a loan of $475 that she will use to purchase merchandise to be able to provide more variety to her clients and therefore expand the business and increase her sales. You can, with your generosity, support Francisca and her husband. Do not doubt any longer. The decision is in your hands. Remember, they need your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Francisca vive con su esposo en la localidad de Villa de García, en el estado de Nuevo León. Ellos viven solos, sus hijos ya están casados y no reciben apoyo de ellos, por lo que hace tiempo Doña Francisca decidió poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para que les permitiera vivir de las ventas, ya que su esposo se quedó sin empleo. Ahora los dos atienden su negocio y trabajan mucho todos los días ya que es su única fuente de ingresos y de ahí viven. Juntos han logrado salir adelante solos, claro con mucho esfuerzo y paciencia.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismo que utilizará para comprar mercancía y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y con esto lograr crecer, obteniendo mayores ingresos. Tu puedes, con tu generosidad, apoyar a Francisca y a su esposo, no lo dudes más, la decisión esta en tus manos, recuerda que ellos necesitan de tu apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alba Nibia

texts.en:
Alba lives in the city of Cadereyta in the State of Nuevo Leon. She is married and she has one small child. Some time ago her husband was let go from the company where he worked and they went through some difficult times. For this reason Alba had the idea to start her own busines and started a small grocery store with the money they had given her husband for his retirement. Arduous work has been the factor that has permitted Alba and her husband to give their son what he needs despite the adverisities they faced.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $250to be able to keep up and slowly grow the busines. This amount will be invested in merchandise to have a better variety in her store and thus increase her sales. Help Alba and her family. They are in need of your generosity. Do no doubt it any longer. Decide and support them.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Alba vive en la localidad de Cadereyta, en el estado de Nuevo león, es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, hace tiempo que despidieron a su esposo de la empresa para la que trabajaba, y estaban pasando por momentos muy difíciles. Fue por ello que Alba tuvo la idea de iniciar su propio negocio y puso una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, con el dinero que le habían dado a su esposo por el retiro. El trabajo arduo ha sido la constante que ha permitido que Alba y su esposo puedan darle su hijo lo que necesita a pesar de las adversidades.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para poder seguir y crecer poco apoco, con esta cantidad invertirá en mercancía para tener más surtida la tienda e incrementar sus ventas. Ayuda a Alba y su familia, ellos necesitan de tu generosidad, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
In the community of Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon, lives Miss Lorenza. It has been 10 years since she started her business selling tacos and snacks. She and her husband have never had a formal job. They have always been self-employed in the sales business. Her husband has a grocery store for a long time and they have been able to survive many important changes in their lives thanks to this business. They do not receive very much support from their children so they have had to struggle alone ever since they went out to get married. But with hard work and effort they have made it.

Now Miss Lorenza requires a loan of $925 to invest in ingredients and utensils that she uses to prepare her foods. This way she will be able to increase her sales. She plans to repay the full amount of this loan in a term of 6-12 months. You can contribute to their cause. You only need to decide. Don\'t doubt any longer. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la comunidad de Cadereyta, Nuevo León, vive Doña Lorenza, quien tiene más de 10 años de haber iniciado su negocio de venta de tacos y comidas. Ella y su esposo nunca han tenido un empleo formal, siempre han desempeñado trabajos por cuenta propia en lo que se refiere el comercio. Su esposo tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo y siempre han logrado sobrevivir ha varios cambios importantes que has tenido que vivir gracias a este negocio. Pues ellos no reciben mucho apoyo de sus hijos, por lo que han tenido que luchar solos desde que ellos se casaron y con trabajo y esfuerzo lo han logrado.

Ahora, Doña Lorenza, requiere de un préstamo de $925 DLLD, para poder invertir en insumos y utensilios con los que prepara los alimentos, de esta manera va a poder incrementar sus ventas. Ella planea regresar el monto total del crédito en un periodo de 6-12 meses. Tu puedes contribuir a esta causa, solo hace falta que te decidas, no lo dudes más, ella agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Mister Chuy, as he he is known by his neighbours in the city of Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon, is an honest and hardworking person. He is married and has two children. He is originally from Veracruz and has been living 25 years in his current home. Many years ago he purchased a car so that he can be a taxi driver, but he had an accident and he needs money to be able to repair the car. His business is the only source of income and they depend solely on this for the upkeep for their home.

For these reasons he is now asked for $250 to be able to continue with his business. He plans to repay this amount in a term of 3 months. You can help him ensure the well being of his family. He needs you and he thanks you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Chuy, así es como lo conocen sus vecinos de la localidad de Cadereyta, Nuevo León, es un persona honesta y trabajadora, esta casado y tiene dos hijos. El es originario de Veracruz y tiene 25 años viviendo en su actual domicilio. Desde hace muchos años el compro un carro para dedicarse a ser taxista, pero tuvo un accidente y necesita dinero para poder repara el auto, ya que la actividad que el realiza es la única fuente de ingresos y de ello depende únicamente el sostenimiento del hogar.

Es por ellos que solicita un préstamo de 250 DLLS y así poder continuar con su actividad, el planea regresar la cantidad en un periodo de 3 meses. Tu puedes ayudarlo a asegurar el bienestar de su familia, el te necesitan y te lo va agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: Repair car

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.en:
Maria Antonia lives in the city of Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon. She is married, her husband is a worker in a bottle factory, and they have one small child. They have just started their life together and they recently acquired a small house. Her husband\'s salary is not enough to coveyr the household costs, not even the mortgage payments. This is why she started, some time ago, her new business: the sale of hamburgers from her own home.

With a great deal of effort they have been able to make it, but Maria Antonia needs a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase ingredients to make her product. She plans on repaying the full sum of the loan in a term of 3 months. You can, with your generosity, support her and her family. Do not doubt it any longer - they are grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Antonia vive en la localidad de Cadereyta, Nuevo León, ella esta casada y su esposo es obrero de una embotelladora y tienen un hijo pequeño. Ellos acaban de iniciar una vida juntos y acaban de adquirir una pequeña casa. El sueldo de su esposo no alcanza a cubrir los gastos de la casa, ni los pagos de la casa, es por eso que ella hace tiempo decidió comenzar un nuevo proyecto, la venta de hamburguesas en su propio domicilio.

Con mucho esfuerzo ellos han logrado salir adelante, pero María Antonia necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $100 para poder comprar insumos para preparar su producto, ella planea regresar el monto total del crédito en un periodo de 3 meses. Tú con tu generosidad puedes apoyarla a ella y su familia, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ursula Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ursula is married and her husband works as a laborer in a factory. They have two small children of 5 and 8 years of age. With his salary they cannot afford their expenses, which is why she sarted a new business some time ago. She started a new business to generate an extra income. She sells books and encyclopedias. Through this she has been able to help her husband. But today she has a very small stock of merchandise which is why her sales have been declining and her earnings are small.

For all these reasons she requires a loan of $250 which she will invest in the purchase of books and encyclopedias, so as to recover her sales. You can contribute in an important way to the wellbeing of Ursula and her family. Help her continue on in her business. She thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ursula esta casad y su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica y tienen dos hijos pequeños de 5 y 8 años de edad, pero con el sueldo de él no pueden solventar los gastos, por esta razón, hace tiempo que ella comenzó con una nueva actividad que le genera ingresos extras, se dedica a la venta de libros y enciclopedias. Con esto ella ha podido ayudar a su esposo. Sin embargo actualmente tiene muy poca mercancía en existencia, es por ello que están bajando mucho sus ventas y esta ganando muy poco.

Es por todo esto que ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 dólares, mismos que invertirá en la comprar de libros y enciclopedias para poder recuperar sus ventas. Tú puedes contribuir de manera importante al bienestar de Ursula y su familia, ayúdala a continuar con su proyecto, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bellanira

texts.en:
Bellanira is a very responsible woman and she busies herself with the sale of diapers. She started her business one year ago and she has seen good success. She is married and her husband works in a factory, earning minimum wage, which is why they have had many problems to be able to cover all their expenses. But thanks to Bellanira\'s business they have been able to overcome many financial obstacles. The busines has been growing with the effort and support of the family. But at this time she requires a capital ans she has some large orders and she cannot fill due to a lack of funds.

For this reason she needs a loan in the amount of $250 that she plans to repay in a term of 3 to 6 months. You can support her. She will thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Bellanira es una persona muy responsable y se dedica a vender pañales desde hace un año y ha logrado muy buenos resultados con esta actividad. Es casada y su esposo trabaja en una fábrica, ganando el salario mínimo, por lo que han tenido muchos problemas para poder solventar todos los gastos, pero gracias a la actividad de Bellanira han podido superar muchos obstáculos económicos. El negocio ha ido creciendo con esfuerzo y apoyo de la familia, pero en estos momentos ella requiere de capital, pues tienes unos pedidos muy fuertes que no puede cubrir por falta de dinero.

Es por lo anterior que necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un periodo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes apoyarla, ella te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paualina is a very active person and she is searching for a better quality of life for her family. Her husband is an upholsterer working for a company. His salary is poor and it is not enough to give his children what they need, such as an education. For this reason she contributes and supports her household with the business she started some time ago, the sale of shoes by catalogue. Paulina has struggled a great deal for the sake of her family, moved by the great love she feels for them and always motivated by teh support that they give her.

She now needs a loan of $200 to invest in merchandise and increase her income, that is very much needed in their home. You can help Pualina keep moving forward and and in turn she can help support her family. Your generosirty is of great help to her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina es una persona muy activa y se interesa mucho por mejorar la calidad de vida de familia, ya que su esposo, que es tapicero, trabaja en un negocio que no tiene buen ingreso y no es suficiente para poder darles a sus hijos lo necesario, como educación. Por ello ella colabora y apoya a la casa con la actividad que hace tiempo inició, la venta de zapatos por catálogo. Paulina ha luchado mucho para poder sacar adelante a su familia movida por el gran amor que les tiene e impulsada siempre por el apoyo que ellos le brindan.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $200 DLLS para poder invertir en mercancía e incrementar sus ingresos, ya que los necesitan mucho en su casa. Tu puedes ayudar a Paulina a seguir adelante y a que ella pueda a su vez apoyar a su familia, tu generosidad es de mucha ayuda para ella.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en:
Miss Mary is originally from de Galeana, Nuevo leon, and she has been living in her current home for a year. It was then when she had a great need to have a better income so she started a small grocery store. Her husband is unemployed and her small children had many necessities. Thanks to her business they have been able to make it through with much effort and dedication. Things have not been easy and they had to face some difficult times.

Now Miss Mary requires a loan of $200 to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise and therefore increasing the number of her clients, providing them with a greater variety. You can help her and her family and you can be part of their growing business, their only source of income. Do not doubt it any longer. They will be grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mary es originaria de de Galeana Nuevo León y tiene radicando en su actual domicilio un año, es entonces cuando tuvo la necesidad de mejor sus ingresos poniendo una tiendita de abarrotes ya que su esposo no tiene empleo y tienen hijos pequeños que tienen muchas necesidades. Gracias a este negocio han podido salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Las cosas no han sido fáciles y han tenido que enfrentar momentos complicados.

En estos momentos Doña Mary requiere de un préstamo de $200 DLLS para poder crecer, comprando más mercancía para incrementar su número de clientes al tener más variedad que ofrecer. Tú puedes apoyar a ella y su familia y ser parte del crecimiento de su negocio, que es la única fuente de subsistencia que tienen. No lo dudes más , ellos te lo vana agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Natalia Guadalupe

texts.en:
In Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon lives Natalia. She is married and has a small child, and she busies herself in the sale of clothing. But her sales have been dropping a great deal and she does not see the income that she once had. She has not been able to work at her business following her little one\'s illness. He has some medical problems including asthma, and he was hospitalized for that not long ago. Now he needs an expensive treatment.

She needs to recover her sales in order to help her son. Her husband\'s salary is not enough to cover all the costs. To be able to make it through she requires a loan of $250 that she will use to purchase merchandise and achieve her goal. Natalia and her son need you help. The decision is in your hands. They will sincerely thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Cadereyta, Nuevo León vive Natalia, ella es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Pero sus ventas han bajado mucho y ya no percibe los ingresos que antes tenia, pues ha descuidado un poco el negocio a causa de la enfermedad de su pequeño. El tiene problemas físicos de asma y hace poco lo tuvo internado en el hospital, y ahora requiere de un tratamiento muy costoso.

Ella quiere poder recuperar sus ventas para poder ayudar a su hijo, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza a cubrir todos lo gastos. Para poder lograrlo ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía y poder lograr su objetivo. Natalia y su hijo necesitan de tu apoyo, la decisión esta en tus manos, ellos te lo vana agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Mister Lorezno is married and has three children of 17, 8 and 6 years of age. He lives in the city of Pedro Escobedo in the State of Queretaro. He has a mechanic repair shop for tractors, agriculture being a way of life in this region. Thanks to this he has a good number of clients every week. In 1997 he started his business with his brother-in-law, to separate themselves from their boss and throw themselves into the adventure of owning their own business, one that to date has been successful. Thanks to this business Lorenzo has been able to provide his children the necessities and indispensable needs such as an education. His previous salary was not enough and they faced problems constantly.

He requires a loan of $1200 to purchase parts that he needs, planning to repay the full amount in a term of 6 to 12 months. Lorenzo needs your support to be able to continue the business that he started some 10 years ago. This business that has allowed him to provide his family with daily sustenance. Don\'t doubt it any longer. They need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Lorenzo esa casado y tiene tres hijos de 17,8 y 6 años de edad, el vive en la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, en el estado de Querétaro. El tiene un taller de reparación de tractores a agrícolas, por ser la agricultura una actividad preponderante en esta región, gracias ha esto el tiene un buen número de clientes cada semana. Inició en 1997 cuando decidió junto con su cuñado independizarse de sus patrón y por su cuenta lanzarse a la aventura de su negocio propio que hasta la fecha le ha dado buenos resultados. Gracias a esta actividad Lorenzo puede brindarles a sus hijos lo necesarios e indispensable como la educación, con su salario anterior no le alcanzaba y enfrentaban problemas constantemente.

El requiere de un préstamo de $1200 DLLS para comprar refacciones que necesita, planeando cubrir el monto total en un plazo de 6 – 12 meses. Lorenzo necesita de tu apoyo para poder continuar con el proyecto que inició ya casi hace 10 años y que le ha permitido darle ha su familia el sustento diario, no lo dudes más, ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase refactions

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio lives in the city of Pedro Escobedo with is wife and 2 little ones aged 10 and 8 years old. He busies himself with the repair of automotive radiators and agricultural radiators. He has started his business two years ago and it has permitted him to provide his family with a dignified way of life. It started in 1994 when he recognized a financial need to have a business so that he can support his family. The shop that where he worked closed down and with the small savings he put away and through the support of other material providers, he managed to set up his own shop. Through daily struggle and arduous work he managed to reach his goals, given, of course, the unconditional support of his family.

Today Sergio requires a loan in the amount of $475 that he will put towards the purchase of parts that he is missing. You can, through your generosity, support this family and permit Sergio to continue expanding his business. He and his family will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sergio vive en la localidad de Pedro Escobedo con su esposa y sus 2 pequeños de 10 y 8 años, el se dedica a la reparación de radiadores automotrices y agrícolas, misma que ha desarrollado desde hace doce años y que le ha permitido darle ha su familia una forma digna de vida. Inició en el año de 1994 cuando se vio en la necesidad de una actividad económica que le permitiera mantener a su familia ya que el taller para el que laboraba cerró sus puertas y es cuando con lo poco ahorros que tenía y con el apoyo de proveedores de materiales logro poner su propio taller. Con el esfuerzo cotidiano y el arduo trabajo a conseguido sus objetivos y por supuesto con el apoyo incondicional de su familia.

En este momento Sergio requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $475 DLLS, mismo que utilizará para la compra de refacciones que le hacen falta. Tú puedes, con tu generosidad, apoyar a esta familia y permitir a Sergio continuar creciendo con su negocio. El y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase refactions

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Servando is a very happily married man and is father of two little girls of 7 and 4 years of age, whom for he and his wife alike, are the engine that moves them to continue their daily efforts. He depends on his business of packaging sales, since 1992, some time after the passing of his father, the one who started the business to begin with. Motivated by sheer necessity to have a means to live and to finish the studies that he was at the time still completing. Today he is successful in his job thanks to constant hard work and the daily struggle for his family.

The support of his own has been indispensable to give him the strength to overcome the obstacles that have materialized. Today Servando needs a loan of $925 that he wil use to purchase materials and hence increase his earnings. Help Servando to keep and expand the business that with so much effort, work, and dedication he has built with the sole objective of giving his family what they need. Do not doubt it any longer. Support him. He and his family thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Servando es una persona que esta felizmente casado, es padre de 2 pequeñas de 7 y 4 años de edad, que al igual que su esposa son el motor que lo mueven para continuar su esfuerzo cotidiano. El cuenta con un negocio propio de venta de estopa, inició en 1992, tiempo después de fallecer su padre que era la persona que originalmente comenzó con este proyecto, impulsado por la necesidad de misma de tener medios para vivir y de terminar los estudios que en ese momento estaba realizando. Actualmente continúa con éxito gracias al trabajo constante y la lucha diaria por su familia.

El apoyo de los suyos ha sido indispensable para que tenga la fuerza necesaria para vencer los obstáculos que se le han presentado. En este momento Servando requiere un préstamo de $ 925 DLLS que utilizará para la comprar de materia prima que incrementará su ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Ayuda a Servando a conservar y hacer crecer lo que con tanto esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación ha construido con el único objetivo de darle lo necesarios a su familia. No lo dudes más y apóyalo, el y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente

loans.use: purchase material

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
For Miss Eulalia the most important things are her husband and her children. They live in the city of Pedro Escobedo. Together with her husband she has been able to provide for their children, having struggled to provide them with all that they need. Miss Eulalia started her business 6 years ago when her husband had an accident and was left temporarily incapacitated. Having the need to somehow support her little children she decided to take action. With a small amount of money she had saved from the family expenses she started a business renting movies, a business that until today she still manages eventhough her husband\'s problem is no longer.

Responsibility, personal strength, and integrity are the characteristics that clearly define Miss Eulalia. Today she requires a loan of $925 that she will put towards the upkeep of her movie catalogue. She needs your support and your generosity. Supporting her is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Para Doña Eulalia lo más importante lo constituyen su esposo y sus hijos, ellos viven en la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, junto con su esposo, ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y han luchado por darles todo lo necesario. Doña Eulalia inició su negocio hace 6 años cuando su esposo tuvo un accidente y quedo temporalmente incapacitado y teniendo que mantener de alguna forma a sus pequeños hijitos decidió tomar acción y con algún dinero que tenía guardado del gasto familiar emprendió un negocio de renta de películas, mismo que mantiene hasta la fecha aún superado el problema de su esposo.

Responsabilidad, fortaleza, entereza son características que definen claramente a la Doña Eulalia, quien requiere en este momento de crédito de $925 DLLS que utilizará para mantener actualizado su catálogo de películas. Ella necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad, apoyarla esta en tus manos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Twenty years ago, after returning defeated from his adventure of following the American dream, one that was coveted by all the farmers, and having returned to his city of Pedro Escobedo in Queretaro, and following the sense of responsibility for his little children, Felix decided to start his own business selling bales of alfalfa. He already knew the bountiful nature of the business, one that his father taught him, and with the support of his brothers he was able to gather enough capital to start a new life, one that he continues to enjoy thanks to arduous work and dedication.

Now Felix requires a loan in the amount of $925, that will be put towards increasing his sales and consequently the family income. He is now in need of your support. Help him. The decision is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 20 años después de regresar derrotado de su aventura por ir a alcanzar el sueño americano que tanto buscan las personas de campo, y viéndose nuevamente en su localidad, Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, y con la responsabilidad de de sus pequeños hijos, Félix decidió iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de pacas de alfalfa. Pues el ya conocía las bondades de esta actividad que su padre le había enseñado, y con el apoyo de sus hermanos junto el capital necesario para iniciar con su modo actual de vida y hasta la fecha lo ha continuado gracias a su arduo trabajo y dedicación.

Ahora Félix requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en para incrementar sus ventas y consecuentemente el ingreso familiar. El ahora necesita de tu apoyo, ayúdalo, la decisión esta en tus manos.

loans.use: purchase material

loans.name: Ana Lilia

texts.en:
Ana Lilia lives in the city of Pedro Escobedo. She is a widow and mother of two daughters aged 23 and 12 years. Her two daugthers have been the prime motivation of her life. She runs a small restaurant that she started when she found herself in the despair not having the support for her family that was once provided by her husband before his passing. Following the death of her husband she saw a need to support her daughters, who were still very young 10 years ago. This is how she started her business, one that all along has permitted her to proviD. for her daughters. Of course, the struggle has not been at all easy, but with work and effort they have been able to make it through.

Today Ana Lilia needs a loan of $475 to purchase ingredients that she uses to make the foods she sells in her small restaurant. You can help Ana Lilia in her daily struggle to proviD. her for daughters. Don\'t leave them alone. They need you and they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Lilia vive en la localidad D. Pedro Escobedo, es viuda y madre D. dos hijas cuyas edades son 23 y 12 años, mismas que se han constituido en la principal motivación D. su vida. Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante, inició con este negocio cuando se ve en el desamparo D. no tener el sustento familiar que le proveía su esposo D. manera cotidiana y tras la muerte D. este vio en la necesidad D. mantener a sus hijas quienes hace 10 años eran muy pequeñitas. Es así como comenzó con esta actividad que en todo este tiempo le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijas, claro que la lucha no ha sido nada fácil, pero con trabajo y esfuerzo es ha podido lograr.

En este momento Ana Lilia requiere D. un préstamo D. $ 475 DLLs para poder comparar materias primas que utiliza para elaborar los alimentos que se consumen en el mini restaurante. Tu puedes apoyar a Ana Lilia en esta lucha diaria por sacar adelante a sus hijas, no las dejes solas, ella te necesitan y te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif applied for a loan of $300 to buy writing materials. He wants to improve his business. For the first time he borrowed a loan of $600 and repaired his own shop.
This 52-year-old man is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region, settled in Khirdalan settlement, married has 2 children.
Now he applied for a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his shop and o increase range of goods. 
You can see his shop in the picture. This shop is very small.
He has been engaged in this business for 5 years.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Veliyeddin

texts.en:
Veliyeddin has rented this hairdressing saloon for 13 years. He is 52, married, has 3 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbajar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. In the beginning of his business, he borrowed a loan of $300 and bought equipments for his hairdressing saloon. 
The second loan he spent to repair his hairdressing saloon. 
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy this salon.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing saloon

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en:
This man likes his business. He enjoys to serve people. Novruz is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Absheron region Masazir village. He is sociable, married, has 4 children, was born in 1957. 
This car is his own.
Having borrowed a loan of $400, he bought 2 wheels and painted his car.
Now he plans to buy a new car. 
He has been engaged in his business for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This shop is his own. In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan amount of $400 to begin of light industrial wares: shoes, socks. Then he decided to increase the range of goods.
He applied for a loan of $800 o start sale of children’s clothes and other wares. 
He has a lot of clients. His shop is a small.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 o expand the area of his own shop.
He is 42, married, has 4 children, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan region Masazir village.
He has been engaged in this business for 9 years.

loans.use: To expand the area of his own shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her African craft business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his metal work and fabrication business

loans.name: Hemid

texts.en:
Hemid was born in 1973. He is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Lachin region. He and his family settled in Absheron region Masazir village.
He borrowed a loan of $400 to buy 2 wheels and 1 accumulator.
For the first ime he borrowed a loan off $800 o repair his car. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 o buy other lorry.

loans.use: To expand he area of his own shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business of making concrete products

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna M. sells repackged used clothing, known in Ghana as "African Print". This is a popular product on the Ghanaian market and it has a very strong patronage.  Ms. M.  gained very good record keeping skills as a trainee of TEACH.  She is seeking a loan in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Horacio

texts.en:
The young and entrepreneurial Horacio has always distinguished himself as being a very hard working person and devoted to his parents, whom are his role models. Ever since he was little, they taught him about honest work and responsibility, virtues that he has adopted for himself. Horacio manages his own business, a taco stand. He started it 6 years ago after the mechanic\'s shop where he worked closed down. He found himself in need to find his own way of supporting himself and his parents. This is how he started with his business, with the support of some of his family members.

Thanks to his business, Horacio has been able to help his family. Today he requires a loan in the amount of $475, which he plans to repay in a term of 6 months. He needs you and through your generosity you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his parents. Do not leave them alone, and become part of the development of his small business. Horacio will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven y emprendedor Horacio siempre se ha distinguido por ser una persona muy trabajadora y apegada a sus padres, quienes son su ejemplo a seguir, ya que desde pequeño le han enseñado el trabajo honrado y responsable que le siempre ha adoptado para si. Horacio tiene un negocio propio, se trata de un puesto de tacos, mismo que inició hace 6 años, después de de que el taller en que trabajaba como mecánico cerró y el se vio en la necesidad de buscar su propia forma de manutención y ayudar a sus padres para que salieran adelante, por lo que decidió comenzar con esta actividad, con el apoyo de algunos familiares.

Gracias a este proyecto Horacio ha podido ayudar a su familia, ahora el requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 6 meses. El te necesita y con tu generosidad puedes ayudarlo a crecer y a que el pueda continuar ayudando a su padres, no lo dejes solos y forma parte importante de su desarrollo microempresarial, Horacio te lo va a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Miss Josefina is 49 years old and is mother of two children. With her efforts she has managed to provide for them and now they have grown into adults and she looks upon them with pride, knowing that her efforts where worth her while. She manages a small grocery store, this being her only source of income for her household. She started the business approximately 8 years ago following the estrangement of her husband, having left to the United States and never returned. With the help of her brother she started a small stand that has permitted her to provide for her family.

The situation has not been at all easy for Miss Josefina. But the love for her children was what pushed her to not give up. Today she needs a loan of $475 that she will put towards the purchase of more merchandise in order to be able to incrase her sales and her earnings. Do not leave Josefina and her daughters. They needs you and appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Josefina tiene 49 años de edad es madre de dos hijos y con su esfuerzo personal ha logrado sacar adelante y ahora que ya son personas adultas ella ve con orgullo que el esfuerzo ha valido la pena. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrote, misma que es la única fuente de subsistencia de su hogar. Inició su negocio hace aproximadamente 8 años después de la desaparición de su marido, quien se fue a trabajar a los Estados Unidos y no regresó jamás y con la ayuda de sus hermanos abrió el pequeño estanquillo que ahora tiene y que le ha permitido mantener a su familia.

La situación no fue nada fácil para Doña Josefina, pero el amor a sus hijos fue lo que la empujo a salir adelante y no dejarse vencer. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercancía para poder aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. No abandones a Doña Josefina y sus hijas, ellas te necesitan y agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jenisbell

texts.en:
In the city of Pedro Escrobedo, Queretaro, lives Jenisbell. She is 23 years old and is a single Mom of a littel girl of 2 years of age. Her daughter is her reason for being and the source of her strength, that pushes her to search for emotional stability and work. Two years ago as the birth of her daughter neared, she could not depend on the support of the father of her daughter so she found herself forced to started a business that would bring her an income. This is how she started selling seasonal items with the help of her mother. Thanks to this, her effort and her arduous work, she has been able to overcome her adversities.

She now requires a loan of $925 that she will put towards the purchase of seasonal items, thus increasing her stock and her variety. You can help Jenisbell provide for her daughter what she needs. Do not leave them alone. She needs your support and your generosity. The decision is in your hands. Do not doubt it any longer. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, vive Jenisbell, ella tiene 23 años de edad y es madre soltera de una pequeñita de 2 años de edad, quien es la ilusión de su vida y la fuerza que la impulsa a buscar una estabilidad emocional y laborar. Hace dos años que al aproximarse el nacimiento de su bebe y al no contar con el apoyo del padre de su hija ella se vio obligada a iniciar alguna actividad que le generara ingresos que le permitieran salir adelante. Es así como, con la ayuda de su madre, comenzó a vender artículos de temporada. Gracias a esto y el esfuerzo y trabajo arduo ha logrado vencer las adversidades.

Ahora ella requiere de un crédito de $925 DLLs mismos que utilizará en la compra de artículos de temporada, incrementando así sus existencias y así sus utilidades. Tu puedes ayudar a Jenisbell a darle a su hija lo que necesita, no la dejes sola, ella requiere de tu apoyo y generosidad, la decisión esta en tu manos, no lo dudes más, ella te lo va agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
The young man Juan, is 23 years old. Ever since he was little he was passionate over the auto mechanic work and since the beginning has always been his hobby, one that today has translated into his way of life. His business has allowed him to reach the goals he had planned. In 1996 he and his older brother started repairing cars on weekends in the garage of their family home. Later his older brother decided to formally set up a shop, the one that they use today. Although still a student he invested himself in his work as a mechanic. Approximately one year ago his brother died as a result of a car accident, so Juan was faced with running the business all on his own.

He has struggled to keep up the business that his brother started. His parents depend on him and the income from his business is the only source of income they have. For this, Juan requires a loan of $475 that he will use towards the purchase parts that he needs. Your genersority will be of great help to Juan and his parents. Help them. They need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El joven Juan tiene actualmente 23 años de edad, desde pequeño le ha apasionado la mecánica y que en un principio fue su pasatiempo es ahora su modo de vida, misma que le ha permitido lograr las metas que se ha planteado. En 1996 el y su hermano mayor iniciaron reparando autos los fines de semana en el patio de su casa y posteriormente su hermano decidió poner formalmente un local, mismo que actualmente ocupan. Siendo el apenas un estudiante se incorporó al trabajo del taller y hace aproximadamente un año su hermano murió en un accidente automovilístico, por lo que Juan se quedo solo al frente del negocio.

El ha luchado mucho por mantener el proyecto que su hermano empezó, pues sus padres dependen de el y las ganancias del negocio es la única fuente de subsistencia que tienen. Por ello, Jun, requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de refacciones que necesita. Tu generosidad será de mucha ayuda para Juan y sus padres, apóyalos, el te necesita.

loans.use: purchase refactions

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria, day after day and filled with optimism, starts her work with confidence and faith in her job. She sells roasted chicken at a stand downtown in the city of Pedro Escobedo, Queretaro. She started her business in the year 2000 when she was let go of her job and she found herself without an income to support her children, seeing as she is a single mother. Despite the fact that she has had to struggle alone for the sake of her family and although she has had to go through some complicated times, the love for her children is what has kept her going.

She now needs a loan in the amount of $475 that she will use for the purchase of wholesale chicken, and in this way she will increase her income. Rosa Maria needs your generosity. The decision is in your hands. She and her children will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa María día con día y llena de optimismo inicia sus labores con la confianza y fé en su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo rostisados, en un local en el centro de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Ella inició esta actividad en el año 2000 cuando fue despedida de su empleo y se quedó sin ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, pues es madre soltera. A pesar de que ha tenido que luchar sola por su familia y ha tenido que pasar por momentos muy complicados, el amor a sus hijos es lo que la mantenido de pie.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad e $ 475 DLLs mismos que utilizará en la compra de pollos por mayoreo y con esto incrementará sus ingresos. Rosa María necesita de tu generosidad, la decisión esta en tus manos, ella y sus hijos te lo vana agradecer sinceramente

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married, is 42 years old, and has 4 school-aged children, and they all live in the city of Pedro Escobedo. In 2000, her household was faced with a very severe crisis, and they also found themselves facing their son\'s leukemia and the very expensive treatments. At that moment they did not have any means to pay for them, which is why they started their small business selling clothes.
