Eva and her husband have had to make a terrific team to be able to make it through. Now she needs a loan of $475 to purchase clothes wholesale and increase her earnings. Help Eva and her family. They thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Eva es casada y tiene 42 años, tiene 4 hijos, todos en edad escolar y vive en la localidad de Pedro Escobedo. En el año 2000 en su hogar enfrentaron una crisis muy severa, además se encontraron con el problema de que unos de sus hijos tenía leucemia y esto requiere de tratamientos muy costosos, en ese momento ellos no tenían medios para costearlos, es por eso que iniciaron a un pequeño negocio, la venta de ropa.

Eva y su esposo han tenido que hacer un gran equipo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ahora ella necesita un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS para comprar ropa al mayoreo e incrementar sus ingresos. Ayuda a Eva y su familia, ellos te lo agradecerderan sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has been running this small store for about 2 years. She is in need of investment capital because she wants to begin selling chicken, beef and eggs. Currently, she can only afford to invest in basic goods such as sugar and oil, but her clients are in demand of many more products. She started the business with the help of her sister in law who has experience in with small stores. Patricia is 45 years old and has 6 children, although only 1 of them still lives at home. She and her husband, who is a construction worker, own their home which is made out of wood and bamboo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Begin selling chicken, beef and eggs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is applying for her second loan through Mifex and Kiva. Her first loan had a much bigger impact than she ever imagined. During the loan period her husband was killed in a robbery attempt. The extra capital she had invested in her business allowed her to support her family during the hard time after her husband’s death. She is now applying for a second loan in order to continue investing in her business.

She has a small store where she sells many different food items that are popular in Ecuador. She also has started selling clothes door-to-door during the day. While she is out selling her 2 kids and her mother help run the store. Despite the death of the Rosa’s husband, the family remains close and they are optimistic about the future.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Continue investing in her store

loans.name: Ervin

texts.en:
Ervin is applying for his second loan with Kiva and Mifex. He is the head of a true family business where he, his parents and his brothers work selling ceviche and other popular seafood meals. He and his brothers travel to the fish markets before dawn in order to buy the freshest fish and seafood. His wife and his mother prepare the meals to sell to the local community by 7 am almost everyday.

With the first loan, Ervin was able to invest his money in food and eventually he used the profits to open a new location with his wife. He is now requesting the loan in order to invest in the new place. Ervin and his wife have three children, but the business support the whole L. family. Late last year, Ervin was paid a visit by one of the very first Kiva lenders named Tom. Read all about the visit and Ervin’s business here: http://baddogpip.blogspot.com/2006/12/mifex-neighborhoods-tres-trinitaria.html

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in his new location

loans.name: Jesenia

texts.en:
Jesenia is 27 years old and works selling clothes in the local community. She started the business with about $400 she had accumulated as savings from a job in a factory. When she started off, she only sold clothes for babies and young children. As the time has passed she has began selling casual clothing for men and women. She hopes that with the loan she will be able to invest in cosmetics and accessories, which are much more profitable than clothing sales. Jesenia already has one child and is pregnant with another. She and her husband are hard workers who want to provide their children with good educations.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Begin selling cosmetics

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa runs a small market out of the front of her home. She started her business off by only selling fruits and vegetables with only $20 in capital. She still sells these products but now also includes other items such as sugar, oil and cleaning products. She is requesting this loan because she wants to invest in baby products and more food items. She has a very stable client base and she has noticed that they are in demand for many of these new items.

Narcisa is a single mother of two. She moved to Guayaquil from Portoviejo because her husband was abusive and was not supportive of the family. She completely relies on her business in order to feed and educate her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in more items for her store

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has a stand where he sells tortillas and common Ecuadorian foods. He started the business off with only $10 of capital several years ago. This business has provided for Francisco and his 3 children. He depends on the stand to provide food, shelter and education for his family. He is requesting the loan in order to buy chairs and tables to put around his stand. He hopes that his business will continue to become popular and that one day he can open a restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for his clients to use

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Khalid is 29 years old. He married and has 2 children. He is the only breadwinner in family. He has an ability to buy the best perfumery. He is very polite with all his clients. Khalid decided to apply for a loan $300 in order to busy with retail trade. 
He applies for the loan $600 to open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods.

loans.use: To open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
34-year-old Zafar with his 2 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2001 Zafar has been engaged in animal sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 2 loans ($500; $800;) from Normicro Zafar significantly expanded his business, bought 11 calves, achieved progress in his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back timely.
He applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy 15 calves.

loans.use: To buy 15 calves

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He is hard working person. He is 48. He married and has 2 children. He began his business 18 years ago and it allows him to support to his family. He borrowed the amount of $400 to renovate for repairing cars. Muhammed is mechanic. He has been engaged in this business for 8 years. He works as the master. The second time he borrowed the loan amount of $800 and with this loan he enlarged and renovated the area of his garage. 
Muhammed applies for a loan amount of $400 to buy the spare parts and to expand his business area.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts and to expand his business area

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en:
Farhad is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Cebrail. He is a professional driver. He has a . 44-year-old Ferhad is hard working person. He married and has 2 children. He began his business 20 years ago and it allows him to support to his family. In 2002 he borrowed $500 from Normicro spent this loan amount to buy the spare parts for his car. For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $600 to repair his cars motor. His car is old. Therefore he plans to sell it and to buy a new car.
Farhad applies for a loan amount of $1400 to buy a new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.en:
Elsever has been engaged in this business for 2 years. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. This 40-year-old man is hard worker. He is married, has 2 children. At the beginner he borrowed the loan amount of $400 from Normicro, has bought grocery googs. 
Now Elsever wants loan amount of $600 to rent a shop and increase the range of goods.

loans.use: To rent a shop and increase the range of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for welding

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica owns a small café where she sells shakes and lunches. She started the business of with her mother after her husband abandoned her and their daughter. She will use the loan in order to invest in a grill so she may be able to sell shish kabobs and other grilled meats. She hopes that this will allow her to open her business at night and generate much more revenue. She is only 24 years old but she plans on having a very successful restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a grill for her business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene has a business where she sells household furniture made out of metal. These items are becoming very popular in these poor sectors of Guayaquil because they offer convenient furniture at affordable prices. Marlene is also very popular because she offers her clients the option of financing the products. She currently has 50 clients that she collects payments from. Marlene has 3 children and is married. She is not from Guayaquil, but moved there in search of work and better opportunities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in furniture products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns a small store where she sells many food items. She started off by just selling fruits and vegetables, but eventually her business grew to include dairy products and soft drinks. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in canned goods that are very popular amongst her customers. She does not have the investment capital to go out and buy these goods and make them part of her product line. Maria has a very stable business that shows the capacity of introducing new products. Her customer base is very strong and the product she plans to introduce promise to generate revenue. Maria is a 28 year old single mother of three children who moved to Guayaquil in search of work and a better for life for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products for her store

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has a store where he sells fresh fruit and other food items. Luis started his business with the help of his wife who saved up bout $400 in capital for the market. At first, Luis only sold fruit and vegetables which were the easiest to buy and sell. He now sells many different items including the dairy products he wants to continue to invest in. Luis relies on the business to feed and educate his children. He and his wife have four children. He hopes to one day have an operation large enough to employ his wife and to pay for the schooling of his children at the college level.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products of his market

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
This 55-year-old man has been engaged in this business for 10 years.
This kind man is married, has 3 children. He lives with his family in Baku city Bulbula settlement.
You can see in the picture his flower garden. This flower garden is in the yard of his house.
There are red, white, yellow roses and other sort flowers in his flower garden.
These flowers are always given every support by Fizuli. He enjoys looking after flowers.
For the first time he borrowed a loan of $600 and bought flower seeds.
For the second time  he borrowed a loan of $800 and expand the area of flower garden and began to be busy with seed-bed.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to open a flower shop and a vegetable-shop for sale the flowers and vegetables.

loans.use: To open a flower-shop and vegetable-shop

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat has her own tailor\'s shop. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She enjoys with her work.
Hawing borrowed a loan of $500 she bought a lot of leather in order to sew on a machine stylish leather jackets.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a bench for leather wares and a iron for leather wares.
This 47-year-old Matanat is single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Surakhani region Yeni Guneshli settlement.

loans.use: To buy a bench for leather wares and an iron for leather wares

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en:
She has rented this tailor\\\'s shop for 10 years. In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $600 and bought a sewing-machine.
She sews on a machine stylish feminine clothes.
Aygun creates the new fashionable feminine clothes. She likes to do innovation in her business.
Now she needs $1200 to buy cloth.
She was born in 1961, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan Beylagan region. She and her family settled in Surakhani region Bulbula settlement.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi and Natasha T. are a husband and wife team. They both worked at a factory in the past, however their salaries were too small to provide for the needs of their family. For that reason they decided to start their own small business selling clothing for teens and youth. Vitalyi and Natasha got their first loan from Nadiya Ukraine in March 2004. At that time they had only one vending stall in an open-air market. Lending services helped the couple purchase four kiosks and hire two employees who work as vendors. The active involvement of both spouses in this business is one reason for its success. Not long ago Vitalyi was in a bad car accident. He had serious injuries and was hospitalized for more than three months. Natasha was the only breadwinner in the family during that time. She had to run their business and learn to manage it efficiently without her husband. The business has not only remained stable but has seen considerable growth since that time. Vitalyi and Natasha are requesting a loan to expand their assortment of clothing for young people. They are planning to purchase trendy jeans, sweaters, blouses, pullovers, skirts and pants that will sell really well. Good taste and the ability to keep up with fashion guarantee high demand for the clothes Vitalyi and Natasha can offer. Their flexibility, loyalty, and ability to handle challenges are some of the reasons this couple will continue to see success in their business.

Віталій та Наталія Терещенки одружені. Вони обидва працювали на заводі. Однак їхньої зарплатні не вистачало для того, щоб забезпечити потреби родини. Тому вони вирішили почати власну справу й продавати одяг для підлітків та молоді. Віталій та Наталія отримали перші позики від „Надії України” в березні 2004 року. Коли вони тільки починали, в них був лише один прилавок на одному з місцевих ринків. Послуги кредитування допомогли цій родині купити 4 кіоски та взяти на роботу двох реалізаторів. Активність подружжя завжди була запорукою їхнього успіху. Нещодавно Віталій потрапив в автокатастрофу, набув серйозних поранень та опинився в лікарні, де перебував більше 3 місяців. Наталія мала одна годувати родину. Вона була змушена торгувати без чоловіка. Їхній бізнес не тільки залишився стабільним, але й суттєво зріс з того часу. Віталій та Наталія просять про позику для того, щоб розширити асортимент одягу для молоді. Вони планують купити модні джинси, светри, блузки, пуловери, спідниці та брюки, які користуватимуться великим попитом серед підлітків. Гарний смак та здатність вловити останні віяння моди гарантуватимуть гарну торгівлю. Гнучкість, вірність своїй справі та вміння справлятися з труднощами – це саме ті якості цього подружжя, які забезпечать успіх їхньому бізнесу.

loans.use: To expand the assortment of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his bicycle repair business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his used clothing business

loans.name: Conforte

texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1960, Conforte A. is married and the mother of five, and she also takes care of two other children. She sells chickens at the marketplace helping to support her family. Since her husband’s spare parts store was looted by thieves, Mrs. A. feels she must take on all household expenses, something that is not at all easy to do. But thanks to her devotion and dynamism, she manages somehow to provide the necessities for her family.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $650 as capital to be able to sell sheep in addition to her poultry. This will grow her business and augment her income. The loan will help her to raise the standard of living for her and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1960 à Lomé, Madame A. Conforte est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des poulets au marché et contribue aux besoins familiaux. Depuis que le magasin de pièces détachées de son mari a été pillé par les voleurs, Madame A. se voit dans l’obligation de prendre toutes les charges du ménage. Cela ne lui est pas du tout facile mais grâce à son dévouement et son dynamisme, elle arrive tant que mal à subvenir aux besoins vitaux de la famille.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour qu’en plus de l’achat et vente de volailles y associer la vente de moutons afin d’accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus. Ce crédit va l’aider à relever son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell poultry and sheep

loans.name: Finè

texts.en:
Mrs. Finè D. was born in 1962 in Lomé (P/Golfe). She is married and mother to three (03) children, with two (02) other children under her care. Her husband, a police officer who has been retired for 5 years, no longer makes any real contribution to the household's needs. The family's costs are becoming more and more difficult to bear, because Mrs. D. lacks the funds to develop her business of selling poultry, which should be able to earn her a substantial income. Very determined although she is illiterate, Mrs. D. has a sharp business sense, which helped her greatly in managing the first credits she received and paid off without incident. She is building her confidence, and deserves once again to receive financial support. She is asking for a credit of $850 to be able to go to farms herself and buy poultry. This credit will increase the size of her business and improve her socio-economic standing.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Finè est née en 1962 à Lomé (P/Golfe). Mariée et mère de trois enfants (03) et deux (02) autres enfants à sa charge. Son mari, un gendarme admis à la retraite depuis 5 ans, ne contribue plus réellement aux besoins du foyer. Les charges du ménage deviennent de plus en plus lourdes car elle manque de fonds de commerce pour développer ses activités de vents de volailles qui devraient bien lui procurer des revenus substantiels. Très déterminée et malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, Madame D. a un sens aigu de gestion des affaires, Cela l’a beaucoup dans la gestion de ses premiers obtenus et remboursés sans incident. Elle nourrit confiance et mérite d’être à nouveau soutenue financièrement. Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour pouvoir aller elle-même dans les fermes pour l’achat des volailles. Ce crédit augmentera la taille de son activité et améliorera son niveau de vie socio économique.

loans.use: Buying and selling poultry

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: AZIZA R. lives near the Dar es Salaam International Airport. She makes and sells concrete bricks. She has employed four assistants in her business. She is married with five children, three of whom are in secondary school and two in primary school. Aziza started this business three years ago. Since then, the business had grown very slowly, contrary to what she anticipated, although concrete bricks are in high demand. She identified two main problems facing her business. One problem is inadequate capital and the second is irregular water supply. She now intends to combat these problems to make her business improve. Water is vital to her business. Concrete making uses a lot of water. Irregular water supply in her area makes her business difficult. She wants to build a concete water tank to act as a reservoir when the water supply is irregular. To implement her plan, Aziza is in need of $550.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a concrete making business

loans.name: Enyonam Séna

texts.en:
Mrs. Enyonam Séna A. is a young woman born in 1979 in Lomé. She is married with one (01) child. After she failed twice to pass the Bac university entry-level exam, she abandoned her studies in favor of an office training program, at which she did very well. However, she did not have the resources to begin working in this profession right away. Her husband, also unemployed, could not help her. With a credit that she received and successfully paid back, she opened a small service center where she provided word processing and photocopying services. However, her ambition is to increase her business by selling computer consumables and office supplies. In order to carry out this plan, she is asking for a further $1200 in financing. She is a woman of character who has a strong desire to succeed where other women have failed. Her dynamism and devotion deserve to be supported.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Enyonam Séna est une jeune femme née en1979 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant. Suite à deux échecs successifs au Bac1, elle abandonna les études pour suivre une formation en bureautique qui lui a bien réussi. Mais faute de moyens elle n’a pas pu exercer ce métier à temps. Son mari également sans emploi ne pouvait pas lui venir en aide. Avec son crédit obtenu et d’ailleurs bien remboursé, elle a ouvert un petit centre de multi services où elle fait des traitements de texte et des photocopies. Toutefois, son ambition est d’accroître ses activités par la vente des consommables informatiques et de fournitures de bureau. Pour réaliser ce projet, elle demande un autre financement de $1200. C’est une femme de caractère qui a une forte envie de réussir là où d’autres femmes ont échoué. Son dynamisme et son dévouement méritent d’être soutenus.

loans.use: selling computer consumables and office supplies

loans.name: Hortense

texts.en:
Mrs. Hortense D., born in 1975 in Lomé, is married and the mother of three (03) children. Her business is running a restaurant serving local specialties in the market of Bè, a popular district in Lomé. Her husband, a traveling photographer without a permanent job, can no longer meet all the needs of the family. Mrs. D., an ingenious woman, has put all of her know-how into her work and the idea of good hygiene, which means that everyone likes to eat in her restaurant. With such a large clientele, Mrs. D. cannot satsify everyone with her meager resources. That is why she is asking for a $500 credit to update the restaurant and build up a stock of the ingredients she uses in her business. This will increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Hortense, née en 1975 à Lomé est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la restauration de mets locaux au marché de Bè, un quartier populaire de Lomé. Son mari, un photographe ambulant sans emploi fixe, n’arrive plus à satisfaire tous les besoins de la famille. Femme ingénieuse, elle met tout son savoir-faire dans son travail et a la notion de l’hygiène, ce qui fait que tout le monde aime restaurer chez elle. Devant cette clientèle, Madame D. n’arrive pas à les satisfaire par ses maigres moyens. Elle sollicite donc un crédit de $500 pour l’aménagement du lieu et faire un stock des denrées qui entrent dans son commerce. Ceci pour augmenter son revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie d sa famille.

loans.use: Update the restaurant and build up a stock of ingredients

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil sews on a machine the leather jackets for men. He is hardworker, has been engaged in this business for 15 years.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a leather sewing-machine.
This 38-year-old man is single, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Khojavend region, settled in Sabunchu region Bakikhanov settlement.

loans.use: To buy a leaher  sewing-machine

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman was born in 1953 in Baku ciy Sabunchu region. He is married, has 1 child.
Having borrowed a loan of $600 he bought materials for individual manufacture. 
He has been engaged in this business for 6 years. 
Now he needs $1200 to buy a stone cutter.

loans.use: To buy a  sone cutter

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region Minkend village. He is married. He settled with family and 2 children in Sumgait city. This 42-year-old man, Yahya started his business 10 years ago. His first loan was $700, bought 9 sheep. He spent the second loan $900 to buy 13 sheep. Third time he borrowed $1200 and bought 5 calves. It is necessary to note that Yahya is the one of the active clients of Normicro. 
Now he is planning to buy 8 sheep and 5 calves. Yahya applies for a loan amounting 1800$.

loans.use: To buy 8 sheep and 2 calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy cosmetics, and beauty products for her shop

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en:
Oralia is 53 years old and is mother of four children of 13, 15, 17 and 20 years of age. Her husband is a labourer and earns minimum wage. Four years ago she decided, seeing the need of her 4 children, to help her husband and started a small business selling seafood, with the ultimate goal of earning extra income to cover all of their necessities. Her husband\'s earnings were not enough and now that their children find themselves in school, their expenses are more every day. With a great deal of effort and hard work, she has managed to expand her small restaurant, having always counted on the emotional support of her family.

She needs a loan of $475 to pruchase products andn utensils that she requires for the preparation of food and, in this manner, generate greater earning to further expand her business. Oralia has fought hard to build what she now has. Help her keep growing. She and her family will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es madre tiene 53 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos de 13, 15, 17 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es obrero y gana el salario mínimo. Hace cuatro años ella, al verse en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos y ayudar a su esposo, inició un pequeño negocio de venta de mariscos, con la finalidad de poder obtener ingresos extras que le permitieran cubrir todas las necesidades. Pues con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente, ya que sus hijos se encuentran estudiando y los gastos son cada día mayores. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado ampliar su negocio de comida, contando con el apoyo emocional de su familia.

Ella necesita de un crédito de $ 475 DLLS par poder comprar productos y utensilios que requiere para la elaboración de sus alimentos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para poder ampliara su negocio. Oralia ha luchado mucho par construir lo que hasta ahora tiene, ayúdala a seguir creciendo, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is orginally from the State of Guerrero, but 10 years ago she saw the need to emigrate to the community of Pedro Escobedo in the State of Queretaro, looking for better opportunities as their financial situation was in grave trouble. With a few savings she had she started a stand selling seafood, the very same one that today still exists and has evolved with satisfaction over the years. Inocencia has fought hard for her family and with all her effort she has managed to give them what they need.

she now requires a loan of $475 to purchase merchandise, and therefore increase her sales and expand the business. Help her grow. She will thank you. Become part of her effots. Don\'t doubt it any longer. Your generosity will be of great help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Inocencia es originaría del estado de Guerrero, pero hace 10 años se vio en la necesidad de emigrar a la comunidad de Pedro Escobedo, en el estado de Querétaro, en busca de una mejor oportunidad, pues su situación económica estaba en graves problemas. Con un poco de capital que tenía llegó y estableció un puesto de venta de mariscos, mismo que hoy sigue vigente y que al pasar de los años ha ido evolucionando satisfactoriamente. Inocencia ha luchado mucho por su familia y con todo su esfuerzo ha logrado darles lo necesario.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía, incrementar sus ventas y poder así ampliar su negocio. Ayúdala acrecer, ella te lo va agradecer, vuélvete parte de sus logros, no lo dudes más, tu generosidad será de gran ayuda.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Simón

texts.en:
Simon is married and lives with his family in the community of Huinala, in the city of of Apodaca, Nuevo Leon. He makes and sells rustic furniture and this is the only source of sustenance for his family. With great effort and dedication he managed to keep to his business, always motivated by the great love he feels for his family.

He requires a loan of $1100 to purchase wood and therfore produce more furniture and increase his sales. He realizes now that his earnings are not enough to cover the school expenses for his two little ones. Help Simon provide his children with the education they need. He and his family will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Simón es casado y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Huinala, en el municipio de Apodaca, Nuevo León. El se dedica a la producción y venta de muebles rústicos, es el único medio de sustento para su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado continuar con su proyecto, siempre incentivado por el gran amor que le tiene a su familia.

El requiere de un préstamo de $1100 DLLS para poder comprar madera y fabricar un mayor número de muebles y así incrementar sus ventas. Ya que con lo percibe actualmente no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos escolares de sus dos pequeños. Ayuda a Simón a darles la ecuación que requieren a sus hijos, no lo dudes más, la decisión ésta en tus manos, el y su familia te lo van agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Gnapoté

texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1952, Mrs. Gnapoté A. is married and the mother of six (06) children, with one domestic staff member. She is a vendor of various products. Her husband, a taxi driver who is no longer working, now barely contributes anything to the household’s needs. This means that his wife must bear all the expenses. Despite her enthusiasm and good faith, she is limited by her resources. Mrs. A. has thus decided to ask for financial support to expand her business. The $550 credit that she is seeking will serve as seed money to buy a variety of products in order to expand her selection. Her experience is a useful asset in making her business profitable and earning a substantial income to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1952 à Lomé, Madame A. Gnapoté est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants avec un domestique à charge. Elle est commerçante de produits divers. Son mari, un chauffeur de taxi qui n’est plus en activité, ne contribue presque plus dans les besoins du foyer. Ainsi, toutes les dépenses reviennent à la femme. Malgré son ardeur et sa bonne foi, elle est limitée par les moyens. Elle décide alors de solliciter un appui financier pour élargir son commerce. Le crédit de $550 qu’elle demande va donc servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat des produits divers afin d’agrandir son étalage. Son expérience est un bon atout pour rentabiliser ses activités et dégager un revenu substantiel pour les besoins sa famille.

loans.use: Selling various products

loans.name: Agnès

texts.en:
Mrs. Agnès A. was born in 1964 in Dalavé (P/Zio). She is married and the mother of two (02) children, with one (01) other child under her care. Her main business is selling coconuts that are used in making palm oil, which is highly valued in Togo. Her husband, a retiree, does not even receive his meager pension, and so Mrs. A. must bear all of the household expenses. However, she has gained a real mastery of her business, which she has been managing for more than 20 years with all the rigor of a responsible manager. Mrs. A. began her business in very difficult conditions, but thanks to her management abilities and especially her business sense, her activities grew to a very encouraging size, requiring additional financing. Her honesty and good faith were demonstrated when she paid back her first credit without any problems. The trust she earned should be worth further financing to expand her business in order to increase her income and improve her living conditions. The $850 credit will thus allow her to buy a large stock from the farms.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Agnès est née en 1964 à Dalavé (P/Zio). Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et un (01) enfant autre à charge. Son activité principale est la vente des noix de palme qui entrent dans la fabrication de l’huile de palme très appréciée au Togo. Son mari, un retraité, ne perçoit même pas sa maigre pension. Toutes les charges du ménage reposent alors sur elle. Toutefois, Madame A. fait preuve de la maîtrise de son activité qu’elle gère depuis plus de 20 ans avec toute la rigueur d’une gestion responsable. Madame A. a débutée ses activités dans des conditions très difficiles mais, grâce à sa capacité de gestion et surtout son sens d’affaires, son commerce a pris une ampleur très encourageante qui nécessite des financements d’appoint. Son honnêteté et sa bonne foi ont été démontrées lors de son premier crédit remboursé sans difficulté. Cette confiance peut lui valoir d’autres financements pour augmenter ses affaires afin d’accroître ses revenus et d’améliorer des conditions de vie. Ainsi, le crédit de $850 va lui servir de s’approvisionner en grande quantité dans les fermes.

loans.use: Buying and selling coconuts

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Mrs. Christine E. is the mother of four (04) children. She has lived for some twenty years with her two (02) sisters in the house she shares with her husband. A blacksmith by trade, her husband has difficulty meeting the family’s needs. This is why Mrs. E. covers more than 70% of the household expenses using the income from her business of selling generic products. She has been in this business for 5 years and has completely mastered it. During the day, Mrs. E. walks from neighborhood to neighborhood with her products before displaying them on the side of the road in the evening. Dynamic and honest, Mrs. E. has proven herself to be a capable manager and a trustworthy woman by receiving and successfully paying back her first two credits of $100 and $200 respectively without any incidents. In order to expand her selection and increase her business, Christine is asking for a new credit of $750, which will allow her to buy medicines directly from wholesalers. This will make it possible for her to increase her revenue and better take care of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame E. Christine est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle vit depuis une vingtaine d’année avec ses deux (02) sœurs au domicile conjugal. Forgeron de métier, son mari subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille. Aussi, intervient-elle à plus de 70% dans les charges du foyer à travers les revenus issus de ses activités de vente des produits génériques. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et en a une maîtrise totale. Pendant la journée, Madame E. Christine se promène de quartier en quartier avant de les exposer le soir au bord de la route. Dynamique et honnête, Madame E. Christine fait preuve d’une bonne gestionnaire et d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux premiers crédits respectifs de $100 et $200 obtenus et régulièrement remboursés sans incident. Pour élargir son étalage et accroître son activité, Christine sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui lui permettra d’acheter les médicaments directement chez les grossistes. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling generic medicines

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain T. is a very energetic and friendly man. His wife is a retailer, and they have married three children. His mother and his kids are additions to his responsibilities. Seeing that his profits from selling fuel oil is insufficient to provide for them, he began tutoring some of the neighborhood children for extra income. That was how he was able to pay off his initial loan without a problem.

Mr. T. is always short of fuel oil because of insufficient resource capital to meet the demands of the market. So, to develop his business which he calls «Papa Petro» and derive a higher profit margin for the benefit of his family, he is requesting a second loan, amounting to $850, which would allow him to construct a bigger supply tank. He could then have a substantial supply of fuel oil to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur T. Sylvain est un homme très dynamique et ouvert. Marié à une revendeuse, il est père de trois (03) enfants. Sa mère et ses petits ont alourdi ses charges. S’apercevant que les bénéfices de la vente du pétrole ne suffisent pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il y associe les cours de répétition à quelques enfants de son quartier. Ce qui lui procure des revenus complémentaires. Ainsi, il a pu solder son premier crédit sans difficulté.

Monsieur T. Sylvain est toujours en rupture de stock car son capital est insuffisant pour répondre aux demandes de son marché. Ainsi, accroître son activité et en tirer plus de marges bénéficiaires pouvant contribuer l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, Sylvain sollicite un second crédit de $850 qui lui permettra de construire une citerne plus grande afin de faire un stock plus consistant de pétrole et répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Construction of a tank and buying fuel oil

loans.name: Brice

texts.en:
Brice D. is married, the father of three, and is the guardian for two of his brothers. He is a mechanic by training and has demonstrated a good mastery of his trade. The quality of his work is what has won him a good reputation in his neighborhood and beyond. Very energetic and a go-getter, he has noticed that there is not one single shop selling spare parts in his area while the need for them exists. He would like to seize the opportunity to establish one next-door to his shop. This would provide him with extra income and allow him to better ensure the education of his children and apprenticeships for his brothers.

This is why he is requesting a loan of $850 which will serve to buy tools and to build an inventory of spare parts. The loan will allow him to increase his income in support of his family’s welfare.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Brice est marié et père de trois (03) enfants et a à sa charge deux (02) de ses frères. Il est mécanicien de formation et fait preuve d’une bonne maîtrise de son métier. La qualité de ses prestations lui confère une bonne réputation dans son quartier et ses environs. Très dynamique et pleine d’initiatives, il s’aperçoit qu’il n’y a pas une boutique de vente de pièces détachée dans son quartier alors que les besoins et existent. Il veut saisir cette opportunité pour mettre à côté de son atelier, une petite boutique de vente des pièces détachées qui peut lui procurer des revenus complémentaires lui permettant de mieux assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et l’apprentissage de ses frères.

C’est ainsi qu’il sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui servir de d’acheter de petit outillage et de s’approvisionner en pièces détachées. Ce crédit lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus pour le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy tools and sell spare parts

loans.name: Amélé Elisabeth

texts.en:
Amélé Elisabeth H. has been married for over twenty years. In addition to her six children, she takes care of her mum. They all add to her household expenses. Nevertheless, her courage and energy have allowed her to keep selling beignets (a kind of doughnut) for 13 years, there on the roadside, to supplement her husband’s small salary. Despite her grade-school level of education, Ms. H. has a keen sense for managing loans and is very frugal. Naturally honest through and through, she embodies trust and deserves financial support.

Elisabeth is currently requesting a loan of $500 to buy a larger quantity of flour, which is the primary ingredient in preparing beignets. She would also like to acquire various goods to offer for sale. The loan will allow her to better take care of her children’s needs with regards to health, nourishment, and schooling. It will also raise her family’s living standard.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame H. Amélé Elisabeth est une femme mariée depuis une vingtaine d’années. En plus de ses six (06) enfants, elle a en charge sa maman, ce qui accroît ses dépenses familiales. Néanmoins, son courage et son dynamisme lui ont permis depuis 13 ans de vendre des beignets aux abords des routes pour accompagner le petit salaire de son mari. Malgré son niveau d’instruction primaire, Madame H. Amélé Elisabeth a un sens aigu de la gestion de crédits et une notion approfondie d’épargne. Dotée d’une honnêteté parfaite elle nourrit confiance et mérite d’être financièrement soutenus.

Elisabeth sollicite aujourd’hui ce crédit de $500 pour acheter une quantité plus importante de farine de blé, matière première de base à la préparation des beignets et acheter pour revente de divers produits. Ce crédit lui permettra de mieux s’occuper de besoins de santé, de nourriture, de scolarité de ses enfants et relever le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy flour to make and sell beignets

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine F. got married to a teacher with whom she had three children. She also looks after a little brother and three sisters, who are in apprenticeships. Her husband’s salary cannot cover the bills, so she is compelled to help him with income from selling ice water and fruit juice. She has had this business, which she names «Espérance» (Hope), for five years and has been doing well in it. She is a very disciplined woman with regards to management and has proven to be honest and trustworthy by successfully repaying an initial loan of $250 without a problem.

She is requesting another loan, in the amount of $550, which will allow her to acquire sugar, fruit, and other ingredients for making juice and ice water. The success of her plans will augment her production and therefore increase her income for the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame F. Justine s’est mariée à un enseignant avec qui elle a trois (03) enfants et a à sa charge 1 petit frère et 3 sœurs en apprentissage. Le salaire de son mari ne pouvant pas couvrir les charges, elle est dans l’obligation de contribuer en aidant son mari avec les revenus de vente d’eau glacée et du jus de fruit. Cela fait 5 ans qu’elle exerce ce commerce qu’elle maîtrise assez bien. Elle est femme très rigoureuse en matière de gestion et a fait preuve de femme d’honnêteté et de confiance à travers son premier crédit de $250 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé sans incident.

Elle sollicite un second crédit de $550 qui va lui permettre de s’acheter du sucre, fruits, et autres matières qui entrent dans la fabrication du jus et de l’eau glacée. La réalisation de projet augmentera sa production et de facto accroîtra ses revenus pour le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy sugar and fruit to make fruit juice and to sell ice water.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Abla Z. has been married for 13 years to a taxi driver, and they have four children. She is practically a professional when it comes to producing and marketing cassava flour and tapioca. She has derived a great deal of experience from this business of hers, which she had before getting married. And she has proved herself to be a good manager. Yet she is no longer able to meet the expectations of her customers due to a lack of capital funds and thus is always short on inventory. This situation might create a crisis of trust with her customers if she cannot gain financial support.

To avoid this problem, Ms. Z. is requesting a loan of $550 to buy fields of cassava plants (the source of both cassava flour and tapioca) in order to develop her business, which she calls «Le Pétit Grain» (The Little Bead) and extend it to Lomé, the capitol. The loan will allow her to augment her income to better ensure the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Z. Abla s’est mariée depuis 13 ans à un conducteur de taxi. De leur union, sont nés quatre (04) enfants. Elle est une véritable professionnelle dans la production et la commercialisation du gari et de tapioca. Cette activité qu’elle exerce avant son mariage lui procure une large expérience et elle fait preuve d’une bonne gestionnaire. Toutefois, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle elle est toujours en rupture de stock à cause de l’insuffisance de son capital. Cette situation risque de créer une crise de confiance avec ses clients si elle ne bénéficie pas d’un appui financier.

Pour ce faire, Madame Z. Abla sollicite un crédit de $550 pour acheter des champs de manioc (matières de premières de base à la production du gari et de tapioca) en vue d’accroître ses activités et diriger son commerce ver Lomé. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux assurer le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cassava fields an to produce cassava flour and tapioca.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en:
Married to a primary school teacher for ten years, Kossiwa F. has three children and also takes care of her mother. Her husband lost his salary 18 months ago, and she feels compelled to cover all family expenses with her income from selling various manufactured goods. Her primary-school education gives her insight into management, and she exhibits a dynamism in her activities. She embodies trust and deserves financial support.

She is requesting a loan of $550 to augment her purchasing power towards selling manufactured products, such as shoes and sandals. Her goal is to increase her income and to better provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à un enseignant du primaire depuis 10 ans, Madame F. Kossiwa a trois (03) enfants et sa mère en charge. Son mari est sans salaire il y a 18 mois et elle se voit dans l’obligation de prendre toutes les charges familiales avec les revenus de la vente des divers produits manufacturés. Son niveau d’instruction primaire lui confère une clairvoyance dans sa gestion et un dynamisme dans ses activités. Elle nourrit confiance et mérite d’être appuyée financièrement.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $550 dans le but d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et de vente des produits manufacturés afin d’accroître ses revenus et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell shoes and sandals

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ablavi A. is the mother of three children who are still in school. Her husband's retirement pension does not ensure that family needs are totally covered. So Ms. A. is obliged to contribute to their household income by selling corn and sodabi (a local distilled palm wine). Having a good handle on her business, she is doing well. But her capital funds are quite insufficient to develop her business. No longer able to meet the expectations of her customers with the funds that she has, she is therefore requesting a loan of $650 as capital to build a substantial stock of corn and sodabi. The loan will allow her to raise her economic and social living standard for the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Ablavi est mère de trois (03) enfants encore en scolarité. Les pensions de retraite de son mari n’assurent pas une totale couverture des besoins de la famille. Alors Madame A. est obligée de contribuer à partir des revenus de son commerce de maïs et de sodabi (boisson locale à base de palmier). Maîtrisant bien son activité, elle arrive à bien s’en sortir. Mais, son fonds de commerce est très insuffisant pour développer et accroître ses activités. Ainsi, ne pouvant plus satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle avec ses propres moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce à faire un stockage consistant de maïs et de sodabi. Ce crédit lui permettra d’élever son niveau économique et social pour le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and stock corn and sodabi

loans.name: Qandi Gul

texts.en:
Qandi Gul is a 39 year old widow with 3 of her children living in Distrit 15 of Kabul City, her original place is the North of Afghanistan where the place was extremely damaged during the 5 years of Taliban Gov, she lost her Husband and the whole house 7 years ago.

She got AFSG first loan to make more hand embroidery and peral sewing to design women and girls dresses for wedding and other special occasions.

loans.use: To buy the sewing supplies, Fabric and peral to make dresses

loans.name: Anis Gul

texts.en:
Anis Gul is a widow of 41 years old with her 11 children. She is a baker who is making bread in her house in a small Tandor (Local Stove) and then her son and her small daughter sell them in the street.

She also accepts orders from her clients to make breads from the dough that they bring. She is mainly from Shamali where there was war for almost 30 years and she lost everything there and now she is living in Kabul.

loans.use: To buy Flour to make dough for baking bread

loans.name: Bibi Sadaf

texts.en:
Bi Bi Sadaf is 50 years old with her 5 children living in District 2 of Kabul City. She is a widow who passed almost 10 years of her life in poverty and living through very difficult times.

She lost her husband due to his sickness while she did not have money to take him to the Doctor. She hopes to receive her first loan through AFSG so she can process and package the vegetable and fresh fruit and her son is selling them on a small hand cart.

loans.use: To buy Vegetable and Fresh fruit

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: CHARLES K. lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam. He is 55 years old and married with four children. Charles is a retired civil servant. He owns a bar and guest house near a bus terminal with buses to the southern regions of Tanzania. His business is well situated. The guest house is usually filled with customers who spend a night before they get on the buses the next day. The house has a section used as a bar where guests can have different kinds of drinks. He built this guest house from retirement benefits accrued to him for the years he served as a civil servant. He employs six people in his business. He himself keeps the finances, while his wife takes care of daily operations. The business is the sole income generating unit for the family. He wants to improve the business by adding enough sitting chairs, tables, bedsheets, and curtains. He also wants to buy a storage tank for reserving water in case of irregular public water supply. To implement his plan, Charles is in need of $1000.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, bedsheets, and curtains

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: LEONARD L. is 52 years old and married with five children. He lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam. L. owns and runs a refreshment center located near his residence. He is a retired civil servant, and the business is the sole income generating unit for the family. In his center, he sells cold drinks, alcoholic drinks, and different kinds of snacks. His center is used by the people of the area as a place to refresh themselves after working hours. He has a plan to improve the business by stockpiling enough drinks and, more importantly, sitting chairs and tables. He experienced a shortage of chairs and tables during the time around Christmas. He does not like to lose as many customers as he lost during Christmas due to insufficient chairs and tables. He also wants to buy a pool table to make his center even attractive. Pool has become very popular nowadays in Dar es Salaam. People travel a long way to find places to play pool. To make his plan work, L. is in need of $1000.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and serving vessels

loans.name: Chacha

texts.en:
CHACHA M. is 33 years old and married with two children. He keeps chickens(layers) in huts built near his residence.

Chacha is planning to add a new flock of chicks, as the existing flock is soon to be culled (taken out of the hut). For this strategy, he will need to add a stock of chicken feed and medications. Raising chicks up to the time when they start laying eggs needs a lot of investment, both in terms of money and time. Chacha has employed two assistants in his business who take care of the chickens while he supplies eggs to his customers. He wants to expand the business by increasing the number of chickens kept from the 600 birds he usually keeps to 1000 birds. The expansion strategy also needs some funding. To implement his plans, Chacha needs $750.

loans.use: To buy chicks, chicken feed, and medications

loans.name: David

texts.en: DAVID L. lives in Yombo-Vituka in the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children. Two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. David owns a small pharmacy near his residence selling human medications. He has six years' experience in this business. His business is licenced by the authorities. He frequently faces shortages of medications for malaria and water contamination diseases like cholera, typhoid, and amoebiasis. The situation is intense, especially during the rainy periods. Dar es Salaam is now in the rainy season. He is in need of $750 to replenish his stock.

loans.use: To increase the stock of medications

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Teresa has been divorced for some time. She has two children and she lives in the city of Kanasin in Yucatan. She saw the need to start a business that would permit her to support her children, as her ex-husband did not help them with their expenses. Following this difficult situation, Maria Teresa started two years ago with a small grocery store, and to increase her earnings she started a movie rental. She found that movie rentals were in great demand to she decided to set up her Video club, a business that she has managed for the past two years, and it has been improving thanks to her efforts and arduous work.

Her integrity and responsibility are the qualities that define Maria Teresa. She now requires a loan in the amount of $925 to purchase movies and be able to have more new releases and improve her income. Your generosity can be a great help for her. Do not doubt any longer and support her. She and her children will forever thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María Teresa es divorciada desde hace algún tiempo, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la localidad de Kanasín, Yucatán. Ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le permitirá sostener a sus hijos, ya que el su ex esposo no le ayuda con los gastos. Frente a esta difícil situación, Maria Teresa comenzó hace dos años con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y para incrementar sus ingresos decidió rentar películas, ella vio que la renta de películas tenía mucha demanda y se decidió a poner un Video club, con este negocio lleva más de 2 años y ha mejorado gracias a su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo.

La entereza y la responsabilidad son cualidades que definen a María Teresa, ella ahora requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS par comprar un lote de películas y así poder tener más estrenos y mejorar sus ingresos. Tu generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para ella, no lo dudes más y apóyala, ella y sus hijos te lo van agradecer siempre.

loans.use: purchase movies

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Agustina started selling cosmetics to have an income as she was widowed 16 years ago. She also provides house cleaning and little by little, with her efforts as her foundation, she started increasing her cosmetic sales. Her strongest motivation has been the great love she feels for her four children. Despite the difficult times she face when her husband passed away, she aged to keep going and fought for the sake of her family.

Now Maria Agustina requires a loan of $475 that she will use to purchase a display cabinet for her products. You can become a fundamental part of her effots and those of her family. Do not hesitate, remember that they need you and they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María Agustina empezó a vender cosméticos por la necesidad de tener un ingreso ya que enviudó hace 16 años. Ella también se dedica a hacer limpieza en casas particulares y poco a poco con base a su esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos con su venta de cosméticos. El principal impulso de ella ha sido el gran amor que le tiene a sus cuatro hijos. A pesar de los difíciles momentos que enfrentó cuando su esposo falleció ella supo seguir y luchar por su familia.

Ahora María Agustina requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de una vidriera de exhibición para la presentación de sus productos. Tú puedes convertirte en parte fundamental de los logros de ella y su familia, no lo sudes más, recuerda que ellos te necesitan y te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase cabinet

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
Guloglan is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan region. He is married. He settled with family and 3 children in Sumgait city. 43-year-old Guloglan started his business 9 years ago. His first loan was $700, bought 3 calves. The loans were paid back timely.
Now he is planning to buy 4 calves. Guloglan applies for a loan amounting 1000$.

loans.use: He is planning to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence Y. is a 40 year old woman who is married and has 6 children.  She lives in a semi-urban area in the Edo State in Nigeria, and she runs a small food market in her community.  Florence hopes to use her loan to buy more goods and increase her business growth.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store

loans.name: Abunoya

texts.en: Mrs. Abunoya I. is 33 years old.  She owns a small store in the Edo State of Nigeria that sells general provisions such as food and cooking supplies.  Abunoya is seeking a loan for the expansion of her business. She is married and has four children.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Amezee

texts.en: Mrs. Amezee E. is a 29 year old woman who lives in a semi-urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria.  She sells soft drinks at her own store.  Amezee spent 2 months learning her trade before she decided to start her own business. She would like to use a loan to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Mrs. Taiwo I. is 41 years old.  She is married and has one child. Taiwo lives in an urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria, and she owns a tailoring business. She completed two years of  training to learn how to sew clothes, and then she opened her own business. A loan will help Taiwo buy more material to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Mrs. Monica A. is 38 years old, and is married with 3 children.  She lives in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Nigeria where she sells firewood to her friends and neighbors.  Monica cherishes her business very much. A loan will help her purchase more firewood and expand her business so that she can help support her family.

loans.use: to improve on her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: A mother of three children, Mrs. Rose O. lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She owns a store, and has been in business for five years.  Rose sells provisions and food items to the public. She is looking forward to getting a loan to improve her business by purchasing more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods for expansion

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Adesuwa O. is 34 years old, and is married with two children.  She lives in an urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria, and owns a clothing store. Adesuwa spent five months learning her trade before she started her own business in 2005. She would like a loan to increase her inventory and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: A 25 year old experienced trader, Mrs. Grace I. sells clothes to the people of her community.  She owns her own store entitled Grace Bouquet.   Grace would like a loan so that she can increase her inventory and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tomato farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tomato farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tomato farming business

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: A 38 year old experienced business woman, Mrs. Mabel O. sells building materials to the public. She is married with four children and she hails from Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. A loan will help Mabel purchase more building supplies to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another knapsack sprayer for rental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to build a cow shed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth E. specializes in the sale of "baby items" such as clothes and toys.  She is 39 years old and a mother of four children. She plans to expand her business with a loan.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock his boutique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use as a taxi

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is married. 33-year Kamil is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Kamil has been engaged in newspaper sales and an lottery sales, to improve his family’s living condition. Having borrowed the 2 loans from Normicro he solved his business problems.
Now he plans to sell office supplies. He applies for a loan amount of $700 to buy the different office supplies.

loans.use: To buy the different office supplies

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 36. He married and has 3 children. Since 2005 he has been engaged in newspaper sales and an lottery sales. Having borrowed the loan amount of $300 from Normicro he has bought the newspaper store. The second time he borrowed $300.
He applies for the loan $500 to rent the grocery store and buy writing materials.

loans.use: To rent the grocery store and buy writing materials

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. Sakina is 47 years old and has 3 children. She is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning hers business she rented a small cafe. Having borrowed the loan from Kiva she wants to buy the new chairs, tables and to expand the area of hers cafe. On a dinner break workers have dinner here and clients are very happy with the servant.
She applies for the loan $400 to buy the new chairs and to expand the area of hers cafe.

loans.use: To buy the new chairs and to expand the area of hers cafe

loans.name: Dilgam

texts.en:
43-year-old Dilgam with his 4 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Lachin region. Since 2002 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed first loans of amount $500 he significantly expanded his business, bought the new ax and the scales. The loans were paid back timely.
Now Dilgam wants the loan in amount  $800 to build own butcher shop.

loans.use: To build own butcher shop

loans.name: Khaiyam

texts.en:
Khaiyam has been engaged in food distribution and sales for the past five years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Jabrail region, relocated to Sumgait city. He is 39 years old with two children. He has his own mini market. He borrowed a loan of $500 from Normicro in order to build the grocery store. The second loan he borrowed of $800 was used to purchase foodstuffs like sugar, tea, rice, etc. 
Now Khaiyam wants another loan for $1200 to increase his inventory and to provide his customers with more product options.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Mawulé

texts.en:
Mawulé A. is married and the mother of four. Her husband barely grows enough to feed his family. You see, this household is confronted daily with hardship of all sorts, notably hunger and sickness. To help with household expenses, Ms. A. has started a small business selling food crops. She has now gained a great deal of experience allowing her to really grasp the inner workings of the business. Thanks to her heightened sense of management, she was been able to repay each loan that she has obtained.

Today, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $650 to augment her ability keep an inventory of goods to sell in times of shortages. The loan will serve as capital to buy, stock, and sell food crops. The success of her dreams will be very beneficial, particularly in terms of savings. She will also succeed at better providing for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Mawulé est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari pratique une agriculture de subsistance qui suffit à peine pour l’alimentation de la famille. Du coup, le ménage est confronté quotidiennement aux difficultés de tout genre notamment la faim et la maladie. Pour contribuer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille, Madame A. a entrepris le petit commerce de vente des produits vivriers. Aujourd’hui, elle a acquis une grande expérience qui lui permet de bien cerner les rouages de son activité. Grâce à son sens élevé de gestion, elle a pu rembourser tous les crédits qu’elle a obtenus.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Mawulé sollicite un crédit de $650 pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage afin de vendre ses produits en temps de pénurie. Le crédit servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente des produits vivriers. La réalisation de ce rêve lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’épargne. Aussi, réussira t-elle à mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, stock, and sell produce

loans.name: Yéwéwoto

texts.en:
Married and the mother of three, Yéwéwoto G. makes gari (cassava flour), one of the staples of southern Togo for over thirty years. Despite being in her sixties, her experience and energy are undeniable. Her husband lost his ability to work which leaves Ms. G. to face paying the bills by herself. The quality of her product has earned her a large customer base because good women come from Lomé to buy her gari. But without enough money, her production of gari is very limited, and her customers are increasingly disappointed. She is now dealing with a strong demand that she cannot meet. Making gari is difficult, given the high risk of injury, particularly when grating the cassava root by hand. Today, she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy a grater in order to increase her production and her profit margin, all to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame G. Yéwéwoto produit du gari (farine à base de manioc), l’un des aliments de base au Sud du Togo depuis une trentaine d’années. Malgré sa soixantaine, elle possède une expérience et un dynamisme impeccable. Son mari a perdu sa force de travail ; ce qui laisse Madame G. seule devant les charges du ménage. La qualité de sa production lui a procuré une clientèle importante car les bonnes femmes viennent depuis Lomé pour acheter son gari. Mais n’ayant pas assez de moyens sa production est très limitée et les clients sont de plus en plus déçus. Elle fait face aujourd’hui à une forte demande qu’elle est incapable de satisfaire. La fabrication du gari est une activité très pénible avec tous les risques de blessures que cela comporte surtout avec le râpage manuel du manioc. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $600 qui servira à l’achat d’une râpeuse afin d’accroître sa production et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a grater

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ablavi K. is a young woman who has been married since 1995. She is the mother of four. Besides her four children, she also takes care of her retired elderly parents. Her husband, a farmer, does not have a steady income that would allow him to effectively support the family. The children are often sent home from class because the tuition goes unpaid. Ms. K. is compelled to diversify her business because she must cover a big share of household expenses. So, aside from her work in the fields, she makes rope and sells it at the marketplace. She would now like to improve her business, which she names "La Fileuse du Village" (The Village Weaver) but lacks the money to acquire the materials for her work. She is requesting a loan of $600 for raw materials in sizable amounts to make rope.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Ablavi est une jeune dame mariée depuis 1995 et mère de quatre (04) enfants. En dehors de ses enfants, elle prend en charge ses parents inactifs à cause de leur âge avancé. Son mari qui est un cultivateur n’a pas un revenu fixe qui lui permet de subvenir efficacement aux besoins de la famille. Les enfants sont souvent renvoyés de l’école pour non payement des frais de scolarité. Madame K. qui doit prendre une grande part dans les charges du ménage est obligée de diversifier ses activités. Ainsi, en dehors des travaux champêtres, elle tisse des cordes qu’elle vend au marché.

Aujourd’hui elle veut améliorer cette activité mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour l’acquisition du matériel de travail. Elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $600 qui va servir à l’acquisition en quantité du matériel nécessaire pour le tissage des cordes.

loans.use: To acquire materials to make rope

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosemary would like to buy foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emily would like to buy 5 boxes of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Ayémiahé

texts.en:
Ayémiahé D. has been a widow for five years. Her deceased husband left her with three children that she supports in addition to her parents. To feed her family, she started a business selling common chickens. She is especially courageous and worries about making sure her children are educated. So she works tirelessly going from village to village to look for chickens to sell back in town. But since family expenses have grown more and more onerous, Ms. D. just cannot go any further. And so she is asking for help to improve her business. Her skill and honesty has resulted in more business than she can handle. She is therefore requesting a loan of $850 to enlarge her chicken coop and to serve as capital to do trade in chickens. The profits gained from this activity will allow her to provide for her orphaned children. She will also be able to save more money to improve her financial situation.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Ayémiahé est veuve depuis 5 ans. Son mari défunt a laissé à sa charge trois (03) enfants qu’elle supporte en plus de ses parents. Pour pouvoir nourrir sa famille, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des poulets ordinaires. Particulièrement courageuse et soucieuse d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants, elle travaille sans relâche en allant de village en village pour rechercher des poulets qu’elle vient revendre en ville. Mais les charges de la famille devenant de plus en plus lourdes, Madame D. n’en peut plus et demande un appui pour pouvoir améliorer son commerce. Son habileté et son honnêteté font que la demande est plus forte que l’offre. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $850 qui va servir à agrandir son poulailler et disposer de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des poulets ordinaires. Les bénéfices tirés de cette activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins des orphelins. Aussi arrivera t-elle à mieux épargner afin d’accroître son économie.

loans.use: To enlarge the chicken coop, and to do trade in chickens.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Ms N. is a single mother of 4 children. The eldest daughter is marries while the other 3 are still in school. She deals in new clothes moving from one market to another over the week.  She has been doing this kind of business for over 20 years. Hence she is well experienced in it. This is the first time she has taken a loan to boost her business. The loan of US$528/450 will be used to boost her stock which has been eroded with the payments of school fees in the month of January. She will also be able to sustain her stock longer as she is now forced to keep on traveling to the city to restock.  Ms N. is supporting the local economy  through her business.

loans.use: Buy Clothing Stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah would like to buy chicks

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Mr MICHAEL K. is a pastor of a local church (Full Gospel). He is married with 3 children. His eldest girl is married. In addition to his pastoral duties, he is also a farmer specializing in raising pigs. The loan of $225 to Mr K. is intended to purchase feed for his growing stock. Once they mature, they are sold to one of the major meat processing companies. The project is intended also to act as a training ground for his church members as a way of empowering them economically. Pastor K. is therefore providing an important service to the local community, and this is a project that deserves our support by PEMCI.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan wants to buy more stock of foodstuff

loans.name: John

texts.en: JOHN B. is an O-level leaver, married with four children. Prior to his current venture, he used to perform clearing & forwarding of cargo trucks at the Kenya-Uganda border. He started his business from capital raised through friends and family in 2003. His first loan of $143 from PEMCI enabled him to move into a permanent location (shop) unlike before, when he was in a kiosk. With a second loan of $300, he plans to increase the stock of parts in his new shop. Mr B. is also involved in a network marketing of a Chinese health product TIASH, which supplements his income. He is a well respected member of the local community.

loans.use: To stock a Cycle-Mart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice would like to buy 3 more steers

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en:
A married mother of six (6) children, Mrs. A. Véronique is well known for selling groceries in her region. Her husband is the community "taxi" driver. However, even with her husband's work, Mrs. Véronique A. is responsible for taking care of most of her family's needs. Very intelligent and practical, she is a woman people look up to in her community. Mrs. Alidjiso has proven to be an honest and trustworthy woman and has reimbursed her first two loans.

She is asking for a new loan of $700, to be able to increase her inventory and, as a result, her income. This loan could also have a very positive impact on her and her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, Madame A. Véronique est réputée dans la vente de denrées alimentaires dans sa localité.
