L’activité principale de son mari est la conduite de véhicule de transport en commun « Taxi ». Malgré la fonction du mari, Madame A. Véronique a en charge presque la totalité des besoins de la famille. Très intelligente et très bien appliquée, elle reste l’une des femmes de référence dans sa localité. Madame A. a fait preuve d’honnêteté et de femme de confiance à travers les remboursements sans incidents de ses deux premiers crédits obtenus. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $700 afin de pouvoir augmenter le niveau de stockage de ses produits et par conséquent de son rendement. Ce crédit pourrait ainsi avoir un impact très positif sur son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy 3 more steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Celina wants to buy 3 more steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to buy 3 more steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Amento

texts.en:
Mr. H. Amento is a very dynamic man. A married father with four (4) children, he manages a mill he set up himself thanks to a $450 credit that was subsequently reimbursed. This initiative allowed him, with the assistance of his wife, a salesperson, to feed his children and provide them with an education.

Now, in Mr. H. Amentos' community, there is a great need for a spice mill and he would like to provide it to his people. However, he does not have the money needed for this new project. He is asking for an $850 loan to build this new mill. The loan will help Mr. H. to take better care of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Amento est un homme très dynamique. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il gère un moulin qu’il a installé lui-même grâce à un crédit de $450 qu’il a obtenu et remboursé sans incident. Cette activité lui permet, avec le concours de sa femme, revendeuse, de nourrir les enfants et d’assurer leur scolarité. Aujourd’hui, un grand besoin de moulin à condiments se fait sentir dans la localité et Monsieur H. Amento se propose d’en mettre un à la disposition des populations. Mais il n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour ce nouveau projet. Il sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $850 pour l’acquisition d’un moulin à condiments. Comme impact, ce crédit permettra à Monsieur H. de mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.

loans.use: to acquire a spice mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice would like to buy more packs of sweets, biscuits, cakes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start dairy farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy packs of sweets, chocolates, cakes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa was born in Yardimli region of Azerbaijan. After death of the husband they have moved in Sumgait. She is 39 and has 1 child. She runs a small Cafe that she started when she found herself in the despair not having the support for her family that was once provided by her husband before his passing. Of course, the struggle has not been at all easy, but with work and effort they have been able to make it through. They need you and they thank you.
Now Latifa needs a loan of $700 to purchase ingredients that she uses to make the foods she sells in her small Cafe.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients that she uses to make the foods she sells in her small Cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose would like to buy two bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Sokandé

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Sokandé has been married to a farmer for twenty years and together they have six (6) children. Sokandé is a very active woman, and her work involves making and selling doughnuts. Her husband's farming does not bring in sufficient funds to support the family, so she tries to contribute to the family's needs with her small income. Her children are now older and their needs are greater, so Mrs. E. would like to increase the revenue of her business.

This is why she is asking for a loan of $700 that would help her buy more supplies for the production and sale of her doughnuts. The sales income will benefit her entire family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame E. Sokandé est mariée à un cultivateur depuis une vingtaine d’années et mère de six (06) enfants. Femme très active, elle fait comme activité principale la production et la vente des beignets. L’activité de son mari (agriculture) ne permet pas de couvrir la totalité des charges de la famille. Elle contribue donc avec son petit revenu à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Mais aujourd’hui que les enfants sont devenus grands, les charges sont devenus plus grandes et Madame E. cherche les moyens pour améliorer son activité et par conséquent son revenu. C’est dans ce sens qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui va lui permettre d’acheter et de stocker des matières premières en vue de la production et la vente des beignets. Les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de la vente des beignets seront destinés à la satisfaction de besoins de la famille.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling doughnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur was born in 1975 year in Sumgait. After graduation secondary school he could not act  Unirersity. Because the family condition was very heavy. He is only breadwinner in family. This 31-year-old man lives with his parents. Zaur has rented very small place near the market, has been busy with repair of mobile phones and sales of phone accessories. 
He applies for the loan $700 to expand his business area.

loans.use: To expand his business area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy varieties of cereal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a house and start farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grain business and start farming

loans.name: Ayéwa

texts.en:
A married mother of 2, Ms. Ayéwa A. is in the business of retail rice sales in her locale. Her husband, a bike mechanic, is unable to meet the needs of his family as he does not have a shop. The majority of the family’s expenses are covered by Ms. Ayéwa A.. She therefore feels obligated to increase her efforts to fulfill her responsibilities to her family. To acheive this, she has but one wish: to improve her business. Dynamic and sincere, she has managed numerous loans with a prompt attitude toward repayment.

Ms. A. is asking for a loan of $700 in order to increase her rice stocks and satisfy her ever-growing clientele. The receipt of this loan will be very beneficial to her in that she will be able to increase her income and achieve true financial independence.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, Madame A. Ayéwa exerce comme activité la vente du riz en détail dans sa localité. Son mari, un mécanicien à deux roues n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille car n’ayant pas d’atelier. La plupart des dépenses de la famille sont à la charge de Madame A. Ayéwa. Elle se sent donc obligée de redoubler d’ardeur pour être à la hauteur de ses responsabilités familiales. Pour cela, elle n’a qu’un seul désir : améliorer son commerce. Dynamique et sincère, elle a eu à gérer plusieurs crédits avec une attitude prompte dans les remboursements.

Madame A. sollicite un crédit de $700 en vue d’augmenter son stock de riz et satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse. L’octroi de ce crédit lui sera très bénéfique en ce sens qu’elle augmentera son revenu pour une véritable autonomie financière.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Dotsè

texts.en:
Mr. Dotsè H. is a married father of five (5) children. His primary business activity is shoe manufacturing and repair. His wife, reduced to being a simple housewife, has no ability to contribute to the household. Mr. H. is solely responsible for providing for the needs of the family. As generous as he is charitable, he provides free training to a group of very poor young men in his shop and provides benefits for his apprentices such as healthcare and lunch. His shop is very well frequented due to the quality of his work, but he is in dire need of materials to better meet the demands of his clients.

Mr. Dotsè H. is asking for a loan of $850 to purchase a machine and acquire shoe manufacturing materials in order to increase his clientele and improve his services. Realizing this ambition will benefit him greatly, particularly with regard to increasing his income.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Dotsè est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants. Il a pour activité principale la fabrication et la réparation des chaussures. Sa femme, réduite à une simple ménagère n’a aucune capacité de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Monsieur H. se bat seul pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Aussi généreux que charitable, il forme gratuitement dans son atelier certains garçons très nécessiteux et subvient à certains besoins de ses apprentis comme la santé et le déjeuner. Son atelier est très bien fréquenté à cause de la qualité de son travail mais il manque cruellement de matériels pour mieux répondre aux exigences de ses clients.

Monsieur H. Dotsè sollicite ce crédit de $850 pour s’acheter une machine et s’approvisionner en matériels de fabrication de chaussures pour élargir la liste de sa clientèle et améliorer sa prestation de service. La réalisation de cette ambition lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’augmentation de son revenu.

loans.use: Purchase a machine and acquire materials for manufacturing shoes

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
48-year-old Zahid with his 2 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Agdam region. Since 2003 Zahid has been engaged in cheese making to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 2 loans ($400; $700;) from Normicro he significantly expanded his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back timely. 
Now Zahid needs a loan of $1000 to rent the food market.

loans.use: To rent the food market

loans.name: Agnès

texts.en:
Ms. Agnès A. is a young married mother of three (3) children. A hair stylist by profession, she has opened a salon which she manages efficiently and has a team of apprentices. Her husband, a bike mechanic, is not financially able to adequately cover the family’s expenses. Quite the entrepreneur, Ms. A. has now expanded her styling business to include the sale of beauty products. The additional revenue allows her to provide for the needs of her household. Her excellent level of service has resulted in a marked increase in the demand for her salon. She would like to implement a plan to improve the speed and sophistication of her work. For this purpose she needs modern and more efficient materials. For this reason, Ms. A. is asking for a loan of $850 to better equip the salon and meet her clients’ expectations.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Agnès est une jeune femme mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a ouvert un salon qu’elle gère avec efficacité et dispose des apprenties. Son mari, un mécanicien à 2 roues n’a pas une situation financière lui permettant d’assumer convenablement les charges de la famille. Très entreprenante, Madame A. joint aujourd’hui à son métier de coiffure, le commerce des produits de beauté. Ce qui lui procure des revenus complémentaires pour subvenir aux besoins de son foyer. Cette bonne prestation de services a entraîné une forte augmentation de la demande dans son salon. Elle souhaite mettre en place un dispositif pour un travail plus rapide et plus raffiné. Pour cela, il lui faut du matériel moderne et plus performant. C’est dans ce sens que Madame A. sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $850 pour pouvoir mieux équiper le salon et répondre à l’attente de ses clientes.

loans.use: Beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Ms. Antoinette G. is a mother of three (3) children. Born to poor parents, she takes care of her mother and her two younger sisters. Her business is the sale of food in schools. Thanks to this business, she somehow manages to feed her children. She has a great deal of experience in saving money, managing loans and has a good understanding of all the aspects of her business.

She would like to increase the amount of food she prepares by buying bags of rice, corn and other necessary items to meet the demand, particularly during the school year. For this purpose, she is seeking a loan of $750. Realizing this project will have a very positive effect on her financial situation and will allow her to take good care of her family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Antoinette est mère d’une famille de trois (3) enfants. Née de parents pauvres, elle prend en charge sa mère et ses deux petites sœurs. Elle a pour activité la vente des denrées alimentaires dans les établissements scolaires. Grâce à cette activité, elle parvient tant bien que mal à nourrir ses enfants. Elle possède d’énormes expériences en matière d’épargne, de gestion de crédit et cerne tous les rouages de son activité.

Elle compte augmenter son travail de préparation de ses denrées : acheter des sacs de riz, de maïs et autres nécessaires afin d’être à la hauteur de la demande surtout en ce milieu d’année académique. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $750. La réalisation de ce projet aura un effet très positif sur son économie et lui permettra de bien s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice, corn and other goods for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Charlotte A.

texts.en:
A married mother of two (2) children, Ms. Charlotte A. E. cares for the young daughter of one of her older brothers. Her business is the sale of food products. She is a dynamic woman and a fighter who works hard for the success of her children. Her husband is a woodworker with no shop and is obliged to help his friends on construction sites. This does not provide him with consistent income to cover household expenses. It is therefore Ms. E. who supports the majority of the family's needs thanks to her commercial activities. Rigorous in the management of her business, she has demonstrated exemplary promptness in the repayment of her loans. She is looking today to improve her business and is asking for financial support. She is therefore seeking a loan of $850 to increase her product stock levels and improve her revenue, which will result in better living conditions for her family.

Translated from [language] by [your name], Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, Madame E. A. Charlotte a à sa charge une petite fille d’un de ses grands frères. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des produits alimentaires. C’est une femme combative et dynamique qui travaille avec ardeur pour la réussite de ses enfants. Son mari qui est un menuisier n’a pas d’atelier et est obligé d’aider ses amis sur des chantiers. Ce qui ne lui procure pas un revenu consistant pour couvrir les charges du ménage. C’est donc Madame E. qui supporte la grande partie des besoins de la famille grâce à son commerce. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de son activité, elle a fait preuve d’une promptitude exemplaire dans le remboursement de ses crédits. Elle cherche aujourd’hui à améliorer son activité et demande un appui financier. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $850 pour pouvoir augmenter le niveau de stock de ses produits et améliorer son revenu qui se traduira par de meilleures conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase stock levels of food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Basile

texts.en:
Mr. Basile S. is a teacher by profession. After 2 years, he abandoned his job for the bakery, as teaching provided him practically no income. A married father of three (3) children, Mr. S. is marrying his second wife after the death of his first. Blessed with a spirit of creativity and a good sense of management, he offers quality service to his clientele. Demand is now very high, and he is researching ways to strengthen his business.

He is asking for a loan in the amount of $850 to install a second oven and expand his sales to other markets in the region. The profits will allow him to care for the health, nourishment and education of his children; in short, to lead a better life.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Basile est enseignant de profession. Depuis 2 ans, il a abandonné son travail au profit de la boulangerie car l’enseignement ne lui rapportait pratiquement rien. Marié et père de trois (3) enfants, Monsieur S. va épouser une seconde femme après le décès de la première. Doté d’un esprit de créativité et d’un sens élevé de gestion, il offre un service de qualité à sa clientèle. Aujourd’hui, la demande est très forte et il recherche des moyens pour renforcer son activité.

Il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $850 pour installer un second four et étendre la vente sur les autres marchés de la région. Les bénéfices serviront à s’occuper de la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants, bref à mener une vie meilleure.

loans.use: Install a second oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Mr. Daniel G. is a married father of five (5) children. His wife helps cover their numerous household expenses through the sale of fruit juices. Mr. G. is a woodworker by profession. He is in high demand by his clientele and offers a level of quality that enchants everyone. His dream now is to purchase high-quality wood in large quantities for building and selling furniture. He is asking for a loan of $700 which will allow him to change his financial situation and adequately meet his family's needs, particularly with regard to health, clothing, nourishment and education.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur G. Daniel est un homme marié et père de cinq (5) enfants. Sa femme contribue aux nombreuses charges du ménage à partir de la vente du jus de fruit. La profession de Monsieur G. est la menuiserie. Très sollicité par sa clientèle, il fait une prestation de qualité qui séduit tout le monde. Aujourd’hui son rêve est de payer du bois en qualité et en quantité très élevée afin de confectionner des meubles et les vendre. Il sollicite un crédit de $700 qui va lui permettre de changer sa situation économique et bien subvenir aux besoins de la famille notamment en matière de santé, habillement, nourriture et scolarité

loans.use: Purchase wood for the construction and sale of furniture

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes has been selling clothes for four years. Before opening her own business, she worked for her sister selling seafood. Her sister had always encouraged her to start her own business, and one day Mercedes decided to take her advice. She set out purchasing clothes that she would eventually sell in her own store. Mercedes made her initial purchases with some money she had saved, and with the generous help of her family and friends. Her store is open 1 p.m. to 6 p.m., thus allowing her to care for her house and family in the mornings.

Mercedes would like a loan so that she can invest in her business, which is now without capital. She will use the loan money to purchase clothes for the beach season, and she is confident this investment will improve her business.

Mercedes is married and has five children. Thanks to her work she has been able to provide education to all of them. Her husband is a mechanic in a workshop in the capital. She hopes that in the future she will be able to repair her house and make it cement- a goal that will make all of her and her husband's struggles worthwhile.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Kreger, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes tiene una experiencia de 4 años en su negocio de venta de ropas. Al principio ella trabajaba vendiendo mariscos con una hermana la que le pagaba. Luego, por iniciativa de su propia hermana, decide comprar ropa para vender ya que algunas personas le habían pedido. Con un dinero que tenía ahorrado lo hace y le ha ido muy bien gracias el esfuerzo de varios familiares que le han ayudado. El negocio lo trabaja desde la 1 p.m. hasta las 6 p.m. ya que en la mañana tiene que dejar haciendo los quehaceres de la casa para su familia.

Mercedes desea el crédito para poder invertir en su negocio el cual esta sin capital y va a comprar ropa para la temporada playera, sabe que con esa inversión le ira mejor.

Mercedes es casada, tiene 5 hijos y gracias a su trabajo le ha logrado dar la educación a todos. Su esposo también trabaja de maestro mecánico en un taller por el centro, desea a futuro poder arreglar su casita y hacerla de cemento, meta que dice la cumplirá con su lucha y junto a su esposo.

loans.use: Invest in warm weather clothing

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has 15 years of work experience. When her husband passed away 15 years ago, she was forced to go to work as a domestic employee to provide for her children. Each day, Julia put aside a portion of the money she earned so that she could eventually open up her own store in her house. Because she wanted her children to grow up alongside her, she took out a loan to launch her own business. Her store is now open from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m., and she works alongside her daughter who lives with her.

Julia would like a new loan so that she can provide for her business that is now low on finances: Recently, Julia's partner had a heart operation, and she paid for many of the expenses. While he is recuperating well, Julia is still low on capital.

Julia is 63 years old, and she has 7 children that help her with the store whenever they can. She would like to be able to improve the facade of her house in order to let more light into the space and bring a better service to her clients. With the help of some credit and her clients, she is sure she will be able to realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Kreger, a Kiva Volunteer.

Julia tiene una experiencia de 15 años trabajando. Su esposo falleció hace quince años lo que la motivo a salir adelante por sus hijos y se inicio trabajando como empleada domestica. Luego todos los días parte del dinero que le daban lo ahorraba y tenia por iniciativa propia ponerse una tienda en su domicilio ya que por ahí no había. La necesidad de que sus hijos crezcan a su lado y estar junto a ellos, hizo que ella realice un préstamo para poner su tienda en su domicilio la que mantiene hasta el día de hoy en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m., la trabajaba junto a una hija que vive con ella.

Julia desea el crédito para poder surtir su negocio ya que esta un desfinanciada por que su actual pareja fue operado del corazón y ella corrió con una parte de los gastos, actualmente el se esta recuperando.

Julia tiene 63 años, y 7 hijos los cuales ya son adultos y le ayudan cuando pueden. Tiene pensado poder hacer una mejora en la fachada de su domicilio como es enlucir el local y parte de la casa de esta manera darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y con la ayuda del crédito y sus ganancias esta segura que lo va ha lograr.

loans.use: Increase the inventory in her store

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar has been selling clothes and shoes for 9 years. Before opening his own business he taught tennis at a local academy where he used to practice with his friend in his free time.

While Cesar was happy with his job, as time passed he decided to leave the tennis academy so that he could dedicate his life to the teachings of Christ. He began preaching at a local penitentiary to the inmates and prison guards, and one day an inmate was admiring the pants he was wearing, and asked him to sell them to him. At this moment, Cesar realized that even inside the prison system there existed a market for the sale of merchandise. He began to bring goods-clothes, shoes, and accessories- with him when he visited the prison, and little by little he established his business. Cesar now visits the prison three days a week, on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays, from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. He is able to both preach, and make a living. In addition, he has two inmates who help him with his business on the weekends, when the demand is highest.

Cesar would like a loan so that he can invest in more merchandise as he has reached a point where the demand for his products outweighs what he is able to supply. He would also like to expand his business to another area of the prison system, but has not been able to yet due to a lack of capital.

Cesar is 40 years old, and has three children who are in school, and help him with the business in their spare time. He is married, and his wife is a nurse. Cesar owns a motorcycle, but would like to buy a car one day to help him transport his goods. He is confident in his business skills, and he knows that with the help of those around him he will continue to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Kreger, a Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar tiene una experiencia de 9 años en la venta de ropa y zapatos. Al comienzo el se inicio como profesor de tenis gracias a un amigo que lo llevo a practicar donde se gano la confianza del dueño y lo contrato para que comience a enseñar en su academia. Luego con el transcurrir del tiempo logra dar un giro a su vida y se convierte a Cristo, lo que lo lleva a predicar la palabra a la Penitenciaria del Litoral en donde están los presos del Ecuador. En ese lugar cierto día lleva un pantalón y un preso le dijo véndemelo a lo que el accedió viendo en ese momento que dentro de ese lugar había potencial de venta. Comenzó a llevar mercadería y al momento ya cuenta con su mercado de clientes, logrando hacer las dos actividades dentro de ese lugar el que lo visita los días miércoles, sábado y domingos desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. Inclusive tiene dos internos que le ayudan con el negocio los fines de semana ya que la demanda es buena.

Cesar desea el crédito para poder invertir en mercadería ya que al momento tiene bastante demanda y desea abrirse a otro sector dentro del Penal pero por falta de capital no lo hace.

Cesar tiene 40 años y tres hijos los cuales estudian y en sus días libres trabajan junto a el ayudándolo en el negocio, su esposa es enfermera particular. Actualmente el cuenta con la moto en la foto pero a futuro desearía comprarse un carro para poder trasladar la mercadería ya que en su moto no puede llevar mucho. El sabe con la ayuda de todos lo va ha lograr.

loans.use: Invest in clothing to sell in local penitentiaries

loans.name: Brenda Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda D. is married and has 5 children of 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years of age. They live in the city of Merida in the State of Yucatan. She started selling shoes after her husband was left unemployed and while he looked for a job. With his severance pay they invested it and started to sell among their family and little by little the business started to grow. It's already been two years since Brenda decided to start her business, whose only objective is to support her husband and her family while going through those difficult times.

Persistence, strength and hard hard, and the great love that Brenda feels for her family, is what has made it possible for them to obtain a daily sustenance. Now she needs a loan of $275 that she will put towards the purchase of more merchandise, to increase her sales, and increasing their income. Help Brend and her family. Your generosity will be of great help. Don't wait any longer, they will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Brenda D. es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 10,8,6 , 4 y 2 años de edad, ellos viven en la comunidad de Mérida, en el estado de Yucatán. Ella inició la venta de zapatos a rías de que su esposo se quedó sin trabajo y mientras encontraba otro empleo, con lo de su liquidación, invirtió y empezó a vender entre sus familiares y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio. Ya son dos años de que Brenda inició con su proyecto, cuy único objetivo fue el apoyar a su esposo y a su familia en los momentos difíciles por los que atravesaban.

El empeño, la fuerza y el trabajo, aunado el a el gran amor que Brenda le tiene a su familia, es lo que ha hecho posible le obtención de un sustento diario. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $ 275 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de más mercancía y así incrementar sus ventas, obteniendo de esta forma mayores ingresos. Apoya a Brenda y su familia, tu generosidad será de gran ayuda, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosana Amalia

texts.en:
Rossana and her family, husband and four under aged children, live in the city of Merida, Yucatan. She and her family went through some difficult times five years ago after her husband was left unemployed. This situation made Rossana think of a solution, as she needed to provide her children with the necessities, such as an education. This is how she started selling corn on the cob from her home. Soon thereafter with the help of some loans she was able to purchase a tricyle to be able to go out and sell her products, which also increased in variety. The want to provide her children with a better quality of life motivated Rossana to work very hard every day, and she has managed to reach her goal through effort and dedication.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $275, that she plans to repay in a term of 5 to 10 months. She will use this amount to purchase ingredients and materials necessary for her products, and upkeep of her tricycle. With your generosity you can help Rossana and her family. Don't wait any longer. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rossana y su familia, esposo y 4 hijos menores de edad, vive en la localidad de Mérida Yucatán, ella y su familia hace cinco años atravesaron por momentos económicamente muy complicados, pues su esposo se quedo sin empleo. Esta situación llevó a Rossana a pensar en una solución, pues tenía que darles a sus hijos lo necesario, como educación. Es así como comenzó con la venta de elotes en su casa, luego con la ayuda de algunos préstamos logró comprar un triciclo para salir a vender y amplió también los productos ofrecidos. Las ganas de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida impulsó a Rossana a trabajar muy duro cada día y ha logrado con esfuerzo y dedicación la meta propuesta

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Ella destinará ésta cantidad para la compra de insumos necesarios para elaboración de sus productos, y para dar mantenimiento a su triciclo. Con tu generosidad puedes apoyar a Rossana y su familia, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.en:
Norma is mother of a young man of 19 years of age and lives in the community of Huhi in a southern State, Yucatan. Two years ago she suffered the loss of her husband and following the loss of an income she started selling shoes with the help of her son. She started selling among family members and friends, but the demand grew and she decided to work full time in her business. Tenacity is a characteristic that Norma undoubtedly possesses. Despite the loss of her husband that she suffered she kept moving forward for the love of her son.

Now she requires a loan in the amount of $925, of which she will use for the purchase of shoes in greater quantity, to get a better price for them and greater earnings. Help Norma and her family. They need you, don't wait any longer. You only need to make your decision now. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es madre de un joven de 19 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Huhí, en un estado del sur del país, Yucatán. Hace 2 años ella sufrió la perdida de su esposo y ante la falta de ingresos comenzó a vender zapatos con la ayuda de su hijo. Empezó vendiendo entre familiares y amigos, pero ante la creciente demanda, decidió dedicarse por completo a ésta actividad. La tenacidad es una característica que indudablemente Norma posee, pues a pesar de la pérdida que sufrió siguió adelante por el amor a su hijo.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de zapatos en una mayor cantidad para poder un obtener un menor precio y por ende mayores ganancias. Ayuda a Norma y a su familia, ellos te necesitan no lo dudes más, sólo hace falta que te decidas, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Freddy Rogelio

texts.en:
Freddy is a very hard working and responsible man, but above all he is a highly enterprising. Some time ago he worked as a driver with a company, but they paid him very little and it was not enough to cover the family expenses, nor enough to cover the education of his three children. In his spare time he learned how to be a carpenter withthe help of a friend. Some time later he started his own shop, the very same one that is running now thanks to his dedication and perseverence.

Thanks to this business that Freddy started he has been able to provide his children and his wife with a better quality of life. In order to maintain his business, he requires a loan of $925 that he will use for the purchase of wood to increase his production and consequently his income. Become an important part of Freddy's increasing success, and help him.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Freddy es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, pero sobre todo es una persona altamente emprendedora. El hace tiempo se desempeñaba como chofer en una empresa, sin embargo le pagaban muy poco y esto no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos familiares, ni a cubrir la educación de sus tres hijos. Por ello en sus ratos libres aprendió el oficio de carpintero por medio de un amigo que le enseñó. Luego de un tiempo inauguró su propio taller, mismo que sigue en servició hasta ahora a base de dedicación y constancia.

Gracias a este proyecto que Freddy comenzó hace algún tiempo ha podido brindarles a sus hijos y su esposa una mejor calidad e vida. Para poder mantener y hacer crecer su negocio, el requiere de un préstamo de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de madera y aumentar su producción y consecuentemente sus ingresos. Vuélvete parte importante del crecimiento de Freddy y ayúdalo.

loans.use: purcahse wood

loans.name: Laufai

texts.en:
Laufai is a 29 year old woman, married with 3 children. Her husband like her has always been unemployed and the family has depended on relatives for financial support for things such as educating the children. 
Her business is a taro plantation. She is now selling 50 bundles of taro at USD 7 each per week and earns USD 300 per week. Previous loans from SPBD have been used to build up the plantation to a level where she is now able to use some of the income for school fees.

loans.use: Purchase fertiler, weed killer, equipment

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ms. Ama D. is a married mother of four children. Her husband works primarily as a fisherman, but his income in insufficient to pay all of the family’s expenses. This situation requires Ms. Ama D. to work hard to contribute a large part of the family’s income. She has already obtained a loan of $400 to build her business of selling cosmetic products, which she has been running for six years. Her energy and her ability to manage a loan have earned her the reputation of a model woman in her town. Faced with new responsibilities in paying household expenses, she is seeking to improve her business but does not have the means to do so. She is requesting a loan of $600, which will help her to buy, stock and resell cosmetic products. The success of this project will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Ama est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. L’activité principale de son mari est la pêche artisanale dont le rendement est insuffisant pour couvrir la totalité des frais liés à la gestion des charges de la famille. Cette situation obligea Madame D. Ama à travailler ardemment pour contribuer dans une large mesure aux charges du ménage. Elle a obtenu un crédit de $400 pour renforcer son commerce de produits de beauté qu’elle exerce il y a 6 ans. Son dynamisme et son aptitude à gérer un crédit lui confèrent une place de femme modèle dans la localité. Face à sa nouvelle responsabilité dans son ménage, elle cherche à améliorer son commerce mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens. Elle sollicite un de $600 qui va servir à acquérir, à stocker et à revendre les produits de beauté. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
A married mother of four children, Ms. Rita A.’s business consists of roadside sales of foodstuffs. Determined in all that she does, she contributes a large amount of the household income because the money her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver, earns is largely insufficient to feed, clothe, educate and take care of their children. Recognizing the seriousness of the situation, Ms. A. dedicates all of her energy to serving her family. She is a tireless woman who works day and night to pull her family out of poverty. To increase her income, she would like to further build her business in order to be able to meet the growing demand for her products.

For this, she is requesting a loan of $600, which will allow her to increase the range of products that she sells. The amount requested will thus serve as the capital to buy and resell her goods. This project deserves to be supported, as it will allow a very poor family to improve its living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame A. Rita a comme activité la vente des denrées alimentaires dans les abords des routes. Déterminée dans tout ce qu’elle fait, elle participe énormément à la gestion du ménage car le revenu de son mari, conducteur de taxi moto, est très insuffisant pour nourrir, habiller, soigner et scolariser les enfants. Consciente de la gravité de la situation, Madame A. met toute son énergie au service de sa famille. Femme infatigable, elle travaille de jour comme de nuit pour réduire la misère dans sa famille. Pour améliorer son revenu, elle souhaite élargir davantage son commerce afin de pouvoir répondre à une plus grande demande qui se présente à elle.

Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de $600 qui va lui permettre d’élargir la gamme de ses produits. Le montant sollicité constituera donc un fonds de commerce pour l’achat, et la revente de ses marchandises. Ce projet mérite d’être soutenu car il permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie d’une famille démunie.

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
An energetic and honest woman, Ms. Marguerite A. is a married mother of three children. Despite running a business of cosmetic product sales, she has great difficulty in meeting the daily needs of her family. Her husband, a farmer, earns less and less due to recent climate irregularities. This poor and degrading financial situation required Ms. Marguerite A. to request her first loan in order to increase her stock of products. She repaid this loan without incident. Her capability has today earned her a good reputation in her town, and her customers have become demanding and large in number. In order to effectively meet this ever-growing demand, Ms. Marguerite A. is requesting a credit of $800 to buy a supply of cosmetic products in order to better satisfy her customers and to contribute what is needed to her family’s income.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Femme dynamique et honnête, Madame A. Marguerite est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Malgré son commerce des produits cosmétiques, elle rencontre beaucoup de difficultés au quotidien dans la gestion des charges de sa famille. Son mari, cultivateur a des rendements de plus en plus maigres dus aux anomalies climatiques de ces derniers temps. Cette situation financière faible et dégradante obligea Madame A. Marguerite à demander un premier crédit pour agrandir son étalage. Un crédit qu’il a remboursé sans incident. Son habileté lui confère aujourd’hui une bonne réputation dans la localité et sa clientèle est devenue abondante et exigeante. Afin de pouvoir répondre efficacement à cette demande sans cesse croissante, Madame A. Marguerite sollicite un crédit de $800 pour s’approvisionner en produits cosmétiques afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et parvenir à contribuer convenablement aux charges de son ménage.

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetic products

loans.name: Dawlossi

texts.en:
Ms. Dawlossi A. is a mother of five children. She has been married for twelve years, but her husband’s farming business does not earn him enough to pay all of the family’s expenses. This is why she has invested the profits from selling ice water at the market in Afagnan in the production of palm oil, something highly popular and widely consumed in her country. Having seen that the production and sale of palm oil is a very profitable activity in her town, she is seeking the means to develop her business. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $600, which will serve as the capital to buy palm nuts in large quantity and to prepare red palm oil. Ms. A. has a lot of experience in managing loans, and the success of her business gives her the ability to repay them. The granting of this loan will give her the ability to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Dawlossi est mère d’une famille de cinq (5) enfants. Mariée depuis une douzaine d’années, la profession de cultivateur de son mari ne lui permet pas de bien subvenir aux charges de sa famille. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle a investi les bénéfices de la vente de l’eau glacée au marché d’Afagnan dans la production de l’huile de palme, une huile bien appréciée et consommée dans le pays. Ayant constaté que la production et la vente de l’huile de palme est une activité très rentable dans la localité, elle cherche des moyens pour l’agrandir. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $600 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat des noix de palme en grande quantité et la préparation de l’huile rouge. Madame A. possède une grande expérience en gestion de crédit et son activité lui confère une bonne capacité de remboursement. Comme impact, l’octroi de ce crédit lui procurera une capacité de bien subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants..

loans.use: To buy palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Sowanou

texts.en:
Mr. Sowanou H. is an energetic man. Married to a shopkeeper for twenty years, he has eight children, two of whom are in apprenticeships. The income from his wife’s business is not enough to contribute to the family’s needs. Mr. Sowanou H.’s business is the production and sale of the local drink, “sodabi,” which is very popular in the region. The quality of the drink he produces has led to him receiving orders from as far as the capital, Lomé. In order to be able to produce a large quantity of sodabi, he must be able to buy enough palm trees. To do so he would need substantial financial means, something which Mr. H. does not have. He is requesting a loan of $850 to buy palm tress and produce and sell sodabi. The income generated by the sale of the drink could help Mr. H. bear his numerous household expenses.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Sowanou est un homme dynamique. Marié à une commerçante depuis une vingtaine d’années, il a au total huit (8) enfants dont deux (2) en apprentissage. Le revenu issu du commerce de sa femme ne lui permet pas de contribuer aux besoins familiaux. Monsieur H. Sowanou exerce comme activité la production et la vente de la boisson locale « sodabi » bien appréciée dans la zone. La qualité de la boisson qu’il produit fait qu’il reçoit des commandes depuis Lomé la capitale. Pour pouvoir produire une grande quantité de sodabi, Il lui faut alors acheter assez de palmiers. Ce qui demande assez de moyens financiers dont Monsieur H. ne dispose pas. Il sollicite un crédit de $850 pour l’achat des palmiers, la production et la vente du sodabi. Les revenus tirés de la vente de la boisson pourra aider Monsieur H. à supporter les nombreuses charges de son ménage

loans.use: To buy palm trees to produce and sell “sodabi”

loans.name: Togbossi

texts.en:
Ms. Togbossi A. has been a widow for five years. Her husband’s farming business did not enable him to leave any money for his family when he died. Today, Ms. Togbossi A. struggles daily with all her energy to be able to meet the needs of her children. Her principal activity is rope weaving. A clever woman, she works hard to shelter her children from hunger and poverty. But today she is being crushed by her expenses and is calling out for help. She has already obtained a first loan, which she paid off faithfully and without incident. She is now requesting a second loan of $600 to equip herself with materials in order to increase her production of rope. The profits she will earn from this business will be used to improve her family’s living conditions. Financing this project will mean giving back hope to children who have lost their father.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Togbossi est une femme veuve depuis 5 ans. L’activité agricole de son mari ne lui a pas permis de laisser un héritage à la famille avant sa mort. Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Togbossi se bat quotidiennement avec toute son énergie pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Son activité principale est le tissage des cordes. Femme ingénieuse, elle travaille durement pour mettre ses enfants à l’abri de la faim et la misère. Mais aujourd’hui, elle est écrasée par les charges et crie au secours. Elle a déjà obtenu un premier crédit qu’elle a pu solder fidèlement sans incident. Elle demande donc un second crédit d’un montant de $600 pour se doter de matériel afin d’accroître sa production en tissage de corde. Les bénéfices qui seront issus de cette activité seront destinés à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Financer ce projet, c’est redonner l’espoir de vivre à des orphelins.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for rope weaving

loans.name: Akofala

texts.en:
Ms. Akofala A. is a young, married woman and the mother of four children. Her age allows her to be energetic in the running of her business. An energetic woman with great endurance, she has a passion for coconut oil production, something she has been doing for a long time. The income that she earns from this activity, little as it may be, allows her to contribute a large amount to the paying of the household expenses. Her husband’s business of raising chickens in the traditional way is not sufficient to meet all of the family’s needs. As the family’s expenses are becoming more and more difficult to pay, Ms. A. wants to increase her production of coconut oil and thus increase her income. The quality of her product is highly appreciated at the market, and the demand for it is high. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more coconuts and production materials to increase her output. This loan will have a positive effect on her financial situation, and she will thus be better able to take care of her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akofala est une jeune femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son âge lui confère un dynamisme dans son activité. Femme dynamique et endurante, elle a une passion pour la production de l’huile de coco, activité qu’elle exerce depuis longtemps. Le revenu qu’elle en tire quoique insignifiant lui permet de contribuer largement aux charges du ménage. L’élevage traditionnel des volailles que son mari fait ne suffit pas pour couvrir les besoins de la famille. Les charges de la famille devenant de plus en plus lourdes, Madame A. veut augmenter sa production d’huile de coco et améliorer ainsi son revenu. La qualité de son produit est très appréciée sur le marché, ce qui fait que la demande est forte. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter plus de coco et de matériel de production pour augmenter son rendement. Comme impact, ce crédit aura une répercussion positive sur son économie. Elle pourra à cet effet mieux prendre soin de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy nuts and materials for coconut oil production

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Ms. Ayoko A. has also taken in her two younger sisters as apprentices. Having not gone to school, she earns her living through the production and sale of “gari” (cassava flour). As someone who appreciates a job well done, she takes great care in the fabrication of gari, which endows her product with a high level of quality. And her gari, which is highly esteemed, sells very well at the market. The demand has become great, as wealthy women come all the way from Lomé to buy it. Today, she no longer has the means to meet the high demand for her product. She is requesting a loan of $650 to buy cassava in large quantity and produce gari.

Despite the fact that she is illiterate, she is gifted with an understanding and a mastery of managing credit. She anticipates increasing her production capacity of gari and selling it at the markets in the region, which will give her the ability to better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, Madame A. Ayoko prend aujourd’hui en charge ses deux (2) petites sœurs en apprentissage. N’ayant pas été à l’école, elle fait comme activité la production et la vente du gari (farine de manioc). Aimant le travail bien fait, elle entoure la fabrication du gari de beaucoup de soins. Ce qui confère d’énormes qualités au produit. Du coup, son gari, bien apprécié, est très bien vendu sur le marché. La demande est devenue grande car les bonnes femmes viennent de Lomé pour s’en procurer. Aujourd’hui, elle n’a plus assez de moyens pour satisfaire la forte demande à laquelle elle fait face. Elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour l’achat en grande quantité de manioc et la production de gari.

Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle est dotée d’une compréhension et d’une maîtrise de gestion de crédit. Elle estime augmenter sa capacité de production du gari afin de le vendre sur les marchés des villes de la sous région, ce qui lui la capacité de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cassava to produce “gari”

loans.name: Amétohoun

texts.en:
Ms. Amétohoun H. is a widow and almost fifty years old. Her business consists of selling “sodabi,” a local drink made from the African oil palm tree. She takes care of the five children left to her by her late husband, and she works every day to ensure their education. Despite her courage and determination, she is often overcome by her problems but has no one to confide in. In order to pull her family out of this difficult situation, Ms. Amétohoun H. has only one ambition: to take her sodabi business to the next level. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $600 to buy a supply of bottles of sodabi, stock them and resell them. Once this business is financed, Ms. H. will be better able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame H. Amétohoun est une veuve de près d’une cinquantaine d’année. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de « sodabi », une boisson locale à base du palmier à huile. Les cinq (5) enfants laissés par son mari défunt sont à sa charge et elle s’active tous les jours pour les éduquer. Malgré tout son courage et sa détermination, elle est souvent dépassée par les problèmes mais n’a personne à qui se confier. Pour sortir sa famille de cette situation difficile, Madame H. Amétohoun n’a qu’une seule ambition : relever le niveau de son commerce de sodabi. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $600 pour s’approvisionner des bidons de sodabi, les stocker et la boisson locale et les revendre. Cette activité une fois financée, permettra à Madame H., de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, stock and sell “sodabi”

loans.name: Dassi

texts.en:
Ms. Dassi A. sells firewood. She is a mother of four children, who she has been raising for twenty years. Her husband, who does not have stable employment, does not earn enough income to meet the family’s needs. So Ms. Dassi A. works relentlessly to help her husband manage the family’s expenses. The business of selling firewood is very prosperous, but her income barely makes a dent in the household expenses.

Faced with the ever-growing demand of her customers, Ms. A. is no longer able to satisfy everyone by her own means. That is why she is requesting a loan of $850 to build a sufficient stock of firewood and sell it when there is a shortage. This way, she could increase the size of her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Dassi est une commerçante de bois de chauffe. Elle est mère de quatre (4) enfants qu’elle élève depuis une vingtaine d’années. Son mari n’ayant pas un emploi fixe ne dispose pas de revenu pour supporter les besoins de la famille. Ainsi, Madame A. Dassi travaille avec acharnement pour aider son mari dans la gestion des charges du ménage Le commerce du bois de chauffe est une activité très florissante. Mais les charges de son ménage font que ses efforts ne sont pas visibles.

Devant la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle, Madame A. n’est plus en mesure de satisfaire tout le monde avec ses propres moyens. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour faire un stockage consistant de bois de chauffe et les revendre en temps de pénurie. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter la taille de son commerce et améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell firewood

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Ms. Marie D. is a divorced woman who takes care of three children. As she is quite gifted in the identification and analysis of business opportunities, she has chosen to get into the business of selling fish and condiments, in which she is doing rather well. However, due to her very limited financial means, she is confronted with high demand that she is unable to meet. She currently needs a loan, which will allow her to increase the size of her business in order to increase her revenue. She is requesting a loan of $700, which will give her the capital to buy and resell fish and condiments. This new possibility will allow her to meet not only the needs of her customers but also those of her family. This will allow Ms. D. to live off the fruits of her labor and to better meet her immediate needs, notably the feeding, clothing, health and education of her children.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame D. Marie est une femme divorcée avec trois (3) enfants à charge. Très douée dans l’identification et dans l’analyse des opportunités d’affaires, elle s’est choisie pour activité principale la vente de poissons et condiments qui lui réussit assez bien. Cependant, par ses moyens financiers très limités, elle est confrontée à beaucoup de demandes qu’elle est incapable de satisfaire. Elle a besoin aujourd’hui d’un appui financier qui lui servira à augmenter la taille de son activité en vue d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires. Elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui lui permettra de disposer d’un fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente du poisson et des condiments. Cette nouvelle possibilité lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement les besoins de sa clientèle mais aussi ceux de sa famille. Ceci permettra à Madame D. de vivre du fruit de son travail et de mieux subvenir à ses besoins immédiats, notamment: l’alimentation, la santé, l’habillement et l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy and sell fish and condiments

loans.name: Sodjédé

texts.en:
A widow for ten years, Ms. Sodjédé A. takes care of her two grandsons, left to her when her oldest daughter passed away. Three of her four children are currently unemployed and are still dependent on her. To meet these numerous demands, she buys the material for rope weaving, makes rope and sells it at the market. Despite her efforts and her courage, her income does not enable her to shelter her children from hunger and poverty. Even though she is illiterate, she has the ability to rigorously manage her business and has been able to repay her first loan of $250 without incident. She desperately wants to improve her family’s living conditions and is requesting a loan in order to do so. The loan of $500 that she is requesting will allow her to buy materials in large quantity to weave and sell rope. The income generated by these sales will allow her to come to the aide of those who depend on her.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Devenue veuve depuis une dizaine d’années, Madame A. Sodjédé a à sa charge ses deux (2) petits fils laissés à la mort de sa fille aînée. Trois de ses quatre enfants qui n’exercent aucune activité à ce jour sont toujours à sa charge. Pour subvenir à ces nombreuses charges, elle achète le matériel de tissage de corde, fabrique les cordes et les revend sur le même marché. Malgré ses efforts et son courage, son revenu ne permet pas de mettre ses enfants à l’abri de la faim et de la maladie. Mais bien qu’elle soit analphabète, elle dispose d’une aptitude de rigueur dans la gestion de ses activités et a su rembourser son premier crédit de $250 sans incident. Elle désire vivement améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et demande un appui financier à cet effet. Le crédit de $500 qu’elle sollicite va servir à acquérir du matériel de travail en quantité pour le tissage et la vente des cordes. Les revenus tirés de cette vente lui serviront à venir en aide aux personnes qui sont à sa charge.

loans.use: To buy material and supplies for rope weaving

loans.name: Nagossi

texts.en:
Ms. Nagossi A. produces palm oil. She learned this skill from her mother. Having abandoned school because of a lack of financial means, she got into this business to take care of herself. Married to a motorcycle taxi driver, she is a mother of four school age children. She also takes care of her parents, bringing the total number of people who depend on her to seven. Determined and enthusiastic, she now has a lot of experience in the production of palm oil, which makes her product very desirable at the market. Demand has become very high, but Ms. Nagossi A. is unable to meet it because she does not have the means for production.

To re-energize her business and to satisfy all her clients, Ms. Nagossi A. is requesting a credit of $700 to buy a supply of palm nuts and the materials to produce palm oil. The profits from her business will allow her to effectively take care of her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Nagossi produit de l’huile de palme. Cette activité, elle l’a acquise de sa mère. Abandonnant les études fautes de moyens, elle se lance dans ce commerce pour se prendre en charge. Mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto, elle est mère de quatre (4) enfants en âge de scolarisation. Elle a aussi à sa charge ses parents soit au total sept (7) personnes. Déterminée et enthousiaste, elle possède aujourd’hui une grande expérience en matière de production de l’huile de palme. Ce qui fait que l’huile qu’elle produit est très appréciée sur le marché. La demande étant devenue très forte, Madame A. Nagossi est incapable de la satisfaire car elle ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour la production.

Pour redynamiser son activité et satisfaire tous ses clients, Madame A. Nagossi sollicite un crédit de $700 pour s’approvisionner en noix de palme et en matériel de production d’huile de palme. Les bénéfices de son activité lui serviront à s’occuper efficacement des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and materials for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira was born in Salyan region Khaladj village. She is married, has 3 children. She is cattle-breeder. 
You can see in the picture woman, who likes cattles. She enjoys looking after the calves.
This 58-year-old woman likes this calf more than other calves.
Having borrowed a loan of $400, she bought 10 pedigree lambs. Then she decided to borrow a loan of $600 to buy 3 pedigree calves. 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree calves.
She has been engaged in this business for 12 years.

loans.use: To buy 4 pedigree calves

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala lives in Salyan region Khaladj village. 
This 55-year-old woman is married, has 4 children.
She has been engaged in this business for 10 years.
In the beginning her business she borrowed a loan of $400 and bought a milch-cow and 4 sheeps.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 2 milch-cows.

loans.use: To buy 2 milch-cows

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 28, single, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village.
She has been engaged in farming for 4 years.
She is hard worker, strong woman, enjoys with her business. 
It is a very dificult work, but she is not afraid of work.
Gulnaz has a lot of plans. She wants to expand her business. 
You can see in the picture a sociable, very kind, friendly young woman. 
Now she needs a loan of $700 to start being busy with a stock breeding. She wants to buy 10 sheeps.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheeps

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
This 42-year-old woman is married, has 2 children, lives in Absheron region Hovsan settlement.
She has been engaged in this business for 7 years.
For the first time she borrowed a loan of $700 and bought cloth.
Now she needs a loan of $1100 to buy a new sewing-machine. Her sewing-machine is old and bad works. This machine has been  broken very often and it disturbs her to work. 
She plans to buy the new  sewing-machine in order to increase number of her clients.
.

loans.use: To buy a sewing-machine

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
This 36-year-old young man is cameraman, married, has 3 children, lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. He enjoys with his business. It is a very interesting business. 
In the beginning his business he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought a camera.
Now he needs a loan of $700 to buy a new video camera and a montage apparatus.
He has a lot of plans. He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person.
He has been engaged in this business for 13 years. 
He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: To buy a new video camera and a montage apparatus

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina runs a small business selling sportswear for men and women. She is married with one son. A Technical school graduate, Marina had previously worked in a factory. However, her salary was too small to provide for the needs of the family and she was forced to seek other opportunities to earn a living. Marina has been in the clothing business for over 4 years and has repaid 19 loans to “Nadiya Ukraine” without any delinquencies. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain loyal clientele. Marina would like to receive a loan for $800 to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of T-shirts, jackets, vests, and knitted wear. High-quality, durable, and comfortable sportswear will sell really well and will help Marina’s business grow – especially in this cold winter season.

Марина Костянтинівна займається продажем чоловічого та жіночого спортивного одягу. Вона одружена, має сина. Після закінчення технікуму, Марина Костянтинівна працювала на заводі. Однак її зарплатні не вистачало для того, щоб забезпечити родину, тому вона була змушена шукати інших можливостей заробити. Марина Костянтинівна займається бізнесом з продажу одягу вже більше 4 років. Вона сплатила 19 позик в „Надії України” без жодних прострочень. Наполеглива, важка праця допомогла їй досягти успіху в бізнесі та зберегти відданих клієнтів. Марина Костянтинівна хотіла б отримати позику розміром в 800 доларів для того, щоб мати додаткові кошти на розвиток бізнесу. Фінансова підтримка допоможе їй купити різноманітні футболки, куртки, жилети та трикотажні вироби. Високоякісний, практичний та зручний одяг обов’язково матиме попит, а це, в свою чергу, сприятиме зростанню бізнесу Марини Костянтинівни – особливо під час зимових холодів.

loans.use: To increase on stock for winter season

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila M. is married with two grown children. Her son is in college and her daughter helps her with her business. Ludmila’s husband is disabled and is not able to work. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Ludmila used some of her savings to start a small business selling women’s lingerie. She was able to purchase a small kiosk located in one of the local markets in busy downtown. Her polite manner and rich experience have helped her operate her business successfully. Over time she has gotten to know the preferences and tastes of her customers making her kiosk a popular stop when they visit the market. Her daughter’s active participation in the business has also added greatly to its success. To meet growing demand from her customers, Ludmila is requesting a loan for $1000 which will allow her to purchase more underwear at wholesale prices. Increased selling capacity will not only meet the needs of her clients, but the additional profits generated will meet another of Ludmilla’s goals – to help pay for her son’s college tuition. This loan will allow her to increase her income and provide the necessary funds to pay for her son’s education which she considers her most valuable investment.

Людмила Василівна – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Її син навчається в університеті, дочка допомагає в бізнесі. Чоловік Людмили Василівни – інвалід, працювати не може. Людмила Василівна одна забезпечує родину. Для того, щоб почати власний бізнес з продажу жіночої білизни, Людмила Василівна використала деякі заощадження. Вона викупила маленький кіоск, розташований на одному з місцевих ринків в центрі міста. Її ввічливість та багатий досвід допомогли їй успішно керувати бізнесом. З часом вона навчилася відчувати смаки та побажання покупців, і саме це знову й знову приваблює клієнтів до її кіоску. Активна участь дочки в торгівлі також сприяла успішному зростанню бізнесу. Для того щоб задовольнити зростаючий попит, Людмила просить про позику в 1000 доларів, яка надасть їй можливість купити білизну за оптовими цінами. Зростання торгівлі не тільки задовольнить потреби клієнтів Людмили, але й допоможе їй отримати додатковий прибуток та заплатити за навчання сина в університеті. Позика допоможе їй збільшити прибутки та забезпечить необхідні кошти для навчання сина, яке Людмила вважає найціннішою інвестицією.

loans.use: To generate more profits to pay her son’s college fees

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a single mother with two children attending school. She manages a small  plantation growing taro, banana, ufi and taamu. Her income from this is usually around USD 200 per week and she takes her produce to the market on Friday and Saturday. She also makes donuts which she sells at the local school between 10AM and 11 AM every day for the morning break. Her previous loans have mostly been used to buy fertilizer and weed killer for the plantation. In addition part of the loans have been used for school fees. She is the leader of her lending group in the village of Sataoa.

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser, weed killer and ingredients for donut business

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a single mother with one child. She runs a plantation with her brother and his adopted son. The plantation only grows taro which is sold once a week in the market in the capital Apia on the weekend. From this she earns approximately USD 1500 per week. She also sells donuts in the village on Saturdays and Sundays which provides her with some additional income. With the loan she wishes to purchase some fertilizer and weed killer. She is a member of the Nuusutia village center which won second prize in SPBD’s best center competition in 2006. She is pictured with her brothers adopted son outside the house where the weekly meeting is held. Also in the picture are materials used on the plantation .

loans.use: Purchase weed killer and fertilser for her plantation

loans.name: Fale

texts.en: Fale is married with two children who are attending school. With her husband she runs two businesses. The first business is a small store which is pictured. This is located at her parents in law house and has been going for 5 years. They also have a plantation which grows taro. Fale wants to open another store in another part of the village which will assist with achieving greater independence. She will get some assistance from relatives from overseas. The loan from SPBD will assist with buying staple goods such as sugar, salt, soap, noodles, sweets, flour and frozen goods

loans.use: Purchase goods for a new general store

loans.name: Aleimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo is married with 8 children. Only one still goes to school, the rest are of working age. Alaimalo is an industrious women who is the chief of the lending group of her village consisting of 14 other women.  She earns her income from a number of pursuits. Her main business is a plantation which grows taro, bananas and ufi. She also has two cows and wishes to purchase one more with this loan. Aside from this she makes ice cakes which she sells from her home and sometimes at the local school. She is pictured in the photo in her kitchen holding one of her ice cakes. In the past she has used loans to build up the plantation, buy cows and also build an outside toilet.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, weed killer and one cow

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza has a small store where she sells basic groceries. She has owned the store for about 3 years, after having to move into a new home because her property was being taken away by the government. She had been working as a domestic assistant for about 25 years until the pain in her legs was too unbearable to continue working. She opened the store in her home and runs it with the help of her granddaughter and children.

Esperanza needs the loan in order to invest in goods for her market. Currently she feels she is very under stocked and she is not selling products that could increase her profits. She has had 9 children, all of which are grown up and independent. She is 69 years old but has been a single mother for 30 years after her husband left her and the children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in goods for her market

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been selling clothes as a street sales woman for 4 years. She travels into the rural sectors about three times a week in order to sell there because there are better business opportunities. She has had to work and sell from a very young age because her parents were not in a good financial situation. She started the business with a $50 loan from informal lenders that charge very high interest rates. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in clothes for the hot weather and rainy season. Helen is 23 years old, she already has 2 children and she is also pregnant with another. She is currently seperated from her husband because he does not contribute to the household and he she considers him to be irresponsible. This business is currently the only source of income she has and she is very dedicated to it.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in summertime clothing

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny sells all types of decorations for the home and she also sells clothing for men and women. She has over 10 years of experience in this line of work. Thanks to the support of her husband, who provided start up capital for the business, she has opened a small location in front of her home where she displays her products and merchandise. She opens her store three times a week from 7 in the morning and 7 at night. The other days she travels outside of the city to sell cosmetics and clothing to under served communities where there are sale opportunities. She is 43 years old and has one child, whose father passed away 8 years ago. She is now in a new relationship with a industrial mechanic who is very supportive.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in clothes for hot weather

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem O. operates a bicycle repair and shoe shining business in Kondele, Kisumu. He is married with two children. He also takes care of 3 children who were orphaned following the death of his elder brother and wife from HIV/AIDS.
He needs a USD 25 loan to add spare parts to his business and pay for a business license.

He will pay the loan in 6 installments as he struggles with basic family needs.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spares and purchase a business license.

loans.name: Shakhmurad

texts.en:
Shakhmurad lives in Salyan region Yenikand village. He is 47, married, has 3 children. He likes animals, enjoys looking after the animals.
One day he decided to be busy with a stock-breeding. He did not have a cattle-shed.
Having borrowed a loan of $300 he built the cattle-shed.
Then he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought 10 pedigreed ewes.
For the third time he borrowed a loan of $800 and bought 20 lambs. Having fattened these animals, he started to be busy with sale of lambs and sheeps.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 25 pedigreed ewes to fatten for sale.
He is purposeful person. He has been working very hard to develop his business.
Being engaged in this business, he supports his family.
He has been engaged in this busines for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy 25 pedigreed ewes to fatten for sale

loans.name: Bikakhanim

texts.en:
This 40-year-old young woman is married, has 2 children, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village.
She has been selling milk.
In the beginning of her busines , she borrowed a loan of $200 and bought a milch-cow.
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought 2 pedigree cows and 100 compressed clover.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree cows.
She has been engaged in this business for  years.

loans.use: To buy 4 pedigree cows

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz has been engaged in farming for 4 years.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 ne bought 0,04 hectare plot of land. She cultivates the plot of land to grow vegetables.
She is 30, married, has a child, lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village..
Now she needs  a loan of $800 to buy in addition the plot of land in order to grow the vegetables.

loans.use: To buy plot of land

loans.use: to expand her farming business

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.en:
Cleotilde lives in the city of Tampico in the State of Tamaulipas, and she is mother of three girls. Her husband passed away some time ago and she, despite the difficult emotional moments she was going through, had to support her daughters and this is hoe she started selling seasonal clothes. Through this business she has been able to pay for the education of her duaghters and for the medications of one of her daughters, who is handicapped.

Things have not been easy for Cleotilde and her family, but thanks to her daily effort and hard work she has been able to provide for her duaghters despite the absence of the head of the family, her husband. Now she requires a loan in the amount of $925 that she will use towards the purchase of more merchandse to have a greater variety of clothing, which will allow her to increase her sales and her income. Do not leave Cleotilde and her daughters - today, now more than ever, they need your generosity. Do not wait any longer and support them. They will thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cleotilde vive en la localidad de Tampico, en el estado de Tamaulipas, y es madre de 3 hijas. Hace tiempo que su esposo falleció y ella, a pesar de los difíciles momentos emocionales por los que atravesaba, se tuvo que hacer cargo de la manutención de sus hijas y es así como comenzó con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa de temporada. Con esta actividad ha podido pagar la educación de sus hijas y sobre todo pagar loe medicamentos de una de sus hijas, quien es discapacitada.

Las cosas no han sido fáciles para Cleotilde y su familia, pero gracias al esfuerzo y el trabajo diario ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijas ante la falta de la cabeza de la familia, su esposo. Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para poder comprar más mercancía y tener mejor surtido en ropa, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ventar y obtener mejores ganancias. No dejes sola Cleotilde y sus hijas, ellas hoy más que nunca requieren de tu generosidad, no lo dudes más y apóyalas, ellas te lo van a agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 47 years old and is an honest, active, enthusiastic and entrepreneurial person. She and her three childrenlive in the city of Tampico. Two years ago, on the side walk outside her home, she started to make and sell hamburgers. But later she built a small stand with an overhead roof in from of her house. She started this for her need to obtain an income to help out her husband, mostly with the education of their children. Her husband's income was only enough to cover the household expenses. The daily struggles and the love of her family have permitted Cristina to keep up her business through so many years.

She needs to expand and continue with her business, as it is the onlyh way to provide her children with the education they need. Today she needs a loan of $925 for the purchase of ingredients that she uses to make her foods, such as, meat, cooking oil, natural gas, bread, tomatoes, onions, napkins, disposable cups and plates. These needed especially during this time of year when sales are highest. It is up to you, don't wait any longer. Become part of Cristina's efforts. She thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina tiene 47 años, es una persona honesta, activa, entusiasta y emprendedora. Ella es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la localidad de Tampico.
