Hace doce años, en la banqueta de afuera de su casa, comenzó a elaborar y vender tortas, pero después construyó un pequeño local techado al frente de su domicilio. Esto lo inició por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo, sobre todo con la educación de sus hijos, ya que con lo que él ganaba no nos alcanzaba más que para solventar los gastos del hogar. El esfuerzo diario y el amor a su familia han permitido que Cristina, después de tantos años conserve el proyecto que un día emprendió.

Ella necesita crecer y continuar con su actividad, pues la única forma de poder brindarle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan. En éste momento ella necesita de un crédito de $925 DLLS para la adquisición de materia prima con la que prepara sus alimentos, tales como carne, aceite, gas, pan, tomate, cebolla, servilletas, vasos y platos, desechables, ya que en ésta época aumentan las ventas. La decisión esta en tus manos, no lo dudes más, vuélvete parte de los logros de Cristina y su familia, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (food)

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Hard working, entrepreneurial, honest and responsible, these are the principal qualities that define Miss Felipa. She is mother of 4 children and is married. In 1981 she started selling cookies, snacks, candies, soft drinks, etc., in front of her house to help out her husband as his wages were not enoguh to cover the household costs (mostly because she had just resettled from another city, Cerro Azul, and they had many expenses following their change in residence to Tampico). All these years Miss Felipa has worked very hard, with the only objective being to obtain income to improve the family economy and to pay for their children's studies. This business has made it all possible as her husband's income is very small.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $925 that she will use towards the purchase of merchandise to increase her sales and consequently her income. With your generosity you can contribute to the wellbeing of Felipa and her family. Do not wait any longer. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Trabajadora, emprendedora, honesta y responsable, son las principales cualidades que definen a Doña Felipa, quien es madre de 4 hijos y es casada. En 1981 ella comenzó vendiendo galletas, frituras, dulces, refrescos, etc., en la parte delantera de su casa para ayudar a su esposo, ya que lo que él ganaba no nos alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar, sobre todo porque habían llegado de otra ciudad, Cerro Azul, y tuvieron muchos gastos por el cambio de residencia a Tampico. Todos estos años Doña Felipa ha trabajado arduamente con el único objetivo de obtener ingresos para mejorar su economía familiar y además poder solventar los estudios de sus hijos, que si esta actividad sería imposible, pues el sueldo de su esposo es muy bajo.

En éste momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Con tu generosidad puedes contribuir a el bienestar de Felipa y su familia, no lo dudes más, ella de lo agradecederá sinceramente

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND FARMING

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND FARMING

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND FARMING

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HER NURSERY SCHOOL

loans.name: Sèlété Pauline

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Kpémé (Lake Region), Mrs. G. Sèlété Pauline is a mother of five (5) children. A widow for several months, she now has the burden of taking care of her entire family alone.

To meet her family's financial needs, she has been storing and selling the vegetable "gari" and corn flour for the last 5 years. This very profitable activity has enabled her to contribute to household needs until the death of her husband. Today, faced with her new situation, Mrs G. cannot make ends meet with her business. Concerned with the education of her children, she would like to build on her business but does not have the necessary means. Her experience and management skills enabled her to refund her first two loans promptly. The new credit of $650 that she is requesting will be used for the purchase, the storage and the resale of gari and corn. The improvement of her business will enable her to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Kpémé (Préfecture des Lacs), Madame G. Sèlété Pauline est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Veuve depuis quelques mois, elle a aujourd’hui la lourde charge d’assumer toutes les charges familiales. Pour leurs besoins et les problèmes financiers de sa famille, elle exerce depuis 5 ans le stockage et la vente de la farine de manioc « gari » et du maïs. Cette activité très rentable lui a toujours permis de contribuer efficacement aux charges du ménage jusqu’à la mort de son mari. Aujourd’hui seule face à ses charges, Madame G. n’a plus la capacité de les assumer. Soucieuse de l’éducation de ses enfants, elle cherche à renforcer son activité mais il n’a pas assez de moyens. Sa sagesse et son sens de gestion lui ont permis de rembourser promptement ses deux premiers crédits. Le nouveau crédit de $650 qu’elle sollicite lui servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente du gari et du maïs. L’amélioration de son commerce lui permettra de relever le niveau de vie de sa famille

loans.use: Buying, storage and resale of gari and corn.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mrs Flora M. was born in 1972 in Aného. She is married and mother of a boy. Her husband is a teacher with a very low income. Daily life in this family is very difficult because the sources of income are not reliable. Having noticed that frozen goods are unavailable in her district, Mrs M. surveyed people in the area to assess their need for these goods. Thanks to her first credit of $400, she managed to buy a freezer and began selling frozen products. This activity quickly became sucessful since Mrs M. is the only business selling these products in the vicinity. Dynamic and honest, she already refunded her first credit. However, her product supply does not meet the demand. To improve her business in this regard, she is asking for a credit of $850 to be able to buy a new freezer for the wholesale of the frozen products. The success of this business will relieve her family's grave situation.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. Flora est née en 1972 à Aného. Elle est mariée et mère d’un garçon. Son époux est un instituteur qui n’a qu’un revenu minable. La vie au quotidien dans cette famille est très difficile car les sources de revenu ne sont pas fiables. Madame M. ayant remarqué le manque de boutique d’approvisionnement en produits congelés dans son quartier a fait un sondage pour avoir une idée sur l’importance de la demande. C’est ainsi que grâce à son premier crédit de $400, elle parvient à acquérir un congélateur et commence un commerce de produits congelés. Cette activité prend vite une grande ampleur car Madame M. est la seule commerçante de ces produits dans sa localité. Dynamique et honnête, elle a déjà remboursé sans aucun incident son premier crédit. La demande étant devenu très forte, son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire tous ses clients. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour pouvoir acquérir un nouveau congélateur pour la vente en quantité des produits congelés. Le succès de cette activité soulagera la misère dans la famille de Madame M.

loans.use: To buy a new freezer for the wholesale of frozen goods

loans.name: Adoté Payi

texts.en:
Mr A. Adoté Payi was born on March 20, 1978 in Aného. A married father of a child, he is an electrician. Not having found work, he opened a small cell phone, radio and computer equipment repair shop. He supports his entire family as well as his mother, despite his low income. Conscious of its responsibilities, he is a hard worker aiming to satisfy all his customers. With the growth of the cell phone industry, Mr A. realized that it would be very profitable to also sell cell phones. To this end he would like to open a small kiosk beside his workshop and is asking for a loan of $800 which will enable him to open the kiosk and to have enough capital for the purchase and the resale of cell phones and their accessories. The profits would increase his income and help him better provide for the needs for his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Adoté Payi est né le 20 Mars 1978 à Aného. Marié et père d’un enfant, il est technicien en électronique de formation. N’ayant pas trouvé de travail, il ouvre un petit atelier de réparation de téléphone portable, de radio et de matériels informatiques. Malgré l’insuffisance de son revenu, il est obligé de nourrir sa famille et aussi sa mère qui est à sa charge. Conscient de ses responsabilités, il travaille sans relâche pour satisfaire tous ses clients. Aujourd’hui, avec l’évolution sans cesse croissante de la téléphonie mobile, Monsieur A. s’est rendu compte qu’il serait très rentable de vendre des téléphones portables. A cet effet il voudrait ouvrir un petit kiosque à côté de son atelier. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $800 qui va lui permettre d’ouvrir le kiosque et de disposer de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires. Cela augmenterait son revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Open a kiosk to sell cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Kévin

texts.en:
Born on September 22, 1983, Mr Kévin S. is a photographer. To make enough money, he goes to visit his customers from district to district because he does not have the money to establish a photo studio. Very dynamic and devoted, he has quickly gained the trust of his customers and is in high demand, especially for big events. At the request of many of his customers, he would like to open his own studio. This project requires the capital that Mr. S.'s small income would not be able to support. He would therefore like to ask for a credit of $700 to open his own studio, buy a high-quality camera as well as a video camera for event reporting. This credit will allow him to bring his work to a more professional level and, ultimately, earn a better income.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 22 Septembre 1983, Monsieur S. Kévin est photographe de formation. Pour se prendre en charge, il se promène de quartier en quartier pour aller vers les clients car il n’a pas les moyens d’avoir un studio photo. Très dynamique et dévoué, il gagna vite la confiance de ses clients et est très sollicité aujourd’hui surtout dans les grandes manifestations. A la demande de ses nombreux clients, il souhaite ouvrir son propre studio. Ce projet nécessite assez de moyens que les petites économies de Monsieur S. ne pourront pas supporter. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $700 pour ouvrir son atelier, acquérir un appareil photo de bonne qualité et une caméra pour les minis reportages des fêtes. L’octroi de ce crédit lui permettra de professionnaliser son travail et d’en tirer plus de revenu.

loans.use: Open a photo studio, buy a high-quality camera and a video camera

loans.name: Afi Virginie

texts.en:
Born in 1978, Miss Afi Virginia K. has had her small business for 4 years. Thanks to her income, she takes care of her mother and brothers. Miss K. sells groceries and staple goods. She is a very dynamic and entrepreneurial woman. Her business know-how and enthusiasm has brought in a growing customer base, and she is now looking to grow her business to be able to efficiently respond to the needs of her clientele. To this end, she would like to open a shop for her business and is asking for a $700 loan to do so. Moreover, this credit will help increase her inventory, which will, in turn, help her increase her sales and improve her economic and social status.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1978, Mlle K. Afi Virginie exerce son petit commerce depuis 4 ans. Elle a à charge sa mère et ses frères qu’elle se doit d’entretenir grâce aux revenus de ce commerce. Mlle K. vend des produits d’alimentation, des produits génériques et des produits de première nécessité. C’est une femme très dynamique et très entreprenante. Son enthousiasme et son savoir faire lui ont procuré une clientèle abondante et elle cherche aujourd’hui à agrandir son commerce pour pouvoir répondre efficacement à la demande qui s’offre à elle. Elle désire à cet effet ouvrir une boutique afin de donner une envergure professionnelle à l’activité. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $700 pour acquérir un local qui va lui servir de boutique. De plus ce crédit l’aidera à augmenter son stock, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et améliorer sa condition économique et sociale.

loans.use: Buy a shop that will serve as a grocery store

loans.name: Abiassi Agbo

texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Aného, Mr. Abiassi Agbo B. is married and a father of two (2) children. Because he is blind, he always stays in the family house. In spite of his handicap, he has become an artisan. The quality of his works surprises the locals, and he thus has a large client base who order his products. This business makes it possible for Mr B. to provide for the needs for his small family. The main products he makes are chairs, cloths and scarves. He would now like to open a gallery in order to better showcase his products. His work is highly regarded and appreciated in the area. He is asking for a loan of $650 to carry out this project and to improve the standard of living of his family. To support this project of a blind person, is to encourage handicapped people to support themselves.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1968 à Aného, Monsieur B. Abiassi Agbo est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. A cause de son handicap de non voyant, il demeure toujours dans la maison familiale. Malgré son infirmité, il a pu apprendre le métier de tisserand qu’il exerce aujourd’hui. La qualité de ses œuvres surprend les habitants de sa localité. C’est ainsi qu’il a une clientèle importante qui raffole ses produits. Cette activité permet à Monsieur B. de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille. Les principaux produits qu’il fabrique sont les chaises, les nattes, les pagnes et les foulards. Afin de faire mieux apprécier ses produits, il voudrait ouvrir une boutique d’exposition de ses œuvres. Ses fabrications sont très appréciées dans le milieu. Il sollicite un appui financier de $650 pour réaliser son projet et changer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Soutenir ce projet d’un mal voyant, c’est encourager les handicapés à se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Open an artisan shop

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Bread is one of the most consumed foods in Togo and particularly in Aného (Prefecture of the Lakes). Born in 1977, Mrs. Abla A. has has been making and selling bread for 7 years already. She is married and a mother of three (3) children. Her husband has been unemployed for the last few years also helps with the business. The growing business makes it possible for Mrs. A. to meet the family's needs. The exceptional quality of the bread she sells has brought her many loyal customers. Bread retailers come in great numbers for their own supplies. However, she cannot meet the market needs because she is limited in the production of the bread. She is thus looking to build a new oven and increase the daily production. Unfortunately, her income does not enable her to cover all the expenses of this undertaking. She is thus asking for a loan of $850 to build a second oven. This will, in turn, increase the family income and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Le pain est l’une des denrées alimentaires les plus consommées au Togo et particulièrement à Aného (Préfecture des Lacs). Née en 1977, Madame A. Abla exerce comme activité la fabrication et la vente du pain depuis 7 ans déjà. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Son époux qui est sans emploi depuis quelques années l’aide dans ses tâches. L’activité très florissante, permet à Madame A. de satisfaire dans une grande mesure les besoins de la famille. La qualité exceptionnelle du pain qu’elle vend sur le marché fait qu’elle a une clientèle abondante. Les revendeurs de pain viennent en grand nombre s’en approvisionner. Aujourd’hui, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire tout le monde car elle est limitée dans la production. Elle cherche à fabriquer un nouveau four en vue d’augmenter la production quotidienne du pain. Malheureusement, son économie ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les dépenses que cette restructuration nécessiterait. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour construire un second four. Ca permettra d’augmenter le revenu familial et améliorer les conditions de vie.

loans.use: Build a second oven

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en: Née en 1960 à Aného, Madame A. Véronique est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Son époux en retraite depuis 5 ans n’arrive plus à assumer les charges de la famille car sa pension de retraite est très insuffisante. Exerçant comme activité le tissage et la vente des nattes, Madame A. arrive à subvenir aux charges du ménage avec son petit  revenu. Elle vient de recevoir une importante commande de 400 nattes d’une gamme spéciale. Avec son équipe, elle a décidé de satisfaire cette commande provenant d’un centre de formation pour jeunes délinquants. Les nattes commandées sont de grandes dimensions et demandent plus de travail parce qu’il faut y insérer le logo du centre. Seulement,  Madame A. n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour faire ce travail. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $750 pour acheter les matériaux de fabrication et engager quelques personnes pour que le travail soit rapide. Cette commande va beaucoup augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et changer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: acheter les matériaux de fabrication

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.

The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively.

loans.use: To purchase five fowls.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.

The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively.  This loan will ensure that I meet my basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase five fowls.

loans.name: Laureen

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.

The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively.  This loan will ensure that I meet my basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase five fowls.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.

The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively.  This loan will ensure that I meet my basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase five fowls.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: I do business in Kisumu Town. I have 3 children and am a single mother. I want the loan to expand my business and purchase clothes for the season. School is currently openning and many customers want to buy school uniforms for both primary and secondary schools.

loans.use: To purchase and stock my second hand clothing business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: I am a retailer of bakery products in Kisumu Town. I am married with 4 children. I will use the loan to assist me in purchasing a microwave. My clients demand hot food and because I only retail the product I need to install a microwave. I will retain more customers and also make more money to feed my children and ensure that they remain in school.

loans.use: To purchase a microwave to heat bakery products for my customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
I sell small food stuffs like beans, rice, and flour outside my house in Manyatta, Kisumu.
I am married with 2 children. I wish to get a loan to pay for an annual license and purchase more cereals.

loans.use: I will purchase an annual license and broaden my stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I need the loan to expand my second hand clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand my brick business. I will hire a brick making machine for 3 weeks to make 5,000 bricks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty has a unique business in the community she lives in. She owns a laundry mat where she charges her clients per load. She started her business off by financing a washing machine. She now has increased the number of washers and allows clients to rent them. Although her home is made of wood, she has placed the washers inside and has done business from her house. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in a dryer. Currently, her clients can only wash the wet clothes and must take them home to hang dry. She hopes that with this new investment she will be able to increase her profits. She is a single mother of four children who completely depends on this business to feed her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in a dryer for her laundry mat.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie visits homes offering her product and services. She is a woman of many trades as she provides not only clothing and cosmetics, but also facials and manicures. She is very popular amongst the women in her neighborhood. She started off doing business with a $200 loan from her sister that she used to invest in women’s undergarments. She still sells these items but now offers other types of clothing and cosmetic services. She is requesting the loan in order to continue investing in these items. She also wants to begin selling jewelry and other women’s accessories. Marjorie and her husband, who is also a salesman, have two children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in jewelry and other women's accessories

loans.name: Digan

texts.en:
Digan is a street vendor of clothes but also has a small business at home. She started the business with the help of her husband who provided $200 in start up in capital. She started selling only children’s clothes but now also provides clothes for men and women. Although the clothes sales do provide for her family, she needs to make more money in order to provide a better standard of living. She wants to invest the loan she receives in household items that she can also sell and provide more profit. She is 42 years old and moved to Guayaquil from a rural sector known as Los Rios. She has one daughter who she wants to educate past the high school level.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in household products to sell

loans.name: Leyda

texts.en:
Leyda has a small beauty shop where she cuts men and women’s hair. She started out in this line of work by offering her services at people’s homes, but now she has set up a part of her own house to work from. She has just started selling jewelry and other accessories to her clients as a part of her business. Leyda wants to continue investing in items to sell as complimentary goods from her business. She has noticed that by having people come in for haircuts she can also market these other goods. She and her husband have three kids. She is very optimistic about receiving the loan for her business and the good of her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in complimentary products to sell from her beauty shop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a general store where she provides many of the items the community uses in daily consumption. When she started, she only had $100 of capital and could only sell vegetables from a stand. Now her store has items ranging from food to office supplies to cleaning products for the home. She is requesting the new loan because she wants to continue investing in all of her merchandise but also wants to introduce baby products into her sales. She sees that diapers and formula are highly in demand and she wants to take advantage of the business opportunity. Esther moved to Guayaquil from a rural sector named Los Rios. She has three children that she works very hard to educate and to feed.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in baby products

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is a wholesale distributor of rice in her area. She started the business with the help of her parents who had the contacts to buy the rice at low prices. At first, she sold to individuals in the community from her home, but she realized there were better opportunities as a whole sale distributor. She is requesting the loan because along with her rice distribution, she wants to open a small store from her home. She will sell rice and other basic groceries to her neighbor and people in the vicinity. Marcia has two kids, but only one of them goes to school. The other is handicapped and therefore taken care and home schooled by Marcia. Marcia wants to continue growing this business because it allows her to be with her family and also provides for them. She hopes that with the increased profits she can provide more for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Open a small store from her home

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has a small ice cream shop. He started the business selling ice cream on the streets and near bus stops. Slowly he began to move closer to home and sell to the local schools until he moved the business into his home. He now runs a much larger operation from his home, where he provides the ice cream for 5 street vendors while he sells the product out of his home. Francisco is very proud of the way his business has grown but does not want to stop here. He needs the loan in order to invest in a new freezer and chairs for his clients. He is 42 years old and has one child with his wife. He will use the extra profits from his investment to fix up his home and save for the education of his children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a freezer and chairs for his ice cream shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa and her husband have a furniture making business. She runs the administrative and sales parts while her husband produces the goods to sell. They started off with about $300 of their savings. They only made chairs and desks at first, but now they have moved into producing all types of bedroom furniture. They well use the loan in order to invest in wood which is getting more expensive at this time of year. Rosa is 37 years old, she and her husband have two children. They completely depend on this business to provide for them and their children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in wood for furniture making

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa owns a small food market very well situated on a main street. Elsa started the store with a family member who helped her with $100. At first she only sold candy and snacks, but she has slowly evolved into a small groceries market. Elsa will use her loan in order to continue to invest in new items like dairy products and canned goods. She is sure that with the loan her business activity will increase and she will bring in more profits. Elsa has been divorced for about 10 years. She has a son that still lives at home. She completely depends on the business to meet the needs of the household.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She wants to invest in goods for her store

loans.name: Maira

texts.en:
Maira has about 4 years of experience catching and selling crab. Her husband has been in the industry since he was 12 years when he used to go out and catch crab with his dad. After marrying, Maria’s husband taught her the tricks of the trade and they decided to start a business of their own. They now wake up at 5 am to catch the crabs and work until 2 pm cooking and selling them. Maria is requesting the loan in order to invest in other seafood that she may couple with her crab selling. She is confident that the investment will be worthwhile. Maria is 19 years old and only has one 3 year old son. Her and her husband work very diligently and are hopeful that the loan will help them get ahead.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in other seafood products

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix has a laundry mat in the local community. These businesses are somewhat new in the area, but they have proven to be successful. He started off with 2 washing machines that he rented out. He now has 4 and has become very popular in the neighborhood for his service that is convenient and cheap. He wants to invest in a new machine now that business is on the rise and he has used up all his savings. He works everyday from 6 am until 6 pm while his wife sells candies from his store. Together they have two children, one of which unfortunately has a mental disability. They hope with this loan they can continue to grow the laundry mat and provide for their family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in a new washing machine

loans.name: Jamela

texts.en:
Jamela is 32 years old with her 7 children living in district 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is married and she took out a loan for her son to increase his business. She hopes to receive more loans through AFSG to continue her son's business.

loans.use: To buy fuel and gas for her son.

payments.comment: Due to an administrative error, Jamela Gul Ahmad\'s individual repayments were not reported to Kiva.  She has, however, successfully paid back the loan to the field partner.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.en:
Fazila is 19 years old girl living in district 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is single and continuing her studies, but she took loan for her brother to help grow his business. She believes that AFSG gives him more loan cycles to increase her brother's business.

loans.use: Buying goods and fresh vegitable.

loans.name: Bibi Jan

texts.en:
Bibi Jan is 20 years old and lives with her 3 children in the Afshar Selow district of Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is married and would like a loan so she can work alongside her husband to enhance their financial situation.


She hopes to receive her first loan through AFSG so she can continue her husband's business and support her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy wood and flour for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Maleha

texts.en:
Maleha is a 21 year old girl living in a household of four in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Maleha and her father Abdul Gafor are doing a share business of selling fresh vegetables and other goods, she normally package the goods and her father is selling them in the shop near to their house.
 
She would like to take a loan so her they can grow small business and get financial income to support the family.

Being an Afghan women it is very difficult to go out side of the house for working, taking photo is more than that so AFSG could not have permission from Maleha's family for taking photo.

loans.use: To buy goods and fresh fruits.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Aného in Togo, Mrs Véronique A. is married and the mother of six (6) children. Her husband, who retired 5 years ago, is unable to meet the family’s needs as his pension is very insufficient. Working as a weaver and selling the mats she creates, Mrs A. is able to provide for her family with her small revenue. She has just received a large order for a special line of 400 mats. The order comes from a centre which trains juvenile delinquents. The mats ordered are of a large size and require more work because the logo of the centre needs to be inserted. Mrs A. and her team don’t have the necessary resources to do the work. She is asking for a loan of $750 to buy the needed materials and to hire a few people so the work will be done quickly. This order will increase her sales a lot and change her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1960 à Aného, Madame A. Véronique est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Son époux en retraite depuis 5 ans n’arrive plus à assumer les charges de la famille car sa pension de retraite est très insuffisante. Exerçant comme activité le tissage et la vente des nattes, Madame A. arrive à subvenir aux charges du ménage avec son petit revenu. Elle vient de recevoir une importante commande de 400 nattes d’une gamme spéciale. Avec son équipe, elle a décidé de satisfaire cette commande provenant d’un centre de formation pour jeunes délinquants. Les nattes commandées sont de grandes dimensions et demandent plus de travail parce qu’il faut y insérer le logo du centre. Seulement, Madame A. n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour faire ce travail. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $750 pour acheter les matériaux de fabrication et engager quelques personnes pour que le travail soit rapide. Cette commande va beaucoup augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et changer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: buy materials to make mats

loans.name: Laetitia Tchotcho

texts.en:
Born on March 3rd, 1980 in Aného, Miss Laetitia Tchotcho K. is a graduate of a fashion house in Lomé. When she returned to Aného five years ago she opened her own sewing shop. She noticed that many of her clients were asking for embroidery work so she went to do some vocational training in embroidery over the last five months. Intelligent and sincere, Miss K. likes to do good work. She charms her clients by the quality of her service. Today, to be able to completely satisfy her numerous and demanding clients, she wants to equip her sewing shop with an embroidery machine and use all her talents. To do this she is asking for a loan of $700 to buy an embroidery machine to meet the new demands of her clients. This will allow her to increase her revenue and assure her financial independence.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 3 Mars 1980 à Aného, Mlle K. Laetitia Tchotcho est diplômée d’une maison de couture à Lomé. Revenue à Aného, elle a ouvert son atelier de couture il y a 5 ans. Elle a remarqué que beaucoup de ses clientes demandent à se faire broder leurs habits et elle est allée faire un stage en broderie au cours de ces cinq derniers mois. Intelligente, sincère et aimant le travail bien fait, elle séduit sa clientèle par la qualité de son service. Aujourd’hui, pour pouvoir donner une satisfaction totale à ses nombreux et exigeants clients, elle veut doter son atelier d’une machine à broder et faire valoir tous ses talents. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour acquérir la machine à broder afin d’être à la hauteur des nouvelles exigences de ses clients. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et d’assurer son autonomie financière.

loans.use: buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Têlé

texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Agbodrafo (Lakes Prefecture), Mrs Têlé A. is married and the mother of five (5) children. In addition to her own children, she also takes care of two (2) children of her eldest child. A dynamic woman who is full of hope, she has a stall of kitchen utensils and accessories at her local market. Widowed for the last two years, she has had a difficult time supporting her family. At the moment, her local market is becoming a regional market with much larger crowds. She wants to take advantage of the opportunity to make her business more professional. Only the improvement and increase of her business will allow her to properly meet the needs of her children. That is why she is asking for a loan of $600 to increase and diversify the products she sells to take advantage of this new chance and improve her standard of living. To finance this business is to ease of suffering of an entire family beset by daily difficulties.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1963 à Agbodrafo (Préfecture des Lacs) Madame A. Têlé est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. En plus de ses enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (2) petits fils de son aîné. Femme dynamique et pleine d’espoir, elle dispose d’un étalage d’ustensiles et accessoires de cuisine au marché de sa localité. Veuve depuis 2 ans, elle a du mal à supporter les charges familiales. Actuellement, le marché de sa localité est en passe de devenir un marché régional et on y note une très grande affluence. Aussi veut-elle profiter de cette occasion pour rendre professionnelle son activité. Seul le renforcement de son commerce pourra lui permettre d’assumer convenablement les besoins de ses enfants. Pour y parvenir, il lui faut de l’argent. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour augmenter et diversifier ses produits afin de tirer profit de cette nouvelle donne et relever son niveau de vie. Financer cette affaire, c’est soulager les souffrances de toute une famille en proie aux difficultés quotidiennes.

loans.use: buying and reselling utensils and kitchen accessories

loans.name: Rohena

texts.en:
Rohena is 42 years old and feeding a household of 8 living in District 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Roshena and her Husband Abdul Waheed are doing a family business where both can be active, she is purchasing Beans and Peas, cook them at home and then her husband sells them on the street in a small cart.
In Afghan society it is very difficult for a women to sell goods in the street or even in the shop, but with all those problems she is trying to be an active business woman.
Even though her husband is an educated person but becouse he is an Afghan he does not allow her wife to post her photo.

She already repaid a 1st and 2nd loan succesfully and would now like a 3rd cycle loan through AFSG

loans.use: To buy beans and peas

loans.name: Mana

texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Lomé, Mrs Mana O. is married and mother of six (6) children. She sells smoked fish to make her living and provide for her family. She owns an oven to smoke the fish, but because of an increase in the population of her village and the increase in demand for her smoked fish, she hopes to install a new oven which will allow her to smoke more fish. The experience she has in this field and her management sense will allow her to successfully expand her business. However, to make this new project a reality she needs some financial support. That is why she is asking for a loan of $650 to expand her business and increase her sales. This project is worthy of support because it will allow Mrs O. to take proper care of her children.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1966 à Lomé, Madame O. Mana est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants tous à sa charge. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de poissons fumés pour assumer les charges de sa famille. Elle dispose d’un four de poissons, mais face à l’augmentation de la population de son village et à la croissante demande en poissons fumés, elle souhaiterait fabriquer un nouveau four qui lui permettrait de fumer plus de poissons. L’expérience qu’elle a dans le domaine et son sens de gestion lui permettront de mener à bien cet élargissement de l’activité. Mais pour réaliser ce nouveau projet, elle a besoin d’un appui financier. Ce qui l’amène à solliciter ce crédit de $650 pour agrandir la taille de son commerce et accroître son chiffre d’affaire. Ce projet mérite d’être soutenu car sa réalisation va permettre à Madame O. de bien prendre soins de ses enfants.

loans.use: Make a second oven to smoke fish

loans.name: Mary Jan

texts.en:
Mary Jan is 45 years old and living with her 9 children in District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan.

Mary Jan and Said Mohammad are doing a family business, they both are trying to do a successful business, Mary Jan is purchasing the supply from the main market and whole sellers and her husband sells them in the shop, due to the Afghan cultuer Mary Jan herself is not able to be in the shop.

She already passed a 1st and 2nd loan cycle, now continuing with a 3rd loan cycle from AFSG.

loans.use: To buy goods and supplies for their shop

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Mrs Akossiwa N. was born in 1959 in Tsévié. Married and mother of five (5) children, she has owned a shoe selling business for the last 5 years. On top of this business, she also does some subsistance farming. The farming is becoming more and more difficult, so she has decided to devote her time entirely to the shoe selling business, which is much more profitable. She wants to diversify her range of products by adding handbags and belts. Despite the fact she doesn’t have a lot of education, she has mastered the concepts of management. She has already paid back her first loan without any incident. Today, to strenghten her business, she is asking for another loan, of $650. She will use the money as business capital to buy and sell shoes, handbags and belts. This will allow her to satisfy the demands of her clients and increase her income, allowing her to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame N. Akossiwa est née en 1959 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, elle tient depuis 5 ans un commerce de chaussures. Parallèlement à cette activité, elle fait l’agriculture de subsistance. Cette dernière activité devenant de plus en plus épuisante, elle a décidé de se consacré entièrement au commerce des chaussures qui est beaucoup plus rentable. Mais elle veut diversifier la gamme de ses produits en y ajoutant des sacs et des ceintures. Bien qu’elle n’ait pas évolué dans ses études, elle maîtrise les notions de gestion. Elle a remboursé son premier crédit sans aucun incident. Aujourd’hui, pour renforcer cette activité, elle demande un crédit de $650 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des chaussures, des sacs et des ceintures. Cela permettra de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et d’augmenter son revenu afin d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and selling of shoes, handbags and belts

loans.name: Masooda

texts.en:
Masooda, who is 23 years old, lives in a household of 5 in District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is married and  passed 4 years of her life in a difficult situation before she started to take a loan from AFSG.

Masooda and her husband Ghulam Mohammad are doing a share business of grocery shop.
Masooda is cleaning the dried fruit and package them and her husband sells them in the shop, in the winter time she makes jam and pickles and vinegar for her husband shop.

She helped her husband and took a loan through AFSG so that her husband can buy lots of goods for his shop. Right now she passed the 1st cycle loan and is continuing with a 2nd loan cycle. She believes that taking a loan and spending it  on thier business will create benefits  and grow fast.

After 30 years of war in Afghanistatn, an additional challenge was that the war had left its mark on women in Afghanistan. Even after that, many women continued to be restricted to their homes and doubted their ability to cope in the outside world or to run a successful business. Many women who were part of a small home business had no idea of the value of their work or of their products on the market.
So AFSG started to focus and lend only to those women who can be at least a part of the business with the male member of thier family.
Masooda is one of those women who is not allow to go out side of her house but still she is trying to help her family, due to all those problems she AFSG is not able to post her photo on the site but perfer to have her husband on his working.

loans.use: To buy Goods

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Glidji (Lakes Prefecture), Mrs Ablavi H. is married and the mother of eight (8) children. In her town, the raw materials needed to fabricate mats are readily available. This is an opportunity for Mrs H., who weaves mats as a profession. Abandoned by an irresponsible husband, she is raising her children alone under difficult conditions. Her first four children, who weren’t able to go to school because of a lack of means, are today working as weavers. It is because of this activity that her children can make their own money and take care of their own needs. This is a help to the whole family. This is why she is asking for a loan of $600, which will allow her to buy larger quantities of raw materials to make mats. This will increase her sales and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1962 à Glidji (Préfecture des Lacs), Madame H. Ablavi est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants. Dans sa localité, les matières premières nécessaires à la fabrication des nattes sont abondantes. Ce qui constitue une opportunité pour Madame H. qui fait la tresse des nattes comme profession. Abandonnée par un mari irresponsable, elle élève seule ses enfants dans des conditions pénibles. Ses quatre premiers enfants n’ont n’ayant pu aller à l’école faute de moyens sont aujourd’hui initiés à la tresse des nattes. Et c’est grâce à cette activité que la famille parvient à survivre. Elle a l’ambition d’élargir l’activité, pour que ses enfants puissent aussi en tirer profit et subvenir eux-mêmes à leurs besoins. Cela y va du bien-être de toute la famille. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit $600 qui va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en quantité des matières premières pour la fabrication des nattes. Ceci va accroître son chiffre d’affaire et améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: buying raw materials to make mats

loans.name: Miboussomékpo

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Mrs Miboussomékpo A. is married and the mother of five (5) children. For the last 8 years, she has run a business fabricating and selling mats. The business of mat making is booming in her town. It is because of this that she is able to contribute to the running of her household. Three months ago, she began making woven baskets because she realized that this would also be profitable. The demand for these baskets has been very strong and they need to been made in large quantities to meet the demand - particularly from tomato producers. To suitably meet the demand of people wanting to buy her baskets, Mrs A. needs some financial support. She is asking for a loan of $700, which she will use as business capital to buy raw materials needed to make mats and baskets. This will increase her income and improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965, Madame A. Miboussomékpo est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a comme profession la fabrication et la vente des nattes, activité qu’elle exerce depuis 8 ans. Le commerce des nattes est une activité très florissante dans cette localité. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle contribue aux charges du ménage. Il y a 3 mois, elle s’est initiée à la fabrication des paniers car elle s’est rendue compte que ce commerce aussi est très rentable. Mais la demande étant très forte, il faut en fabriquer en grande quantité pour les livrer aux producteurs de tomates surtout. Pour pouvoir satisfaire convenablement les acheteurs de nattes et de paniers, Madame A. a besoin d’un appui financier. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat des matières premières nécessaires pour la fabrication des nattes et des paniers. Ceci augmentera son revenu et améliorera ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials to make mats and baskets

loans.name: Sakena

texts.en:
Sakena was born in 1986 in Kabul City, Afghanistan. Right now she is single, living with her 6 family members.

Sakena is working together with her brother, weaving carpets, but her family income is rather limited. She decided to take a loan through AFSG so she can buy thread and weave the carpets. Then her brother can sell them in the bazaar at a high prize.

loans.use: To buy thread

loans.name: Bibi Khadeja

texts.en:
Bibi Khadeja was born in 1946 in Kabul City, Afghanistan, Bib Khadeja is a widow and a mother of 7 children.

She lost her husband during the war and now she is living with her kids, M. Ashmat is her eldest son who is supporting his family.

Bibi Khadija is purchasing the supplies for her son's shop and M. Ashamt sells them, they have a very good and successful business and got the loan to improve her. 

Becouse she is an Afghan woman so her in-laws do not allow her to take photo for posting. 

She plans to expand her business, therefore she took a loan from AFSG to buy lots of goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Têko

texts.en:
Born in 1952, Mr Têko F. B. is married and father of eight (8) children, four of whom are no longer under his charge. Polygamous, he today finds himself crushed under the weight of his household. Thanks to a first loan of $400 dollars, he was able to install a corn mill in his town and run it with rigor and efficiency. The scope of this activity has allowed him to lighten the suffering of his family. In light of the significant activity at his mill each day, Mr F. B. is thinking he should install a second corn mill. To do this, he needs more consistant financial support. This is why he’s asking for a loan of $850 which will allow him to rent a locale, buy a second mill and have it installed. This will help speed up service and ease the long lines waiting to use his first mill. This will allow Mr. F. B. to increase his income for the well being of his family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1952, Monsieur F. B. Têko est marié et père de huit (8) enfants dont 4 ne sont plus à sa charge. Polygame, il se trouve aujourd’hui écrasé par les lourdes charges de son ménage. Grâce à un premier crédit de $400 obtenu, Il installe un moulin à maïs dans sa localité qu’il arrive à gérer avec rigueur et efficacité. L’ampleur de l’activité de ce moulin a permis d’alléger les souffrances de la famille. Vu l’importance de la clientèle dans le moulin chaque jour, Monsieur F. B. a pensé qu’il faudrait en installer un second. Pour cela, il lui faut un appui financier plus consistant. C’est dans ce sens qu’il sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre de louer un local, d’acheter le second moulin et de faire l’installation. Ceci aiderait à rendre plus rapide la prestation de travail et à soulager la longue attente des clients. Cela permettra à Monsieur F. B. d’améliorer son revenu pour le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: buying a second corn mill

loans.name: Adoudé Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs Adoudé Mercy A. A. was born in 1968. Married and the mother of two (2) children, she also has charge of her sick mother. For that last 8 years, she has operated a business producing and selling palm oil - a very popular oil used for cooking in her town. This has allowed her to contribute to running of her household with her modest income. The production and stocking of palm oil requires enough money. It is necessary to first buy the palm nuts before making the oil. This preparation also requires wood for burning and a lot of care and precision. It is meticulous work. To store the oil, one needs to buy drums. Palm oil is a much loved part of Togolese cuisine and her business is flourishing. Mrs A. A. is asking for a loan of $600 to improve her production and satisfy her ever increasing clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. A. Adoudé Mercy est née en 1968. Mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, elle a à sa charge sa mère malade. Depuis 8 ans, elle exerce le commerce d’huile de palme (huile très utilisée pour la cuisine dans sa localité). Ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux charges du ménage avec son revenu, aussi modeste soit-il. La production et le stockage d’huile de palme nécessitent assez de fonds. Il faut d’abord s’approvisionner en noix de palme avant de faire la préparation. Cette préparation nécessite également de bois de chauffe et se fait avec beaucoup de soins et de précision. C’est un travail méticuleux. Pour le stockage, il faut des bidons qu’il faut aussi acquérir. L’huile de palme est une denrée très appréciée dans les préparations culinaires togolaises et son commerce est florissant. Madame A. A. sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir améliorer sa production et satisfaire sa clientèle qui croît de jour en jour.

loans.use: purchase of palm nuts for the preparation of palm oil

loans.name: Karema

texts.en:
Karema is 23 years old and a mother of 7 children,living in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She already passed a 1st and 2nd loan cycle and continuing with her 3rd loan cycle she has been able to set up a beauty shop in her home area.

The shop requires stock to cater for customers' needs and to buy hair braids, weaves and wigs. Therefore she decided to take a loan from AFSG who believe that her business will increase and she will be able to pay her children's school fee.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves, braids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hameda

texts.en:
Hameda was born in 1989, living with her family in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan in a household of 10.

Hameda and her Brother Abdul Hamed has a share business of selling vegetable, she is normally cleaning and package the vegetable at home and her brother is selling them at a small cart in the street near to their house.

She took the 3rd cycle loan from AFSG to improve their business, they are doing this busienss since 3 years. They can generates enough to cover the needs of thier family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fresh fruits

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana operates a fast food establishment in a populous  area of Accra. She operates in the evenings when workers have have finished their jobs for the day and patronage very high. Her sales turnover is very high. Diana is a trainee of the TEACH lending programme. She wants a loan to improve her catering service.

loans.use: Microwave Oven

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: A 44-year-old woman, Mrs Fidelia A. lives in an urban area in Edo State of Nigeria.  She is married with two children.  She spent 6 months learning her trade, after which she opened her own store in 1985.  She says the loan will make it possible for her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs Helen E. is 44 years old. She lives in a semi-urban part of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells her goods to people in her community. She is married with seven children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says her business will improve with a loan of $350.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs Faith O. is 30 years old, married with two children. She operates her business in Benin City, an urban center in Nigeria. She needs the sum of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalene Osabokhan is 51-year-old woman, who lives a semi-rural area of Edo State, Nigeria. She cherishes her business so much that she learnt it for 6 months before started her own. She hopes to expand her business with the stated amount.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: A dedicated LAPO woman who is a leader in her group, Mrs Helen E. is 48 years old with five children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo state of Nigeria.  She learnt her trade for five months before she started her own business in 1997. She is anxious to get the requested amount to enable her buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sales

loans.name: Nosa

texts.en: "I am proud to be a LAPO member for four years," explains Mr. Nosa E..  He is 36 years old and married with a child. He lives in Benin City of Edo state. He had training for 3 years before he finally started his own business. He says the loan amount will enable him to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Mrs. Philo O. is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City of Edo State, Nigeria. She asks for the above amount for the expansion for her business.

loans.use: To buy more girlswear for sale

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married and has one son. Her husband helps her with the business and her son is in college. Yelena attended University and after graduating she worked for a time as a merchandising expert. However, the need for higher income - to help meet her family’s needs and ensure her son’s education - prompted her to move into the market business selling groceries. Yelena has gained much rich experience working in the market trade. Her perseverance and diligent work have been keys to her success. The availability of loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” has also been a big help to her business. Just recently, Yelena was able to purchase a stand in the busiest market in the city. Yelena is requesting a loan of $1,200 for several purposes. She’d like to increase her turnover capital, purchase additional merchandise, and buy a new refrigerator to store perishable food items. Fresh dairy products, canned corn, peas, fruit and quality vegetable oil are just some of the many items Yelana beautifully arranges on her stand to attract customers in the busy market. The ability to purchase more items and get a new refrigerator to keep groceries fresh will help Yelena meet the high demand for these food items. Increased business income will generate more funds to help pay for her son’s college tuition and continue to secure her family’s well-being.

Олена – одружена, має сина. Її чоловік допомагає їй з бізнесом, син навчається в університеті. Олена має вищу освіту. Після закінчення вузу деякий час працювала товарознавцем. Однак потреба в грошах та необхідність забезпечити навчання для сина примусили її почати власний бізнес з продажу продуктів харчування. Олена має багатий досвід торгівлі на ринку. Наполеглива праця забезпечила їй успіх в бізнесі. Можливість користуватися позиками „Надії України” також відіграла неабияку роль в розвитку її бізнесу. Зовсім нещодавно Олена придбала прилавок на найбільшому ринку міста. Олена просить про позику в 1200 доларів через декілька причин. Вона планує збільшити робочий капітал, розширити асортимент продтоварів та купити нову холодильну камеру для того, щоб зберігати продукти, що можуть зіпсуватися. Свіжі молочні продукти, консервовані кукурудза, горох, фрукти та олія – це лише деякі найменування товарів, які Олена пропонує своїм покупцям. Можливість розширити асортимент товарів харчування та придбати новий холодильник для зберігання продуктів допоможе Олені задовольнити потреби покупців. Дохід від торгівлі допоможе Олені отримати гроші для того, щоб заплатити за навчання сина та забезпечити добробут своєї родини.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator for groceries

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. lives in a semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria.  She is married with two children and is 48 years of age. A dedicated LAPO client, she learnt her business for three months before opening hers in 1997. She asks for the above amount for the expansion for her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs Magdalene O. is a young woman of 42 years old. She is a dynamic client of LAPO who specializes in the sale of provisions for people in her community. She is bent on improving her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: A 31-year-old experienced trader, Mrs Mercy B. sell food items for people in her community. To meet the demand of her customers, she needs a loan of $350.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is in the bicycle sales business selling recreational and performance bikes. He owns a small, comfortable pavilion where he offers a variety of bicycles and supplementary components. Oleg has been a client of “Nadiya Ukraine” for more than 4 years. He acknowledges that loans have been an essential part of the growth of his business. He was able to purchase a van using credit which has made his business more flexible and mobile. Currently Oleg’s net sales profit amounts to 50-70% which helps create stable growth for his business. Oleg is requesting a loan to increase his inventory of bicycles and various components. He is planning to buy bikes designed for urban use, mountain bikes and road bikes. He is able to purchase in bulk for good prices at a wholesale market. Prompt loan repayment and self-discipline have characterized Oleg in the past. Financial assistance will continue to promote the growth of his business and give many bike-lovers the extra moments of joy, speed and adventure that come with riding.

Олег займається бізнесом з продажу велосипедів для відпочинку та професійного спорту. Він – власник зручного павільйону, в якому можна знайти різноманітні велосипеди та запчастини для них. Олег співпрацює з „Надією України” більше 4 років. Він визнає, що позики відіграли важливу роль у розвитку його бізнесу. Завдяки одній з позик він зміг придбати мікроавтобус і це зробило його бізнес більш мобільним. Чистий прибуток його бізнесу становить від 50 до70 відсотків, а це сприяє стабільному зростанню торгівлі. Олег просить про позику для того, щоб розширити асортимент велосипедів та запчастин для них. Він планує купити велосипеди призначені для пересування містом, гірські та дорожні велосипеди. Олег хоче купити товар оптом для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Його завжди відрізняла дисциплінованість та вчасна сплата позик в „Надії України”. Фінансова допомога сприятиме зростанню його бізнесу та подарує багатьом велосипедистам хвилини радості, швидкості та пригод під час їзди.

loans.use: To increase inventory of bicycles and components

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: "There is a positive difference in my life," explained Mrs Josephine I.. She is married with five children and lives in a semi-rural area of Edo State. She provides the service of hairdressing for the community. She needs the amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs Mary O. is 40 years old. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she sells plastics and rubber to customers in her community. She is married with eight children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says if she is loaned the sum of $300, her business will improve.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: 35-year-old Mrs Eunice O. lives in a semi urban area of Edo State, Nigeria.  She is married with six children. She sells food items to the community. She hopes to borrow the above money for her business expansion.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Imunwanhen

texts.en: A business-woman with 24 years experience, Mrs Imunwanhen A. lives in Benin City with two children.  She needs the loan amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen O. is a distinguished LAPO client who smiles when it comes to talking about her business. She is 45 years old and married with five children. "I am in need of the sum of $450 for my business expansion," she says.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Mrs. Margaret E. is married with four children. She is a 46-year-old LAPO client. She started the business three years ago and she is delighted to engage in the sale of foodstuffs.  She is optimistic that her business will improve if loaned the sum if $350.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: 45-year-old Mr Vincent A. lives in an urban area in Edo State, Nigeria.  He learnt his trade for six years, after which he opened his own business in 2001. He says if the amount is loaned to him, it will help him expand his business.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel is married, is father of 2 children and lives in the city of Monterry in the State of Neuvo Leon. He started his business selling kids' clothes following a large financial investment. Unfortunately the business did not yield the results he hoped for, and this is how he started to sell groceries in local markets. This busines shas given him the results he hoped for. Thanks to his dedication and his hard work, he has been able to provide his children with the needed education, that without this business would not have been possible.

Today Miguel requires a loan in the amount of $250, that he will invest in the purchase of more merchandise to increase his sales. Help him, he needs your generosity. Do not wait, he and his family will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel es casado y padre de 2 hijos, el vive en la localidad de Monterrey, en el estado de Nuevo León, él inició con un negocio de venta de ropa para niños invistiendo una fuerte cantidad de dinero, sin embargo el negocio no dio los resultados esperados, es por ello que empezó a vender mercancía de abarrotes en los mercados rodantes, actividad que le ha dado los resultados esperados. Gracias a su dedicación y trabajo ha podido brindarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria, que sin esta actividad hubiera sido imposible.

En estos momentos Miguel requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 DLLS, mismos que invertirá en la compra de más mercancía para poder de esta forma incrementar sus ventas. Ayúdalo, el necesita de tu generosidad, no lo dudes más, él y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Four years ago Juana started selling used clothing from her home, following the necessity for an income that would purchase school supplies and pay the tuition of her two children, that with her husband's salary would not be possible. First she asked her family for coothes that she could use to sell, something that later evolved into purchasing package lots of clothes. Thanks to the support of her family, Juana still manages her business, always motivated by the enormous wish to provide her children with a better quality of life and future, something that she could only give them through an education, an education she did not have.

Now she needs to purchase two package lots of clothes, as she has run out of merchandise to sell. She also wants to start selling in the local markets to increase her earnings. For all of this she is requesting a loan of $200 that she plans to repay in a term of 3 months. You can become an important part of the efforts of Juana and her family. Do not wait, the decision is in your hands. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 4 años Juana comenzó a vender ropa usada en su domicilio, tras la necesidad de contar con ingresos que le permitieran pagar los útiles escolares y colegiaturas de sus dos hijos, pues con el sueldo de su esposo esto era imposible. Primero pidió a sus familiares ropa que la no les sirviera para comenzar a vender, luego de un tiempo comenzó a comprar pacas de ropa. Gracias al apoyo de su familia, Juana continua con su proyecto, siempre impulsada por el enorme deseo de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida futura y esto sólo puede logarlo proporcionandoles la educación que ella no tuvo.

Ahora ella necesita comprar dos pacas de ropa, pues ya no tiene mercancía que ofrecer, además que comenzará a vender en los mercados rodantes para aumentar sus ingresos. Para esto esta solicitando un crédito de $ 200 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 3 mese. Tu puedes convertirte en parte importante de los logros de Juana y su familia, no lo dudes más, la decisión esta en sus manos, ella te lo va a agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a very active and entrepreneurial woman, and of course, an excellent mother and wife. Two years ago they started to experience financial difficulties in their home. Her husband was working in a carpinter shop and his salary was very little, not enough to fill all of their necessities. This is when Patricia came up with the idea to help her husband to set up his very own carpinter shop, with the help of the severance pay received from his previous job. This is how they started their own business, the same that they continue to manage with mutual effort and dedication.

Patricia now needs a loan of $200 to purchase quality wood with which they can make their creations, and this way increase their sales and their earnings. You can help Patricia and her husband and contribute to the well-being of their children. Do not wait, they sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora y por supuesto una excelente madre y esposa. Hace dos años en su casa comenzaron a tener problemas económicos, pues su esposo trabajaba en una carpintería y sueldo era muy bajo y por ende insuficiente para satisfacer todas las necesidades. Es por ello que Patricia tuvo la idea de ayudar a su esposo para que pusiera su propio taller de carpintería, ayudándose con el capital que le dieron por el retiro de su antiguo trabajo. Es así como comenzaron con su propio negocio, mismo que aún continúa con el esfuerzo y dedicación de ambos.

Ahora Patricia requiere un préstamo de $200 DLLS para comprar madera de calidad con la cual fabrican sus productos, y así poder aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias. Tú puedes apoyar a Patricia y a su esposo y contribuir al bienestar de sus hijos, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Monica Veronica

texts.en:
Monica is mother of a little one of 3 years of age, is married and lives in the city of Monterrey in the State of Neuvo Leon. She has always been an enterprising woman, which is why when her husband faced problems, she started to save some of their income to invest and start selling shoes by catalogue. This is how she was able to help him and how she was able to provide a better quality of life for their son. It has already been one year since she started her business and the extra income has been of great help.

Monica now requires a loan in the amount of $200, which she will use to fill the orders she has received and has not been able to honor due to her lack of liquid capital. You can help her continue supporting her family. The decision is yours, do not wait. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mónica es madre de un pequeñito de 3 años, es casada y vive en la comunidad de Monterrey, en el Estado de Nuevo León. Ella siempre a sido una persona muy emprendedora, es por ello que al ver que su esposo comenzaba a tener problemas con su salario, ella comenzó a designar parte del gasto que él le daba para invertirlo en la ventad e zapatos por catálogo, y de esta manera ayudarlo y poder brindar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Ya es un año de que inició con este proyecto y los ingresos extras que recibe gracias a este les ha sido de mucha ayuda.

Ahora Mónica requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para poder surtir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes, por faltad e capital en este momento Tú puedes ayudarla a continuar ayudando a su familia, la decisión esta en tus manos, no lo dudes más, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nohemi Elizabeth

texts.en:
Nohemi is mother of two children and is married. She lives in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a driver and his earnings are not enough to cover all of the family expenses, which is why four years ago she started her small busienss selling hot dogs from her home. Soon thereafter, with the help of her husband she was able to buy a hot dog cart and she started selling her product at local markets. Thansk to her efforts and dedication she has been able to help her family.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $550 to purchase a larger hot dog cart and consequently offer a better service and carry a greater quantity of products, to meet the high demand that she is currently seeing. With your generosity you can help Nohemi and her family. Do not wait, she and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nohemi es madre de 2 hijos y es casada, vive en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo es chofer foráneo y con lo que gana no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos familiares, es por ello que ya hace 4 años Nohemi tuvo la idea de comenzar con pequeño negocio propio, la elaboración y venta de hot dogs en su propio domicilio. Luego con la ayuda de su marido pudo comprar un carrito pequeño para vender su producto en los mercados rodantes. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha logrado ayudar mucho a su familia.

En este momento, ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 550 DLLS para poder comprar un carro más grande y ofrecer un mejor servicio y una mayor cantidad de productos, dada la fuerte demanda que esta experimentando. Tú con tu generosidad puedes apoyar a Nohemi y su familia, no lo dudes más, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase car for hot dogs

loans.name: Iva

texts.en: Mrs Iva T. is a 62 year old lady that joined SPBD in April 2006. Iva is the only lady in the wheelchair in SPBD’s program in Samoa. She was in her wheelchair in her late thirties, due to mistreating at the hospital. She was awarded second price in our savings progam in 2006. Iva ia a happy lady like any other normal lady, but with the fact that she can’t walk no more, she is not giving up in trying to develop her family. I’ve visited Iva’s home up the mountain, and from there, It had a clear picture of Iva when she was strong. She’s got a beautiful garden in front of her house, and a vegetable garden at her backyard. Due to the fact that she can no longer work in her gardens, she decided to start a business that she can do, which she chooses Elei Printing. Elei printing is a man made Samoan type of  printing that is highly demanded by Samoan staying in Samoa and especially the Samoans staying overseas. After 4 months of starting her business, Iva realized that her business was becoming really successful, due to more demand from her local customers, because of the good quality and neat printings.

loans.use: Loan was used to buy materials, fabric paint and glitters, brushes, carved timber for printing.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Fuatai

texts.en: Fuatai S. is a 63 year old lady, and she joined SPBD in April 2006, with he first loan of $300.00. Fuatai is now on her 4th loan and she never had problems with her repayment. She’s a very creative and talented lady. That enjoys trying out new ideas of creating stuffs. Before joining SPBD, she already had her variety shop, where she spends all her time looking after. Apart from every other product that you can find in any other shop, you can be amazed with other interesting products that Fuatai makes that she also sells in her shop i.e. Samoan Oil that is made from the Moso’oi flower, which is quite famous with Samoans. She also makes S. Cocoa, that is used to make tea. With the Europeans, coffe is what they have for morning tea, but with the Samoan, their coffee is Samoan Cocoa, which we believe gives ua strength for the whole day.Well, you may think that it’s cheap because it’s a local product, but it’s not, for a bottle of Nescafe maybe costs you about $10.00, but for one pack of Samoan Cocoa costs $7.00, and believe it or not, this can only last for half a day. Fuatai also sells clothes that she sew, but mainly school uniform for the kids. Other stuffs she sells, are coconuts, bananas, taro, guavas that she collects from her husbands plantation, and fresh flowers that she picks from her garden. She also do bouquet of flowers for church decorations, weddings etc. With her forth loan now, she’s planning on extending her business selling live chickens and pigs.

loans.use: Restock her shop and home improvement

loans.name: Rosemary
