texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary A. is 38 years old. She lives in a semi-urban part of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells her goods to people in her community. She is married with six children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says that with a loan of $350, her business will be able to expand.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort O. is 55 years old.  She lives in a semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria and is married with five children.  She learnt her trade for four moths, after which she established her business in the year 1985. She asks for the above amount for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. I. is a married woman with three children, living in an urban area in Edo Sate, Nigeria. She cherishes her business so much that she learnt it for a year and later opened hers in 2002. She says if she is loaned the money, it will enable her expand her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary O. lives in a semi-urban area in Edo State, and is married with seven children.  She learnt her trade for three months and started her business in the year 1990. She asks for the above amount for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia O. is a 45-year-old woman who has be a leader in LAPO. She trades in food items and needs the money to buy more goods for sale.  She lives in Benin City in Edo State of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Mrs. Regina B. is 43 years with two children.  She lives in an urban area of Benin City in Edo State of Nigeria. She trades in yams, and she started her business in 2000. She plans to improve her business with the stated amount above.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Glady’S

texts.en: Mrs. Glady’s O. is a 35 year old woman, married with a child. She acquired formal training in business for six months and finally opened her own in the year 2002. She resides in Benin City of Edo State, Nigeria. She plans to increase her business with the stated amount.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Regina

loans.name: Mary

She specializes in hairdressing and she is eager to use the loan to expand her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Ogbonmwan

texts.en:
Mrs. I. Ogbonmwan says that life has become sweet and enjoyable since she became a LAPO member 8 years ago. She hopes to improve her business with the loan that she has requested.

38 year old Mrs. Ogbonmwan and her 5 children live in Benin City, located in the Edo State of Nigeria.

loans.name: Emil

texts.en:
Emil was born in 1982 year in Sumgait. After military service he could not continue his education. Because the family condition was very heavy. He is 24 years old. Emil has rented very small place near the market, has been busy with program service of mobile phones and sales of phone accessories. He do not have enough funds and he wants first loan from KIVA, to develop his business well enough. 
He applies for the loan $700 to expand his business area.

loans.use: To expand his business area

loans.name: Osagiduwa

texts.en: "LAPO has brought rain to my financial desert ever since I became a member," says Mrs. Osagiduwa O.. She is 34 years old with 6 children. Her business specializes in selling cooked food to the community. She is from an urban area of Bini in Nigeria.

loans.name: Shafiqa

texts.en:
Shafiqa is 45 years old. She lives in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan.
She is married and a mother of 5 children. Two years ago, with the support of one of her friends, she opened a beauty shop to support her family and cover household expenses but mainly to give her children a better standard of living and the security to help them finish their professional studies. She continues with her business thanks to her effort and the support of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for her shop

Nasima is 35 years old and a mother of 6 children, living in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan.

It is almost 3 years that she has been working in her shop baking bread and selling to the bazaar 

She hopes to receive a loan through AFSG so she can buy wood and flour and find good income through this business.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy lives in Vituka area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with two children. She owns a small tailoring mart and employs two assistants. She has had  training in entrepreneurship and small business management from Youth Self Emloyment Foundation (YOSEFO). Happy has a plan to expand her business.She needs to add two sewing machines,employ one more assistant and increase the stock of sewing materials.This business expansion will help her increase income thus meet the needs of her family including school fees for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing sewing materials

loans.name: Salum

texts.en: Salum is married with two children.He lives in Vituka area of Dar es Salaam where he owns a small shop in Tandika market in which he sells new imported clothes. He has been in this business for more than six years. He had training in entrepreneurship and small business management offered by Youth Self Employment (YOSEFO). To meet the rising demand for his clothing, he is planning to open another shop adjacent of the current one. The current shop has a small displaying surface, making it difficult to display all samples of clothes in stock. The new shop will help him keep enough stock of clothes so that he will no longer go out of stock on a frequent basis and add the display surface he needs.

loans.use: ADDING STOCK OF CLOTHES

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in Makangarawe  area of  Dar es Salaam.She is married with three children.Two are in primary school and one is in secondary school.Hawa owns a shop selling different consumable items,especially food .She plans to expand her business by adding a stock of Cereals,Maize Flour,Beans,Rice,Millet,Cassava Flour and Groundnuts.Limited with her narrow capital base,Hawa fails to cope with demand from her clients.She sees this as a lost opportunity,which need to be utilized.She is in  need USD 550 to facilitate her plan.

loans.use: ADDING STOCK OF CEREALS,MAIZE FLOUR,BEANS,RICE,MILLET,CASSAVA FLOUR AND GROUNDNUTS

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
For two years, Raúl M. has been the owner of an electronics repair shop in which he fixes televisions, stereos, and household appliances. He is a very hardworking, entrepreneurial person. He is requesting a loan of $1200.00 to buy replacement electronic parts and tools. He plans to pay back the amount over the period of one year.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Raúl M. cuenta desde hace 2 años con un taller de electrónica en el cual arregla televisores, stereos y aparatos electrodomesticos, el es una persona muy emprendedora solicita un préstamo para compra de refacciones y herramientas, el importe que el esta solicitando es por $1200.00 Dllrs los cuales piensa pagar en un año.

loans.use: Buy electronic parts and tools.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Martínez has owned a carpentry shop for more than 2 years, and business has gone very well. This year he plans to grow his business and in order to do this he would like to buy new machinery so he can provide better services to his clients. He is requesting $1200.00, which he plans to pay back within a period of one year.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Víctor Martínez, cuenta con una carpintería desde hace mas de 2 años y en la cual a funcionado muy bien pero dentro de sus proyectos de este año esta el de crecer por lo que piensa adquirir nueva maquinaria para asi poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes el solicita $1200.00 Dllrs y piensa pagarlos en un plazo de 1 año.

loans.use: Buy machinery.

loans.name: Suepasi

texts.en: Suepasi is a married lady with 7 children, all attending district schools due to cheaper of school fees. With her first loan in January 2004, she has developed her taro plantation, which is their main source of income that is financing her children’s education. She can now also afford to bring her children to the National Hospital in town where her children are been given good medications that are not available in the village. Suepasi’s husband is her right hand with the business, he’s the one responsible for selling taro twice a week, mainly on Friday and Saturday.

loans.use:
Buy chemicals, weed killer and fertilizer.       
Home Improvement

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
ITA M.

Mrs M. is married with 5 children.She started with the $100 loan to start a business of Elei and Printing materials.She has the talent of printing, and thinking of having a business but she’s lack of finance support to start with.Since she joined SPBD, then she got a big help in starting her business by buying paintings, clitters, materials and upeti (woods which already printed to lie on the materials for printings).She used to sell puletasi, t-shirts, ie-lavalava(printed materials) at flea markets and also for people who travel overseas.She’s also got help for house improvement, like repairing the roof of her house and add some space at the back of it.So, for her next loan which is $650 she need to build a special room for running her business and buy more stuffs like clitters which is the most expensive equipment and printed woods for the particular business.She is still happy to join to the SPBD program in the future, because she believed it helped her the most in financial support of her family.

loans.use: Buy paintings,clitters,materials & printed woods.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married. He makes his living in the small electrical appliance trade. Sergey’s entrepreneurial talent and sociable nature have been a real help as he’s started his own business. Currently he offers a variety of household electric appliances, fans, heaters, blenders, wiring accessories, electrical switches, etc. After becoming a client of “Nadiya Ukraine”, his business has seen considerable growth. Financial assistance from “Nadiya Ukraine” has given Sergey an opportunity to purchase a spacious pavilion where he stores and sells his inventory. Currently Sergey’s net sales profit amounts to 40% which helps create stable expansion for his business. A cheerful disposition and active position in life have helped him succeed in business and find his market niche. Sergey is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase electric devices and a variety of associated components. The favorable location of his business in one of the busy local markets and a wide range of high-quality electric equipment help attract many potential customers. Sergey also has a hobby – he’s a beekeeper. It’s a rewarding hobby for him. Not only do the bees produce honey and beeswax, but they serve as pollinators for crops grown in the local area. He is planning to re-invest profits gained from selling electric devices into his bee farming.

Сергій - одружений. На життя він заробляє торгівлею електричними приладами. Підприємницький талант та жвавість характеру Сергія завжди допомагали йому в бізнесі. В кіоску Сергія можна знайти різноманітні побутові електричні прилади, вентилятори, обігрівачі, змішувачі, електромонтажну арматуру, перемикачі тощо. Після того як Сергій став клієнтом „Надії України”, його бізнес суттєво зріс. Фінансова підтримка надала Сергію можливість придбати просторий павільйон, в якому він зберігає та продає товари. Чистий прибуток Сергія становить 40%, а це дуже позитивно відбивається на зростанні його бізнесу. Життєрадісна вдача та активна позиція допомогли йому досягти успіху в бізнесі та знайти свою нішу на ринку. Сергій просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати електричні приладі та різні додаткові запчастини. Вигідне розташування його бізнесу на місцевому ринку та широкий вибір високоякісного електричного обладнання обов’язково приваблять потенційних покупців. В Сергія також є хобі – він бджоляр. Це дуже корисне заняття. Бджоли не тільки виробляють мед та віск, але й ще виконують функцію місцевих запильників врожаїв. Отже Сергій планує використати гроші, які отримає від продажу електричних приладів, для того, щоб розводити бджіл.

loans.use: To increase inventory
